loans.name: Force Plus Group

texts.en:
“Force Plus” is a community bank of 25 owners of small businesses chaired by Yalele. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Yalele has been selling second hand clothing since 1985. Besides that, she also sells plastic items and handbags. Over the years, her business prospered through determination and hard work, and she has been able to build a loyal customer base that has stabilized her business. With good management and savings, Yalele has been able to increase her working capital today. Her business generates US$150 per week. She is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having three times obtained and correctly repaid loans. Yalele will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by buying two bundles of second hand clothing and reselling them at a profit.She is confident with her business and she is determined to someday open a modern restaurant. Yalele is 53 years old, married, and the mother of six children between 8 and 35. All of them go to school.

loans.use: to purchase two bundles of second hand clothing to resell at profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ligia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Ligia habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, su esposo sus planes a futuro son mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y con eso ha hido construyendo su casa, con este nuevo credito Ligia comprara: Piedra cantera, Cemento, un Viaje de Piedrin, un viaje de Arena, Hierro. con esto podra construir gran parte de su vivienda.
Espera continuar recibiendo el apoyo de Afodenic quien a travez de Fondo Kiva ayuda a personas que necesitan mejorar de vida.
texts.en: Ligia lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband.  Her plan for the future is to improve her living conditions.  She sells clothes and with this has been building her house.  Ligia will use this new loan to buy paving stones, cement, a truckload of gravel, a truckload of sand and metal with which she will be able to build a large part of her house.  She hopes to continue receiving support from Afodenic who through Kiva funds helps people who need to improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Sara Paulina

texts.es:
Sara tiene 28 años de edad, es madre de 2 pequeños de 8 y 6 años a quienes ama muchísimo y por quienes da la vida con tal de darle una vida digna y con mucho amor. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad muy activa, debido a la afluencia de turistas que visitan a diario las milenarias Líneas de Nazca, son dibujos inmensos ubicados en un extenso campo de tierra árida y que según algunos estudios sirvieron como un calendario astronómico para la cultura Nazca; asimismo se desarrolla mucho la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, tuna, cochinilla, pallares, frejoles, entre otros.  Sara en su tiempo libre disfruta de de leer un poco y sobre todo comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “pollo al horno”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el nivel primario pero le hubiera gustado mucho terminar la escuela.

Con mucho entusiasmo Sara trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas en su pequeño triciclo, ella trabaja alrededor de 12 horas diarias; ella cree que le  va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante y darle lo mejor a sus hijos.

Sara está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como golosinas en especial chocolates, chizito, cheetos, entre otros; así de esta manera tendrá mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a su clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Tener una bodega en casa y poder darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Sara, 28, is the mother of two little ones who are 8 and 6 years old who she loves very much and would give her life in order to provide them with a proper life filled with love.  Her house is located in the city of Nazca, a very busy city because of the large number of tourists who come by daily to visit the age-old Nazca Lines which are immense drawings located on a vast field of arid land which according to some studies were used as an astronomic calendar by the Nazca culture.  Much agriculture also is carried out here especially cotton, prickly pears, cochineal, white beans and broad beans, among others.  In her free time, Sara likes to read a little and above all to eat one of her favorite dishes, the delicious “Pollo al Horno.”  Because of her parents’ limited economic resources she only went to elementary school but would have liked very much to have completed her schooling.

With much enthusiasm, Sara works in her small business selling snacks in a three-wheeled cart.  She works about 12 hours daily and believes that she does well because she’s kind to her customers and above all because she strives very much to get ahead and provide the best for her children.

Sara is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy merchandise for her business like snacks, especially chocolate, puffed cheese snacks and Cheetos, among others.  In this way, she will have more variety of products to offer her customers and will improve her income which will allow her to continue working to make her greatest dream a reality: to have a home-based store and to give her son a good education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: La socia Judith sigue participando en el banco comunal “Luz del Sur”, tiene una relación  de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. La socia Judith es técnico en reparación de refrigeradoras y tiene un pequeño taller pero el local es alquilado. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad la socia Judith requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo cables, motores, termóstatos y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
The member, Judith, is still participating in the communal bank "Luz del Sur." She is in a common-law marriage from which she has two children. 

Judith is a refrigerator repair technician and she has a small workshop, but the space is rented. She has worked in this business for ten years already, and it's going very well. 

At this time, Judith needs a loan to buy work materials like, for example, cables, motors, thermostats, and more.

loans.use: to buy work materials like, for example, cables, motors, thermostats, and more.

loans.name: Aayed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 50 years old, married, and has three children.

Aayed has owned a grocery store since 2011, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, snacks, detergents, and other products. He has  sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers.  He knows about their demands. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to buy a refrigerator for juices and to install a shop window.  He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for juices and install a shop window.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 26-year-old married woman. She has three children, ranging from five years to nine years. She describes herself to be a determined and diligent woman.

Monica operates a farm and a dairy farm where she sells produce such as potatoes and tomatoes.  She has been involved in this business for 18 years. Her business is located in an area with favorable weather, and her primary customers are local residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Margaret plans to use the KES 10,000 loan on buying three sheep to rear and sell.  Her business goal is to improve her business of dairy farming by buying more cows within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a six-acre land with profits generated from the business.

loans.use: to buy three sheep to raise on her farm.

loans.name: Dashurije

texts.en:
Dashurije is a 30-year-old Ashkali woman living in a Ashkali community in Kosovo. She is married, and she has three children. This wonderful and loving family lives in unacceptable conditions. They live in a small village, and during the rainy season and winter time, they have a serious problem with the roof, windows, and doors. 

Dashurije requests a loan to buy windows and door frames to renovate her house and improve the living conditions for her family.

The main source of income comes from her husband, who is working as a taxi driver. He transports goods, such as wood and furniture, for local members of the community.  

Dashurije is grateful to KosInvest lenders for improving the family's conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: To buy windows and door frames to renovate her house

loans.name: Maymoun

texts.en:
Maymoun, a 22-year-old youth client from Iraq, is single and lives with his family. Since 2010 Maymoun has owned a shop selling perfumes and women’s cosmetics. With good experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge about their needs, he has a good reputation and is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Maymoun is requesting a $3000 youth loan to buy an air conditioner and window closet. He is aiming to develop his business and increase his profits in order to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner and window closet.

loans.name: Chrispine

texts.en:
Chrispine is a married father who always works hard to give his two children all they need. For the past three years Chrispine has been selling games and movies, having moved to Kisauni from Mombasa to pursue better job prospects. He says that he does very well and feels happy. His business success is due to the support of his neighbors and friends.

Chrispine is requesting this loan to buy games and movie tapes so that he can continue working to give his family all that they need. He is grateful for the help since it will be of great benefit to him.

loans.use: to buy games and movie tapes for his business.

loans.name: Paskalia

texts.en: Paskalia is a 34-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 18 years. She describes herself as a determined and aggressive woman. She operates a dairy farm and a farm where she sells milk, maize, beans, tomatoes etc. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in an area with fertile soil and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy vegetable and cereal seeds. Her business goal is to improve her business into a double turnover within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be a large scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy vegetable and cereal seeds.

loans.name: Angel Orlando

texts.es:
Ángel es un hombre de 29 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene muchos deseos por salir adelante y apoyar a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Mecánica, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus hermanos y amigos, y en algunas de estas ocasiones aprovechan para comer un riquísimo Pollo a la Brasa.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Ángel trabaja como chofer de taxi y adicionalmente brinda servicios de movilidad escolar, él dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y puede atender a un promedio de 45 cliente, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien debido a su trato amable y respetuoso hacia los demás.
Ángel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de una habitación en un pequeño terreno que su padre le dejo como herencia; de esta manera Ángel podrá dar inicio a la construcción de lo que en un futuro será su vivienda, así poco a poco gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo espera poder culminar la construcción total de su hogar.
texts.en:
Angel is a 29 years old, single, and lives in the city of Ica.  He is a very friendly and enthusiastic worker who is eager to get ahead and support his family. Unfortunately, due to the need to work and address expenses, he could not pursue a professional career, but he would very much have liked to pursue a career in mechanical engineering. In his spare time he enjoys playing soccer with his brothers and friends, and on some of these occasions he takes advantage of the opportunity to eat a delicious Pollo a la Brasa or Roasted Chicken.

With much effort and enthusiasm, Angel works every day as a taxi driver and also provides school transportation services.  He works at this business approximately 12 hours per day and he serves an average of 45 clients. He feels comfortable with his work and believes that things are going well due to his kind and respectful treatment of others.  

Angel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered he will be able to construct a room in a small plot of land his father left him as an inheritance. In this way Angel can begin construction of what at a future date will be his home.  Thus, little by little thanks to his work and effort, he hopes to be able to finish the construction of his whole house.

loans.use: to complete construction of one room.

loans.name: Sherine

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is a youth client who is 27 years old. She is single and lives with her family.

Sherine has a women's beauty salon. She just opened her business, but she has good experience in this field since she worked in a beauty salon for 5 years before opening her business. She also has a deep understanding of the local customers and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation, and she is becoming well-known in the surrounding areas.

She is requesting $2,400 as a youth loan to buy some shaving equipment and make-up. She is aiming to grow her business and develop her skills so she will be able to better provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy some shaving equipment and make-up

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder realizar la compra de leña y de maíz, que son los necesarios para que ella continúe elaborando la venta de las tortillas, ella manifiesta a través de los préstamos es cómo ha logrado tener una fuente permanente de ingresos que le cubra las necesidades de su familia.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener la ayuda para el mejoramiento de la vivienda y asimismo la compra de maíz y leña para continuar en el negocio, está muy agradecida pues considera que a través de este aporte cuenta con vivienda en mejor condición más segura en el invierno, protegída de cualquier incidente ocasionado por las lluvias.
texts.en:
Cecilia is requesting a new loan to be able to buy firewood and corn, items she needs to continue preparing and selling tortillas. She says that it is thanks to the loans that she has succeeded in getting a permanent source of income to provide for her family’s necessities.

Her previous loan has helped her making improvements to her house, on top of allowing her to buy corn and firewood to carry on with her activity. She is deeply grateful because she thinks that thanks to this support she can now live in a better house, safer in the winter as it is now protected from any incident caused by heavy rains.

loans.use: To buy firewood and corn.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi, 43, lives with her husband, Chaka, in Samburu. She has five children. She has been operating a kiosk for the last three years, selling a variety of products. Chizi has an excellent group of customers who buy from her on credit and make their payments punctually. She has been building up her customer base gradually, evaluating them based on their potential and ability to pay.
 
Chizi is always attentive to how the market moves, so that she can offer the best products at the lowest prices. Her goal for the future is to have her own retail shop with a great diversity of products to make a positive impact on her customers, while she serves them and generates income.

At this time, Chizi is applying for a Kiva loan so that she can buy sugar and bags of wheat and maize flour to meet her clients' needs.  This way, she is able to manage financial sustainability for her business and generate more and more income, which benefits her personal well-being and that of her family.

loans.use: To buy sugar and bags of wheat and maize flour

loans.name: Jorge Heberto

texts.es: Jorge Heberto, de 37 años de edad, soltero con dos hijos menores, tiene por herramienta de trabajo la venta de leña y leche, la cual lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion, experiencia que tiene en el negocio, ocho años, el inico con esfuerzo propio esta actividad para poder tener un ingreso para su familia, hoy en dia ha properado grancias al apoyo que leon 2000 y el programa kiva le brinda a los pequeños comerciantes para poder tener una herramienta de trabajo propia y digno medio de trabajo,del financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en el negocio y comercializar el producto como: compra leña, compra leche para comercializarla dia a dia .
texts.en: Jorge Heberto is 37 years old, he is single and he has two young children. He has been selling wood and milk from his house for eight years, and he has started this activity thanks to his own efforts in order to earn some money for his family. He has been able to prosper thanks to the support granted by Fundación Leon 2000 and to the Kiva program to small retailers so that they can run their own activity in a dignified way. The loan he is requesting will be invested in his activity by purchasing his products – wood and milk – to sell them on a daily basis.

loans.use: To buy wood and milk.

loans.name: Lumnije

texts.en:
Lumnije is 41 years old. She lives in a village with her family: her husband and four children. Her children go to school. Lumnije spends most of her time taking care of her home and working on her business of raising livestock and selling milk in the area.

She has been doing this for four years, and it has been going very well due to the great effort that she puts into her business every day. 

Lumnije has requested a loan to purchase a milking cow. She plans to expand her dairy farm through adding more cows. She will be able to double her production and sales, and the income of her family will significantly increase. 

With the increased income, she will be able to create better living conditions for her children.

She is grateful to KosInvest lenders for improving her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Hafiz

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 47 years old, married and has 8 children.

Hafiz has owned a shoe shop since 2009, selling women's and men’s shoes. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge about their demands. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to decorate the shop and increase inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to decorate his shoe shop and increase inventory

loans.name: Berna

texts.en: Berna is married with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling green bananas and has been selling bananas for 5 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more bunches of bananas. Besides this banana business, she generates additional income through hiring out a bodaboda (bicycle or motorbike taxi). She works seven days a week and works from her home. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She aspires to seeing her business grow big so that she can start going to villages to sell green bananas and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school rent and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 38 and married with five children, with the first four already in school. He lives with his family in their rural home in Litein, South Rift, Kenya where he carries out farming and sells mainly tea and milk to the local market. He currently runs his farm with the help of two farmhands.

Benard has made a loan request of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy a chuff cutter. He says this will ease the process of feeding his cows. He plans to buy more land in the future to create room for his growing number of cows.

Benard, however, notes that feeding animals still remains a challenge but he expects to manage it effectively.

loans.use: to buy a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Natek

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 23 years old who is single and lives with his family members.

Natek has owned a food market since 2010, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their demands. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3,000 Youth Loan to decorate the shop and purchase more goods. He is aiming to gain more profits which will offer a better standard of living for his whole family.

loans.use: to decorate the shop and purchase more goods.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 34 years old. She is a very hard-working person who lives with her husband and five dependent children. Like all responsible mothers, Alice has had to work very hard to get ahead in life. She is a very kind and positive woman. 

Alice has been operating a motorcycle taxi business for over five years in which she has hired someone to operate the motorcycle. Alice is requesting a loan to invest in another motorcycle to meet the increasing demand for services, since her motorcycle operates in rural areas where there are no vehicles. She hopes that this will make her more profits. This would be of great benefit to her children and her household.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 33 years old, single, and the mother of one child. She runs a boutique business in which she sells a variety of items like shoes, umbrellas, and ladies' clothes. She has been in this business for two years, earning a monthly income of 8,500 KES. 

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use it to purchase umbrella, clothes, and shoes for the business.

She plans to use the anticipated profit to purchase a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of shoes, umbrellas, and clothes to sell

loans.name: Dory

texts.es: La Sra. Dory tiene 56 años tiene 2 hijos que son de las edades de 12, y 15 años,  ella se dedica  a la  venta y  crianza de cerdos en la localidad de Rio Seco, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Dory va a usar este préstamo para la compra de cerdos para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de cerdos, la Sra. Dory enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad en la alimentación de sus cerdos,  su deseo es poder tener una granja donde pueda criar cantidad de cerdos para que de esta manera pueda mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Sra. Dory is 56 years old and has two children aged 12 and 15. She earns her living raising and selling pigs in the town of Rio Sec. This loan will be her first with this organization. She will use the money to buy pigs for her business as she does not have enough capital of her own to do this. 

Sra. Dory will use the profit from her business to improve the quality of feed she gives the pigs. Her goal is to own a farm where she can raise pigs and in this way have greater economic stability.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 28 years old. She is married, and she lives with her husband and two children in Ashkali community in Kosovo. Six years ago, they returned fro Germany, where they had lived for many years. To earn a living, four years ago, her husband opened a Car Wash. 

The car wash is located alongside the highway. The business is one of the better known ones in their town because of the good service they give the cars. Many of their customers comment that in their business service to customers and attention paid to the cars is very good, so they always come back to their wash cars.

Violeta requests a loan for her husband to purchase supplies for her husband's auto wash and pay for service on the machine. 

In the future they want to increase the capacity of their business, so they can satisfy clients and meet the demand for car washes and in this way gain more interested clients.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her husband's auto wash and pay for service on the machine.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin has been married for several years. He and his wife have one child, who is still too young for school.

He has set up a retail store in his house, which is located in a strategic place in town. He says he started with a little capital that he got from the other job he had done previously as a salaried worker. 

He is requesting the loan to buy basic needs products to stock his store. He will buy things like rice, noodles, sugar, and others. He is grateful for the help that he is receiving. It is a great growth opportunity for him.

loans.use: to buy things like rice, noodles, sugar, and others.

loans.name: Langat

texts.en:
Langat is a resident of Litein in Litein, South Rift, Kenya and says that farming is his source of income that helps him meet his family needs for the last three years. His farm produce includes tea and maize. 

Langat has requested a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds for a venture into the poultry business. He adds that the income will also boost his transport business which was his major business prior to taking up full-time dairy farming.

Langat, however, notes that lack of enough feeds, especially for dairy cows, is a major challenge, but believes the poultry business will mitigate any potential adverse loss in dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 29 years old and married with two children. She has operated a boutique business, where sells both ladies' clothes and shoes, for the last two years earning a monthly income of 33,000 shillings.

This will be her second loan with KADET LTD and she plans to purchase more stock of clothes and shoes for sale. She plans to use the anticipated profit to invest back into her business. 

She hopes to expand the business and improve her family's standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married and has two children who are already grown. Mariam started her food market more than 20 years ago. Thanks to their perseverance and commitment, Mariam and her husband were able to nurture their two children. Their children are now adults and each one has a job.

As a result of Mariam's good service and friendliness, along with help from her family, her business is improving with each moment. Her goals are to continue working, to feel useful, and to move forward. Mariam needs a loan to buy rice, noodles, and baked goods to restock her business, since these are the products that sell the most. She and her husband are grateful for the help they have received and view it as a good opportunity to make progress.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, and baked goods

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a single mother of three children and only one of her children goes to school. She has a business selling charcoal and sells to all categories of people on retail. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She has been in this charcoal business for ten years. She works at the market and works six days a week. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. Her major business challenges include transportation, thieves, and seasonality. She aspires to become a wholesaler, to get a delivery van to ease in transportation, and to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and no piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Mwaka from the town of Samburu, located in the Coastal region of Kenya. She is married with 8 children between the ages of 6 and 20 years; six currently attend school. She also has one relative at home.

Mwaka runs a kiosk selling a variety of consumer products. She has been running this business for 5 years, working 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Mwaka also earns income from small-scale farming in the village. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation costs and price inflation.

Mwaka has requested a loan of KES 20,000 through Yehu in order to buy more general stock such as flour, sugar, rice, and beans. The extra income from this loan will allow her to renovate her house and educate her children. In the future, she plans to own a wholesale. Mwaka appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more general stock such as flour, sugar, rice, and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Evance

texts.en:
Evance is the owner of a store, where he sells all kinds of agricultural products. He has worked in this business for more than 1 year and so he already has a loyal customer base that always buys products from him.

His wife works as a businesswoman and sell household products. In this way, they help each other to get ahead. Evance is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person with great hopes of progressing and getting ahead.

He is requesting the loan to buy green vegetables and more supplies to stock his business and to be able to offer good quality to his customers.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables and more supplies.

loans.name: Petrit

texts.en:
Petrit is a single man living with his parents. He started his career three years ago working construction and as a painter decorator. He works on a freelance basis with multiple projects, and he is working for a lot of clients in his area.

He is applying for a loan from KosInvest to purchase a machine for flooring. He needs equipment in order to build a good business reputation and satisfy his customers.

With his business income, he is able to help his father with the family expenses. Petrit is very ambitious and he intends to work harder to enhance the family’s way of living and help them meet their needs.

loans.use: to purchase a machine for flooring.

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es: Felix Antonio de 54, años de edad, soltero con un hijo de la localidad de leon, tiene  por actividad  economica  el servicio de taller  de reparacion de vehiculos, el cual tiene 23 años de experiencia, actividad la inicio desde muy joven ya que es de familia con escasos recursos y necesitaba tener un medio para sobrevivir, el la actualidad a podido salir adelante con su oficio gracia a su responsablidad y dedicacion, el financiamiento lo esta solicitando para invertir en el negocio  y darle mejores condiciones y atencion a su clientela el necesita comprar : llantas, soldador, motores, desarmadores, focos, carroceria de vehiculo, entre otros.
texts.en: Felix Antonio is 54 years old, he is single and he has one child. He comes from Leon, and he has been running a vehicles repair shop for 23 years. Coming from a very poor family, he started his activity when he was very young as he needed an income to survive. He has been able to progress in his job thanks to his responsibility and commitment. The loan he is requesting will be used to invest it in the shop in order to tend to his customers in a better way and in a better environment; for this reason he needs to buy tires, engines, hammers, headlights, bodyworks and other items.

loans.use: To buy tires, engines, hammers, headlights and bodyworks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy secondhand clothing

loans.name: Los Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal LOS EMPRENDEDORES; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Aydee alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como colonias, perfumes, cremas entre otros, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a sus amistades y familiares, la socia a la vez trabaja en una empresa privada de supervisora, la socia trabaja de lunes a viernes durante el dia, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de colonias para su negocio.

Los otros socios se dedican a la ganadería, venta de productos de belleza, trabajan en empresas privadas, estudiantes universitarios.

Las personas que salen adjuntas en la foto son socios que pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Aydee belongs to the communal bank LOS EMPRENDEDORES, which is situated in the district of Wanchaq in the department of Cusco.  She has a business selling beauty products such as colognes, perfumes, creams and other items.  She sells her products from door to door to her friends and relatives.  She also is employed as a supervisor in a private company, where she works from Monday through Friday during business hours.  She is a very responsible and diligent person and his highly motivated to keep working for her family.

She is seeking this loan so that she can buy colognes for her business.  The other members of the communal bank sell beauty products, raise livestock, and work in private companies.  Some are university students. The people in the small photograph in the corner are members who asked for permission to come late to the meeting for work-related reasons.

Aydee is grateful for the loan opportunity and promises to repay her loan according to the agreed-upon schedule.

loans.use: to purchase colognes for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and lives in Likoni. She has made her living selling clothing for more than 4 years. She has a well-established clientele, which is a great help. She has been a client of Yehu Microfinance since last year, and thanks to the help she has received from them, she has been able to keep her business growing.
Margaret has a boutique in which she sells new clothing and footwear. In addition, she has added ice cream sales and sells cell phone cards from all the cellular companies.
She is requesting the loan to purchase jeans, t-shirts, footwear, and blouses, which will all help her to stock her business and to continue filling her customers' requests.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, t-shirts, footwear, and blouses.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is from Likoni, Mombasa. She is married and has eight children; six attend school while two are adults and work independently. Mwanalima's business is buying and selling vegetables. She makes her sales to a neighboring community and in Likoni town market. She tells us that she has an established customer base which helps her to make a very good income and thereby help her family.

Mwanalima is requesting a loan to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, onions, etc. She tells us that this will enable her to stock up and have a larger variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, onions, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 42 years old and married with four children. She runs a farm products business. She has been in this business for three years, earning a monthly income of nine thousand shillings.

This will be her second loan from KADET LTD and she plans to purchase farm inputs and seedlings. She plans to use the anticipated profit to invest back into her business and be financially stable. 

She hopes to be a horticultural farmer in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seedlings.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
With her previous credit Kiva loan, Everline bought more stocks of rice, cooking fat, potatoes, and wheat flour that she sold, increasing her working capital slightly. Now she is applying for a new credit Kiva loan, because her sellers have requested more products, as they have an established clientele, and Everline's working capital is insufficient to meet the growth in demand.

Her credit Kiva loan will be successful because she will respond to demand by buying bundles of wheat flour, riceand sugar at a good price. Everline tells the lenders that her credit Kiva loans have been very useful to her. She says thank you, and may they continue helping her.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of wheat flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Henry Norberto

texts.es:
Henry es un joven muy activo, sigue laborando como técnico eléctrico en una empresa privada, para él, la mejora a su casa es el objetivo, ya que tiene a dos hijas que requieren mucho cuidado.
Ha venido mejorando su casa, con préstamo, siendo más viable para él, al ser ah aplazo, hoy con este nuevo financiamiento construirá la cocina en la parte de afuera, tendiendo mejor espacio de sala, ya que tiene dividido una parte para la cocina y desea mejorar la higiene de su hogar, siendo de gran necesidad, materiales a comprar: cemento, hierro, bloques, arena y otros materiales para comenzar.
texts.en:
Henry is a very active young man who works as an electrical technician for a private company.  An important goal for him is to improve his house, since he has two daughters who require a lot of care.  

He has already been working on his home, and this loan will make it easier for him to be able to build an addition to his home which will become his new kitchen, and to do this on a timely basis.  His current kitchen has been divided and is partially used for living space; this project will thus improve the hygiene in his home, which is very important.  He will use the loan to buy cement, steel, cinder blocks, sand and other materials that he needs in order to get started.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a kitchen for his house.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: La Sra. Jenny tiene 41 años y es Casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 18 y 22 años, la Sra. Jenny se dedica a la  Venta de calzados y productos de belleza en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la zona San Juan Macias,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución la Sra. Jenny utilizara este préstamo para la compra de mercadería como zapatos y cosméticos por mayor y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es diversificar sus productos para así brindar mayor variedad a su clientela, la Sra. Jenny enfrenta retos en su negocio que son La Competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir  incrementando su capital de trabajo, esta es su única fuente de ingresos con la que mantiene a su familia por esta razón se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Jenny is 41 years old and married with two children aged 18 and 22. She sells footwear and beauty products from her stall in the San Juan Macias area. This loan will be her second with the organization. She plans to use the money for working capital to buy goods such as shoes and cosmetics at wholesale prices. Her aim is to diversify into different products and provide her customers with more variety. The challenge Jenny faces is competition. 

She is going to use the profit to continue increasing her working capital. The business is her sole source of income to provide for her family. For this reason she is very grateful to the organization for the support it provides.

loans.use: Buy footwear and beauty products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old and married. She runs a horticultural business. She has been in this business for six years, earning a monthly income of 33,500 Kenyan shillings.

This her second loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use it to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for growing tomatoes. She plans to use the anticipated profit to buy a piece of land for development. She hopes to construct rental houses in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for growing tomatoes.

loans.name: Nohelia

texts.es: La socia Nohelia sigue participando en el banco comunal “Luz del Sur” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella sigue con el negocio de venta de jugos de diferentes frutas como papayas, piñas y otras frutas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas como papayas, platanos, piña, naranjas, azúcar y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Nohelia is continuing to participate in the communal bank “Luz del Sur”.  She is a responsible member of the bank and is very punctual with her loan repayments.  She is continuing to sell fruit juices made from papayas, pineapples and other types of fruit.  She has worked in the business for several years, and things are going very well.

She is seeking this loan in order to buy fruits such as papayas, bananas, pineapples and oranges, as well as sugar and other items.

loans.use: to buy fruits such as papayas, bananas, pineapples and oranges, as well as sugar and other items.

loans.name: Kumrije

texts.en:
Kumrije is 30 years old and married. She has three children; all three of them attend primary school. They live in a village not far from a major city. 
Kumrije has been in the livestock business for a long time. She has been selling milk to neighboring dairy farms. 

She loves what she does and is committed to it. 

She is aware that without KosInvest support, her goal will be difficult to achieve. For the second time, she is requesting a loan to buy a cow to expand her business. Kumrije is very appreciative of KosInvest for the help.

She is hoping to grow her business and save for her youngest child’s education expenses.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Meswaleh

texts.en:
Meswaleh is married and has two children and they live in Likoni. Meswaleh has had a clothing sales business for more than 7 years in a strategically located spot in Likoni. She sells assorted articles of clothing like shirts, t-shirts, pants, sandals, and belts for cash and on credit. Thanks to her sacrifice, she’s getting ahead and also helping her husband with everyday expenses.

She’s asking for the loan to increase her stock of clothing because sales always increase starting mid-year and she wants to be prepared in the best way possible to provide her customers with quality and a variety of national and imported clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam has been able to sell fast food products thanks to her previous Kiva loan, with which she bought sacks of beans, maize flour and rice in large quantities. Currently she is applying for a new Kiva loan which she will use to buy raw materials and supplies, expecting an increase in products. She can benefit from buying them with cash and in larger quantities than usual. She sends the following message to the Kiva backers: "I am very grateful for the financing of my business since you have given me the opportunity to increase my production and my income."

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
Camila es una joven muy trabajadora y estudiosa, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo en esta ciudad podemos apreciar la “Laguna de Huacachina”, la cual se encuentra en medio de maravillosas dunas y sobre todo recibe a muchos turistas en todo el año, se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, paprika, entre otros. Cuando Camila tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho leer y sobre todo estudiar ya que ella se encuentra estudiando la carrera de derecho y ya va por el cuarto año.

Con mucho entusiasmo Camila trabaja en una empresa de comida rapida ya que con su trabajo puede costear sus estudios de derecho y apoyar en algunos gastos de su hogar, ella trabaja alrededor de 5 horas al día ya que por las noches va a su universidad, ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque realiza su trabajo con gusto.

Camila está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá pagar de manera adelantada sus cursos universitarios para no atrasarse en su maestría, así ella no tendrá inconvenientes con sus estudios y de esta manera seguirá estudiando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y una carrera”.
texts.en:
Camila is a very hardworking and studious young woman. She lives in the town of Ica, famous for its hot and welcoming climate all year round; the Huacachina Lagoon is also there, located among wonderful dunes, and it attracts an infinite number of tourists all year round. Agriculture is the main activity, growing particularity cotton, grapes, asparagus and paprika. Whenever Camila has some free time, she loves reading and above all studying, as she is currently attending Law, and she is in her fourth year.

With great enthusiasm Camila works in a fast food company, a job thanks to which she can pay for her law studies and help paying for some of her family’s expense. She works around 5 hours a day, going to university in the evenings. She thinks her job is going well for her because she is very responsible and above all because she loves doing her job.

Camila is deeply grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help she will be able to pay in advance for her university classes and she will not stay back in her course, thus avoiding problems with her studies. In this way she will keep on studying in order to make her biggest dream come true: “To have a house of her own and to pursue a career”.

loans.use: To pay for university classes.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is 28 years old and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past five years, Walid has been working hard to manage his small business which sells phone accessories. 

To help expand his business, he has requested a youth loan of 350,000 YER from AMB. The loan will be used to purchase more phone accessories for resale and will help him to generate greater profits. He hopes that in the future he will be able to open other phone accessory businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more phone accessories for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma has been able to sell many fast food products thanks to her previous Kiva loan with which she bought raw materials and supplies such as wheat flour and maize flour.  Currently she is applying for a new Kiva loan which she will use to purchase rice, oil, potatoes and cereals in large quantities. She can benefit from buying them with cash and in larger quantities than usual. She is very grateful for the financing she received from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance for giving her the opportunity to increase production and income.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, potatoes and cereals in large quantities

loans.name: Consolatah

texts.en:
Consolatah is 40 years old, married to Silvanus and blessed with five children. For the past six years, she has run a fish selling business, earning a monthly income of about 10,000 KES.

With her first loan of 20,000 KES from Yehu, she intends to purchase additional stock of fish, firewood and cooking oil.

She intends to use the profits gained to reinvest and diversify the business. Her future plans are to open a retail shop.

She lives with her family in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She hopes to earn some profits and construct her own house.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fish, firewood and cooking oil

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married and a mother; she has four children all attending school, who are Halima’s reason to strive. She’s from Likoni, Mombasa. She currently has a well-established clientele in the zone and her clothing orders increase accordingly. Thanks to her effort and dedication she has been able to build a little house for herself. She also continues running an open food stall to earn her additional income.

She’s asking for the loan to buy shirts, t-shirts, shorts, and other clothes that are in season and that her customers ask her for a lot. She is grateful for the support she’s receiving because everything she does is in order to provide her little son with the best.

loans.use: to buy shirts, t-shirts, shorts, and other clothes.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is from Likoni, Mombasa. She is married and has two children. She tells us that she is a saleswoman and also owns a store in the small town of Likoni where she sells all kinds of men's and women's clothing. She lives in her own home and sells her products throughout the village. She tells us that she has been in this business for four years and so she already has some experience.

Halima is requesting this loan to invest in her business because she would like to buy more garments and thereby have a wider variety to sell to her customers. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en: Flavia is married with two children and all her children go to school. She has a business of selling used clothes and sells to all categories of people on retail. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She has been in the clothing business for three years. She works at the market and works six days a week. Her major business challenges include defaulters and seasonality. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and clothing.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a widow and she has 7 children, five who are working and two who are attending elementary school.

Asha started out as a merchant over 4 years ago. She started out with some money she’d saved up working as an employee in a shop for several years. She currently has a large clientele base in the community because of her good service and the variety of products she offers in her store.

She’s asking for the loan to buy soft drinks, flour, oil, sugar, noodles, etc., to stock the store and provide more variety for her customers.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, flour, oil, sugar, and noodles.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a single mother of two children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business of selling secondhand clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She sells to all categories of people at the market on a retail basis and works six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of used clothes. She is aspiring to import used clothes and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina is married with four children and all of her children attend school. She has a business selling secondhand clothes and has been in this clothing business for three years. Madina works six days a week at the market and sells to all categories of people on retail. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Her monthly expenses include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to see her business grow so that she can educate her children up to university. She also aspires to become a wholesaler. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Prudence

texts.en:
Prudence, age 30, is married and has two twin children who are six years old and attending school. She has been operating a grocery store since last year. She sells a variety of fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, bananas, etc. She has established a small place in front of her house. In addition, she sells uteos (plaited baskets or trays used for sifting grain). Her location is a strategic place because a lot of people pass by. This is how she manages to sell her products.

She will use the loan she is requesting to buy more fruits, vegetables, and uteos so as to offer variety to her customers. She will do this to keep her business stocked and to be able to increase her income. Her goal is to make her business grow in order to help her children with their education and to improve the family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, vegetables, and uteos (plaited baskets or trays used for sifting grain).

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is from the town of Likoni. She's married and has three children. She operates a retail shop and owns a store of her own where she sells all types of products, such as garments, household goods, shoes, etc. Aside from that, she makes traveling sales of all kinds of products.

She's a very hardworking, responsible and very honest lady, as her customers comment. Her longtime dream was to work independently, so that she no longer depended on someone else. Through her hard work and dedication, she achieved what she so desired and already has her own store.

She requests the loan in order to purchase charcoal and fried fish so that she can continue to offer her customers the variety to which they are accustomed. She gives thanks for the opportunity she's being given.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and fried fish.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is a single mother of six children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling secondhand shoes and has been in this business for the last seven years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more bales of used clothes. She sells to all categories of people on retail and works at the market seven days a week. Her major business challenges include   thieves and the rainy season, which hinders her customers' ability to reach her. She aspires to import used shoes and also to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is an artisan who carves authentic African masks and wood sculptures. He would like to purchase wood and other raw materials for his work.

George has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

In 1990, George settled in the Akuapim hills to begin training as a carver. By the time he graduated, he had become the real artist he always knew he was. Four years of careful training had not been undertaken for common standards. Not only did George's background knowledge of woodwork help him, but an inbred acumen contrived to bring to the surface a talented carver. He believes in the strengths and aesthetic values of the woods that he and other colleagues transform into works of art. For good reason, he works out many different forms from these materials – sese wood, cedar wood, and tweneboa wood in particular.

"I thank you all for this microcredit, as it will allow me to continue my craft. May God bless you for your help."

Use the link below to view George's hand-carved masks and sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=2329

loans.use: to purchase wood and other raw materials for his work.

loans.name: Javier Martin

texts.es:
Javier es un joven de 22 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposa con la cual tiene 1 pequeño de 2 años de edad a quien quiere mucho y sobre todo trabaja para darle una vida digna llena de ejemplo y amor. Su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Santiago, distrito que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, se cultiva el algodón, uva, esparrago, pallares, frejoles, entre otros, asimismo se encuentran muchas empresas agroexportadoras las cuales brindan muchos puestos de trabajo en el distrito. Javier cuando dispone de un tiempo libre disfruta de jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos de su barrio y también aprovecha en algunas oportunidades para comer uno de sus platillos favoritos, el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo”. Debido s sus pocos recursos económicos el solo tuvo estudios secundario, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar la carrera de ingeniería mecánica.

Día a día Javier trabaja en su pequeño negocio de manejo de tubulares, las cuales son una especie de carros en los cuales se pasean los turistas por las dunas de la laguna de Huacachina, el puede atender diariamente hasta 25 clientes en el día y trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable cuando conduce y sobre todo porque el turismo a aumentado mucho.

Javier está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda ya que va refaccionar su techo que es de esteras y podrá realiza tarrajeo de las paredes, entre otros, de esta manera podrá mejorar su vivienda y darle una mejor calidad de vida para su familia, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y darle una buena educación a su hijos”.
texts.en:
Javier is 22 years old, he lives with his wife and their young child aged 2 whom he loves very much and for whom he works hard so that he can enjoy a life full of good examples and love. His house is located in Santiago, a district famous for its hot and welcoming climate ad for its agriculture, notably growing cotton, grapes, asparagus, beans and lima beans. Various agro-export companies can also be found here, offering many job chances in the district. Whenever he has some free time, Javier loves playing soccer with his friends and neighbors, and he also takes advantage of his free time to eat one of his favorite dishes, the delicious “Arroz con pollo” (rice and chicken). Owing to his meager economic resources, he has succeeded in completing secondary education only, but he would have liked to study Mechanical Engineering.

Javier works day by day running his small activity: he drives tubular dunes buggies, a sort of carts used to drive tourists in the dunes of the Huacachina lagoon. He can daily tend to up to 25 customers, and he works around 10 hours a day. He thinks his job is going well because he is very responsible when driving and above all because tourism has greatly increased.

Javier is deeply grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help he will be able to make improvements to his house. He will repair his roof, now made of straw mats, and he will put tiling on the walls among other works. In this way he will succeed in improving the conditions of his house, providing his family with a better standard of living. This in turn will allow his to keep on working and fighting every day to make his biggest dream come true: “To have a house of his own and to provide a good education to his child”.

loans.use: To make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is married and lives in Likoni. She has made her living selling clothing for more than 4 years. She has a well-established clientele, which is a great help. She has been a client of Yehu since the beginning of the year, and thanks to the help she has received from them, she has been able to keep her business growing.
Sakina has a boutique in which she sells new clothing and Khangas (wrap cloth used by African women). In addition, she operates an open-air food business.
She is requesting the loan to purchase jeans, t-shirts, and blouses and to purchase 40 pieces for Khangas, which will all help her to stock her business and to continue filling her customers' requests.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, t-shirts, and blouses and to purchase 40 pieces for Khangas (wrap cloth used by African women).

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married mother of twins aged 7 years old who go to school. A long-time specialist in the sale of cereals in a small store, Lilian buys her stock at a market in the neighboring town at a cheaper price.
Given her experience, she is requesting assistance from Yehu to better meet the needs of her clientele and to maximize interest in her merchandise.

The profits earned will allow her to provide her children with adequate health care and education and will support her own needs.
Lilian intends to use the requested loan to purchase stocks of maize, beans, and rice for sale.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of maize, beans, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a divorced mother of two children who both attend school. Previously, she worked in the home of a family and gradually she got together the money to open a small business, to be nearer her children. This way she became independent and, thanks to her sales strategy, her business grew.

She is a very hardworking person and she shows it every day working in her small store. Thanks to her hard work, she gives her son everything he needs.

She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of beverages, sugar, and flour. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity it is giving her; this is very important support for her because the loan is her only opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beverages, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar creates realistic sculptures and figurines from gemstones. He would like to stock up on raw materials and also upgrade his stone-cutting tools.

Cesar has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

Cesar has worked as a stone carver since 1988. Cesar works with serpentine, rose manganese, calcite, celestite, red jasper, mottramite, chrysocolla, rhodochrosite and quartz. "I work in stone because of the beautiful things that can be made with each kind," he says. "I like stone's naturalness and purity of color." Of his four children, it is his eldest daughter who has shown the most interest in her father's art and in carrying on his craft.

"Selling my works through NOVICA has elevated my sense of inspiration, motivating me to continue growing as an artist and to develop new designs. My problem is that sometimes it's hard to find good quality stones — every day it seems they are scarcer and more expensive. When I heard about this interest-free microcredit opportunity, I felt a huge relief. Now I won't miss an opportunity to buy good materials. Thank you so much!"

Use the link below to view Cesar's work on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=3600

loans.use: to purchase gemstones in bulk and upgrade his stone-cutting tools.

loans.name: Ummikulthum

texts.en:
Ummikulthum is from Likoni, Mombasa. She is single and has no children. She is very hardworking and responsible, and a very honest lady. According to what she told us, she started out working as a waitress in a restaurant. Her dream has always been to have an eatery and to sell beverages in general at home. Today she has her own business; she has regular clientele and a good income thanks to her work and effort.

Ummikulthum tells us that she wants to continue growing and this is why she always strives and works sunup to sundown and why she’s asking for a loan to buy beverages, meat, condiments, vegetables, and other ingredients for her eatery. She is thankful for the support she’s getting from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance.

loans.use: to buy beverages, meat, condiments, and vegetables.

loans.name: Nyoman

texts.en:
Nyoman specializes in handcrafted sterling silver jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of silver to expand production.

Nyoman has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

Nyoman recalls, "My first exposure to the arts was in elementary school, when I began learning to carve wood. My grandfather, an architect of traditional Balinese buildings and also a senior carver, was very supportive of me. Later, my father introduced me to a leading silversmith in my village, and I began to learn from him." Today, Nyoman makes good use of his wood carving ability, combining it with his silver work to produce a variety of intricate designs.

"A million thanks for your attention and support! This interest-free microcredit will allow me to increase my production capacity, which I hope will translate into increased sales. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Nyoman's sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=3703

loans.use: to purchase silver in bulk and expand production.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 35 years old, married, and lives in Samburu, Kenya. She manages a taxi business where she has hired someone. To look for more alternatives, she decided to open an internet cafe. She provides variety of services such as browsing, printing, etc. She has several years experience.

Elizabeth has already received previous loans from Yehu and has shown herself to be responsible, honest, and of good character. The loans have been very helpful to her in growing her business as she has been able to invest in working capital. She has requested this loan to buy printer paper and toner. She dreams of opening more businesses in the future and to ensure that her three children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy printer paper and toner.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes tiene 30 años, tiene tres hijos. Con ellos, vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la localidad de Yanamarca.  
Hace 4 años emprendió su negocio de compra y venta de verduras, granos y tubérculos. Su madre, quien es su socia, vive en la capital y a quién Lourdes le envía los productos para que los venda allá. “Cada vez que obtengo, una carga de alimentos, le mando a mi madre a la capital para que comercialice”, afirma. En temporadas de cosecha es cuando tiene que aprovechar al máximo, ya que los alimentos cuestan muy poco y pueden obtener más ganancias. Su trabajo es muy bueno, pues es mayorista y reparten a los comerciantes minoristas que llegan a los mercados más grandes del país. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “La rosa de Guadalupe” y este es su sexto crédito con MFP. Agradece el apoyo financiero durante todo estos años, pues pudo administrar su dinero y volverlo productivo. Además, le gusta mucho el trabajo con su banco comunal, por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.  
Lourdes invertirá este dinero en la compra de menestras y verduras, por toneladas, para seguir con su negocio y abastecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 30 years old and has three children.  She lives with them in her parents home which is located in the town of Yanamarca.  

Four years ago she began her business of buying and selling vegetables, grains and tubers.  Her mother, who is her partner, lives in the capital and Lourdes sends her the products so that she can sell them there: "Each time that I obtain an order of foods, I send it to my mother in the capital so that she can sell it," she affirms.  During the harvest season is when she has to take advantage of the opportunities to their maximum, since the foods cost very little and she can obtain a better income.  Her work is very very good, since she purchases in bulk and it is then sold to smaller businesses that arrive at the largest markets in the country.  

She belongs to the communal banking group "La rosa de Guadalupe" and this is her sixth credit with MFP.  She is grateful for the financial support received during all these years, since she was able to administer her money carefully and make it productive.  Besides, she likes the work of the communal bank very much, and thus she promises to be punctual with the repayments of the loan.  

Lourdes will invest this money in the purchase of mixed vegetables and greens, by the ton, in order to continue with her business and to supply her clients.

loans.use: To purchase assorted vegetables and greens by the ton for her business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a 46-year-old married woman. She has 7 children ranging from 13 years old to 28 years old. She describes herself to be a diligent woman. She operates a farm where she sells milk and potatoes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low bargaining power from customers. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy dairy cow feed. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy cow feed.

loans.name: Wayan

texts.en:
Wayan is a master carver from Bali, specializing in wood sculptures. He would like to invest in the purchase of larger quantities of wood to expand production.

Wayan has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

"Most of my family members are carvers, for it is a family legacy that has endured several generations. You could say I was born with a talent to carve, which I developed by merely observing my parents and relatives at work every day. My inspiration comes from Balinese customs and traditions. Competition is tough here in Bali, for there are many expert carvers, making the life of a carver a very uncertain one. It means that I must excel, so hopefully my sculptures will be well received.

"Thanks to all of you who support me with this interest-free microcredit. I really hope these funds can help develop my small carving business by preparing a better stock of sculptures and allowing me to improve sales. My deepest gratitude to you."

Use the link below to view Wayan's wood sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=4352

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of wood and expand his wood carving.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR JUAN TRABAJA EN UNA MAQUILADORA,SU ESPOSA SE DEDICA  ALAS LAVORES DE EL HOGAR Y AL CUIDADO DE SU HIJA QUE SE ENCUENTRA CURSANDO EL PRE ESCOLAR
JUAN TIENE EL DECEO DE PINTAR LA FACHADA DE SU CASA EN EXTERIOIR Y INTERIOR DE SU HOGAR,YA QUE CON ELPASO DEL EL TIEMPO SE A HIDO GASTANDOI YA SE MIRA EN MALAS CONDICIONES.
ASI MISMO ANDOLES UN PATRIMONIO DIGNO A SU ESPOSA E HIJA
texts.en: Juan works in a factory and his wife works in the home taking care of their daughter who is preschool age.  Juan desires to paint the outside of his house, both the exterior and interior walls since with the passage of time the wood is beginning to need protection.  It already looks in bad condition.  In this way he would like to provide a decent home for his wife and daughter.

loans.use: To paint the exterior and interior walls of his house.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: El Sr. Marcelo  tiene 61 años y tiene hijos ya independientes, el es  Agricultor se dedica  a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de cerdos en su parcela que se encuentran ubicado en la localidad de Rio Seco, Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr   Marcelo va a usar este préstamo  para la siembra de maíz y compra de cerdo,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es Para obtener recursos para subsistir, el Sr.  Marcelo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida ya que esta es la única actividad que tiene para mantenerse  y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su producción la Sr. Marcelo vende sus productos en el mercado de la localidad directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en: Mr. Marcelo is 61 years old and has two adult children.  He is a farmer and works growing corn and raising pigs on his parcel that is found in the city of Rio Seco.  This loan is his first sequence with Kiva.  Marcelo is going to use this loan to plant corn and to purchase pigs.  His reason for requesting the loan is to gain the necessary income in order to subsist.  Marcelo faces challenges in his work which include trying to improve his quality of life since farming is his only economic activity and he needs the income to maintain himself.  He is going to use the money to improve his production.  Marcelo sells his products in the local market directly from the producer to the consumer.

loans.use: to buy pigs and to plant corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Marisol, Junto a su esposo e hijos habitantes del municipio de Ticuantepe, sus planes a futuro es tener una mejora de vida y terminar su casa, el le apoya con los gastos del hogar y con los estudios de sus hijos. Doña Marisol en el credito anterior reparo la parte delantera de su casa ya que estaba demasiado deteriorado pero con estas lluvias ya el techo de la parte trasera esta filtrando agua y lo cambiara.
con este credito comprara: Laminas de Zinc, Perlines y Cielo Razo. para asi no tener mas problemas con las lluvias, Agradece a Afodenic el apoyo que le brinda atravez de fondo Kiva.
texts.en:
Marisol lives with her husband and children in the city of Ticuantepe.  Their goals for the future are to have a better life and finish constructing their house.  Her husband supports her with the household expenses and their children's school costs.  With her previous loan she repaired the front part of her home since it had deteriorated.  However, due to the rain, her roof is now leaking water and she plans to replace it.

With the loan funds she will buy corrugated sheet metal, wooden beams, and materials for the ceiling so that she will not have further problems with the rain leaking in.  She thanks Afodenic for the support the are giving her by means of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy corrugated sheet metal, wooden beams and hardware.

loans.name: Raul Franchezco

texts.es:
Raúl es un joven de 19 años, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Chincha, a pesar de su corta edad él es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación y muchas ganas de apoyar a su familia; gracias al apoyo de sus padres Raúl pudo estudiar una carrera técnica de computación y actualmente gracias a su trabaja se encuentra estudiando la carrera de gastronomía que tanto quiere; en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar diversos postres y en algunas ocasiones prepara un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Raúl trabaja como técnico en una empresa de refacción y mantenimiento de computo de la su ciudad, él trabaja un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor, ya que lo consideran mucho por su buen desempeño y por su trato amable hacia los demás.
Raúl se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de estudio, tales como: cuadernos, libros, mandiles y diversos utensilios de cocina; de esta manera Raúl contará con los útiles necesarios para poder seguir estudiando su carrera de gastronomía, así él espera poder culminar satisfactoriamente su profesión para que un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener su propio restaurant y con ello desea seguir apoyando a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Raúl is a 19 year old young man.  He lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Chincha.  In spite of his young age he is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person.  He has a great desire to succeed, and he really wants to support his family.  Thanks to the support of his parents, Raúl was able to study computer technology.

Thanks to his work, he is currently studying for a degree in the culinary arts, which he loves so much.  In his free time he likes to make delicious Arroz Chaufa [fried rice] to share with his family. 

With great determination and enthusiasm, Raúl works day to day as a technician at a computer repair and maintenance company in his city.  He works approximately ten hours a day.  He is happy doing this work because they treat him with respect because of his good performance and how kindly he treats others.

Raúl is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they gave him, he will be able to buy materials for his education.  He will buy materials like notebooks, books, aprons, and different kitchen utensils.  This way Raúl will have the materials needed to be able to continue studying the culinary arts.  

This way he hopes to be able to satisfactorily complete his professional studies.  He hopes to do this so that in the near future he will be able to have his own restaurant.  With his own restaurant he wishes to continue helping his family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy materials like notebooks, books, aprons, and different kitchen utensils for his studies.

loans.name: Vitaliano

texts.es:
Vitaliano tiene 33 años de edad, vive al lado de su pareja quien trabaja como obrera agrícola, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad que se caracteriza por su agricultura, en especial por el cultivo de arroz, considerado uno de los mejores del mundo, también se cultiva pallares, frejoles, maíz, entre otros. Junto a su esposa Vitaliano tiene 2 pequeños hijos de 4 y 8 años de edad y por quienes trabaja muy duro para darles una vida digna y sobre todo con mucho amor y honradez.
