Miriam is a life-long resident of the city of Ticuantepe. She and her husband, who works for a private company, have made a great effort to realize their dream of finishing their house. Miriam sells clothes and helps with the household expenses, but it's not enough money for them to be able to afford the improvements. 

With this new loan, Miriam will be able to buy the following materials: cement, Bondex [a tile adhesive], green tile, and tile spacers. WIth these materials, they will finish the flooring. 

Miriam is very grateful to Afodenic, which has supported her with several Kiva-funded loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement, tile adhesive, and tile.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a 53-year-old resident of Lapasan, Clarin. She provides for her six children's needs from the little amount of 8,000 PHP she has gained each month from her own piggery business for the past five years, as an aid to the income gained from her husband. 

However, in 2009, she became a member of GDMPC and is applying for a loan at GDMPC microfinance for 7,300 PHP to buy feeding supplies. Nenita wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La socia Antonia sigue participando en el banco comunal “Luz del Sur” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella sigue con el negocio de venta de repuestos de cocina. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad la socia Antonio requiere el préstamo para comprar repuestos de cocina como por ejemplo hornillas, asas, pitones y otras cosas más.  

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member Antonia is still a part of the “Southern Light” Communal Bank and is doing very well thanks to her punctual payments of her quotas. She still has her business selling kitchen supplies. She has worked in this business for several years and is doing very well. At present, Antonia needs a loan to buy kitchen supplies like stove burners, cups, tongs and other items.

The member is very grateful for the loan and is committed to paying her quotas on the time specified.

loans.use: buy kitchen supplies like stove burners, cups, tongs and other items.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: La socia Ernestina sigue participando en el banco comunal “Luz del Sur” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella sigue trabajadora como ama de llaves. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este trabajo y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad la socia Ernestina requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de la casa o sea va comprar mayólicas, cemento y otras cosas más. La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Ernestina is still participating in the “Luz del Sur” communal bank, and it is going very well, as she is making her installment payments on time. She continues to be a hard-working housekeeper. She has been doing this work for several years now, and it is going very well. 

On this occasion, Ernestina needs the loan to do maintenance work on her home. That is, she is going to buy tiles, cement and other materials. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her installment payments in accordance with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on her home, and buy tiles, cement and other materials.

loans.name: Juan Leonardo

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR JUAN,TIENE  UNA HIJA POR EMPESAR A CUERSAR LA UNIVERSIDAD
YA QUE NO CUENTA CON SUFICIENTES INGRESOS 
PARA SOLVENTAR LA INSCUPCION Y GASTOS PREVIOS A LA UNIVERSIDAD
COMO ECAMENES,LIBROS,MOCHILA´METERIAL INTERACTIVO
MATERIAL DE ESTUDIO
ENTRE MUCHAS COSAS MAS
JUAN DECEA PODERPAGAR SU ESTDIO I QUE SU HIJA PUEDA TERMINAR SU CARRERA
I ASI ELLA PUEDA TENER UN BUEN FUTURO LLENO DE EXITO.
texts.en:
Juan has a daughter who is about to begin her university studies. He does not have sufficient income to cover the enrollment fees, and pre-university expenses such as examinations, books, knapsack, study materials, interactive educational materials and many other things.   

Juan wants to be able to pay for her studies, so that his daughter can complete her degree, and this way have a good future, full of success.

loans.use: To pay for university expenses.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio tiene 37  años de edad, es casado y con  3  hijos. Vive en casa propia en la zona urbano marginal del distrito de Lambayeque  en el Norte de Peru. El lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias que cuenta con servicios de agua. 

Gregorio es muy trabajador y se dedica al transporte y a la agriculture. Por un lado el se dedica al transporte publico de pasajeros en una mototaxi, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años, el ambito de desarrollo del negocio es la zona urbano- rural de lambayeque. Esto ayuda a comunicar a la poblacion rural con la urbana y asi fomentar el comercio y el desarrollo de su comunidad.  Adicionalmente el cliente, se dedica a la crianza y comercializacion de ganado vacuno, caprino, ovino y aves de corral varias. Ultimamente tambien a empezado a sembrar productos agricolas en su afan de salir adelante y diverisficar sus ingresos. Presisamente, el solicita un credito de 1500 soles a Edpyme Alternativa con el apoyo de Kiva para para invertir en la siembra y mantenimiento de ¾ de Ha. de alfalfa.
texts.en:
Gregorio, 37, is married and has three children.  He lives in his own house in the marginal urban area of the district of Lambayeque in northern Peru.  It is a small community with around 100 families who have running water.

Gregorio is a hard worker who earns a living in the transportation business and in agriculture.  He uses a motor-taxi in his public transport business which he has been in for two years, and works in the urban-rural area of Lambayeque.  This helps connect the rural population with the urban area and promote commerce and development in his community.  He also raises and sells cattle, goats, sheep and different poultry.  Lately he has begun planting crops to diversify his income and get ahead.  Precisely, he is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa, with Kiva's support, to plant and maintain alfalfa on a 4,800 m2 plot of land.

loans.use: To plant and maintain his alfalfa crop.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia Francisca sigue dedicandose al negocio de compra y venta de leche,a la vez continua dedicandose a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas ,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan ,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de leche para su negocio.
texts.en:
The member, Francisca, runs a business buying and selling milk.  She also raises small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens, which she later sells to customers on an order basis.  She has been in business for quite some time and it is going well because of her hard work.  She is a determined woman who has put every effort into providing for her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy milk for her business,.

loans.use: To buy milk for her business.

loans.name: Luis Mariano

texts.es: A Luis un comerciante de 55 años de edad,  siempre le ha gustado hacer negocios, de allí que haya experimentado en una gran variedad de ellos desde hace 32 años, observando de cerca o trabajando en el negocios de otros y desde el año 2005 trabajando en el suyo propio, desde las 8:00 A.M. hasta las 10:00 P.M., vendiendo los productos que la  temporada le señala, como de mayor demanda; de esta manera  el lugar donde habita  y puerta a puerta transitando en bicicleta por las calles de Soledad,  vende productos de aseo, prendas de acero, sabanas, toallas,  pescado, víveres y todo lo que el potencial de su clientela necesita diariamente. Luis se ha extendido en su trayecto y acaba muy pronto con los productos que vende sin haber llegado al lugar donde termina su recorrido. El vende principalmente a crédito y algunos productos  de contado, pero su capital es insuficiente para lograr satisfacer la demanda de todos sus clientes, señalados en su rutinario trayecto, quitándole esta posibilidad de crecer. Sus compras las realiza una parte a crédito y otra de contado, en graneros, mercados públicos, distribuidores de abastos etc. Así mismo ha construido una clientela alrededor de su vivienda, que significa para él, un gran potencial de clientes y tiene a su vez un menaje de cocina, suficiente para ofrecer los fines de semanas comidas rápidas, lo cual constituiría otro ingreso, pero lo único que le hace falta,  es el carruaje de perros calientes para completar su estructura de nuevo negocio. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará pescado, víveres, útiles de aseo, prendas de dormitorios y un carro de comidas rápidas. Con su anterior crédito, logró trabajar un poco mas holgado con un efectivo disponible para compras rápidas, de contado y con descuentos logrando así dar más agilidad a la rotación de sus inventarios. La inversión de su credikiva se convierte en una posibilidad de generar un nuevo ingreso, con el que aportará mayor bienestar para su familia, conformada por su esposa y sus 4 hijos, que hoy se encuentran en las edades de 18 a 26 años, a quienes sueña verlos convertidos en profesionales exitosos.
texts.en:
Luis, a 55 year old merchant, has always enjoyed doing business and for 32 years has been involved in a wide variety of different ones, either observing from nearby or working in someone else's business.  In 2005 he started his own and now works from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. selling any products that are in highest demand depending on the season.   Out of his house, and on bicycle going door to door, he sells cleaning products, steel items, sheets, towles, fish, groceries and anything else his customers might need on a daily basis.

Luis has extended his route and finishes selling his products before getting to the end of his working circuit.  He sells mainly on credit, and some products in cash, but his capital is insufficient to be able to satisfy the demand of all the customers along his route, which keeps him from expanding.  He makes part of his purchases on credit and the other in cash, at farms, public markets, wholesale suppliers, etc.  He has built a customer base around where he lives, which has a lot more market potential.  He also has kitchen equipment so he can offer fast food on weekends, giving him an extra income.  The only thing he needs for his new business is a hot dog cart.  This is why he is applying for a CrediKiva loan, his second through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  He will use it to buy fish, groceries, cleaning products, sleepwear and a fast food cart.

He used the previous loan to have more liquidity to make his purchases in cash to get better discounts and increase his turnover.  The CrediKiva loan will help him generate more income and improve the lifestyle of his family, comprised of his wife and four children, ages 18 to 26, who he wants to become successful professionals.

loans.use: To buy fish, grociers, cleaning products, sleepwear and a fast food cart.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia Norma sigue dedicandose a la ganaderia,la socia cria vacas para luego venderlo en las ferias de los dias viernes y a sus clientes que le solicitan ,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de alimento para sus vacas como forrage concentrado.
texts.en:
The member, Norma, continues with her livestock farming, raising cows that she later sells at the Friday market or to customers on an order basis.  She has been in business for quite some time and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day, allowing her to provide for her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy animal feed, such as concentrated fodder, for her cows.

loans.use: To buy animal feed, such as concentrated fodder, for her cows.

loans.name: Mary Leidy

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 10,600 pesos Mary Leidy podrá comprar mercancía para tener una mayor variedad para mostrar a sus clientes. Mary Leidy vende zapatos por catálogos, pero a muchos de sus clientes no les gusta esperar hasta que llegue el producto, sino que prefieren compar directamente de los que ella tiene en su casa. Hace dos años que inició este negocio y ha aprendido que la oportunidad de hacer una venta muchas veves depende de tener la mercancía  a mano y no en el catálogo.
Mary Leidy tiene 27 años y es casada, su esposo trabaja en una maquiladora de ropa ganando 8.00 USD diarios. Tienen 3 hijos de 9, 8 y 4 años que asisten a la escuela.
El deseo de Mary es que su negocio de venta por catálogos crezca de tal manera que pueda establecer una tienda de calzados en un local fuera de su casa.
texts.en:
With a loan in the amount of 10,600 Pesos, Mary Leidy will be able to buy a wider variety of merchandise for her customers.  Mary Leidy sells shoes by catalogue, but many of her customers do not like to have to wait for the product and would rather buy from her directly at home.  Two years ago she started the business and has learned that many times the opportunity to make a sale depends on having the product on hand and not have to orderit  by catalogue.

Mary Leidy is 27 years old and married.  Her husband works at a clothing factory and earns 8.00 USD a day.  They have three children, ages 9,8 and 4 who go to school.

Mary's goal is to expand her catalogue business so she can open a shoe shop somewhere other than in her home.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Cyrile

texts.fr: Cyrile est âgé de 39 ans et vit au Bénin. Cyrile a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire et est marié à une marchande du nom de Dossi. Le couple a sept enfants à charge dont six sont leurs propres enfants. Certains des enfants de Cyrile sont scolarisés. Cyrile vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme et assure ensemble avec sa femme les différents besoins du ménage. Cyrile a appris la coiffure, activité qu’il exerce depuis une quinzaine d’année dans son atelier et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Parallèlement à cette activité, Cyrile vend de l’huile de palme dans sa région. La clientèle de Cyrile devient de plus en plus grandissante. Afin de perfectionner son activité et d’être plus compétitif sur le marché, Cyrile désire acquérir de nouveaux matériels de travail et augmenter son stock de vente. Cyrile s'approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Cyrile sollicite une quatrième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les trois crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Cyrile, age 39, lives in Benin. He dropped out of elementary school. He's married to a merchant named Dossi. The couple has seven children in their care, out of which six are their own. Some of Cyrile's children go to school.

Cyrile and his wife live with their children, and the couple provides for the various needs of their household.


Cyrile learned hairdressing, a job he's been doing for about fifteen years in his workshop. This provides him with a non negligible income. In parallel to this business, he also sells palm oil in his region.

Cyrile's clientele is ever-increasing. In order to strengthen his business and be more competitive on the market, he would like to buy new work equipment and increase his stock.

He gets his supplies in his region. Eager to satisfy his customers, and in order to increase his revenue and income, he's seeking a fourth loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. The previous three loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy hair clippers and cans of palm oil

loans.name: Vouveyéton Jonas

texts.fr: Vouveyéton Jonas est âgé de 28 ans et vit au Bénin. Vouveyéton Jonas a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire et est marié à une marchande du nom de Béatrice. Le couple a trois enfants à charge dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Aucun des enfants de Vouveyéton Jonas n’est encore scolarisé. Vouveyéton Jonas vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme et assure ensemble avec sa femme les différents besoins du ménage. Vouveyéton Jonas a appris la peinture et la décoration, activités qu’il exerce depuis une dizaine d’année dans son atelier et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Parallèlement à cette activité, Vouveyéton Jonas vend des gravures dans sa région. La clientèle de Vouveyéton Jonas devient de plus en plus grandissante. Afin de perfectionner son activité et d’être plus compétitif sur le marché, Vouveyéton Jonas désire acquérir de nouveaux matériels de travail. Vouveyéton Jonas s'approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Vouveyéton Jonas sollicite une troisième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Vouveyéton Jonas, age 28, lives in Benin, He dropped out of elementary school. He's married to a merchant named Béatrice. The couple has three children in their care, out of which two are their own. None of his children attend school yet.

Vouveyéton Jonas and his wife live with their children, and the couple ensures together that the various expenses of their household get covered.

Vouveyéton Jonas learned painting and decoration, a job he's been doing for about ten years in his workshop. This provides him with a non negligible income.

In parallel, he also sells engravings in his region. His clientele is ever-increasing. In order to perfect his business and be more competitive on the market, he would like to buy new work equipment.

He gets his supplies in his region. Eager to satisfy his customers, and in order to increase his revenue and his income, he's seeking a third loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. The previous two loans where repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy serigraphy equipment

loans.name: Jorge Washintong

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven de 21 años de edad, viven el distrito de Santiago, el cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, paprika, entre otros, también encontramos gran variedad de empresas agroexportadoras que brindan varios puestos de trabajo para los pobladores del distrito. Cuando Jorge tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio y también le gusta preparar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pato”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos él solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar administración de empresas.

Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación traba en un fundo de su distrito como obrero, trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias, es muy honrado y responsable por ello el cree que le va bien en su trabajo, asimismo con el fruto de su trabajo apoya con los gastos de su casa y en especial apoya a su abuelos.

Jorge está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar medicinas y consultas medicas para sus abuelos ya que están muy enfermos, con ello podrá darles una mejor calidad de vida ya que ellos siempre lo han apoyado y sobre todo porque los quiere muchísimo, así el seguirá trabajando y podrá hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una carrera para ser el orgullo de sus padres y abuelos”.
texts.en:
Jorge is 21 years old, and he lives in Santiago, a district famous for its hot and welcoming climate and for its agriculture, notably growing cotton, grapes, asparagus and paprika. Various agro-export companies can also be found here, offering many job chances in the district. Whenever he has some free time, Jorge loves playing soccer with his friends and neighbors, and he also loves eating one of his favorite dishes, the delicious “Arroz con pato” (rice with duck). Owing to his meager economic resources, he has succeeded in completing secondary education only, but he would have liked to study Business Administration.

Jorge is a laborer employed in a farm of his district, working with great energy and dedication. He works around 8 hours a day, he is very honest and responsible and he thinks it is for this reason that his job is going very well; on top of this, thanks to his job he helps paying for his household’s expenses, supporting his grandparents in particular.

Jorge is deeply grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help he will be able to buy medicines and to pay for medical consultations for his grandparents who are seriously ill. Thanks to the loan he will succeed in offering a better standard of living to his grandparents because they have always supported him and above all because he loves them very much. He will then keep on working in order to make his biggest dream come true: “To pursue a career in order to be the pride of his parents and grandparents”.

loans.use: To buy medicines and to pay for medical consultations.

loans.name: Yeny Margarita

texts.es: YENY MARGARITA TIENE 40 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES SEPARADA Y  TIENE 02 HIJOS A SU PODER. VIVE EN CASA PROPIA EN UNA COMUNIDAD CERCA DE CAYALTI AL NORTE DE PERU Y TIENE BUENAS RELACIONES CON SUS VECINOS. ELLA ES UNA MUJER CON GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE, INDEPENDIENTE Y LUCHADORA, ADEMAS DE CONTAR CON MUY BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES. ELLA CUENTA CON UN NEGOCIO DE CRIANZA Y VENTA DE ANIMALES DE CORRAL EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO,CONTANDO CON MAS DE 12 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN ESTA ACTIVIDAD. ADEMÁS ES TRABAJADORA DE EMPRESA DE VIVERES AGRICOLAS LO CUAL LE AYUDA A DIVERSIFICAR SUS INGRESOS MENSUALES Y AYUDAR A SUS FAMILIA. DADO SU ESFUERZO Y GANAS DE MEJORAR LAS CONDICIONES DE VIDA DE SU FAMILIA, YENY BUSCA UN DE 2200 SOLES PARA  MEJORAR SU CASA Y ESPECIALMENTE PAREDES Y TECHO, QUE NECESITAN MANTENIMIENTO.
texts.en: Yeny Margarita is 40 years old, she is separated and she has 2 children who live with her. She lives in her own house in a community located close to Cayalti, in the north of Peru, and she has a good relationship with her neighbors. She has a great desire to progress in life, she is an interdependent and tenacious woman, and she can also count on very good personal references. She breeds farm animals in her house, an activity she has been engaged in for more than 12 years. She also works for a food company, something that helps her diversifying the monthly income she earns to help her family. Because of her efforts and her desires to improve her family’s standard of living, Yeny is requesting a loan of 2200 PEN to make improvements to her house, as the walls and the roof need to be repaired.

loans.use: To make improvements to the walls and roof of her house.

loans.name: Melfie

texts.en:
For three years in Bacolod, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Melfie, a 37-year-old married mother of one child, has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melfie joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 17,400 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Aged 44, Mom is the mother of three kids who are living with her and helping the family's business. For 12 years, she has sown rubber tree seedlings for resale in order to support the family’s basic needs. From this business, she is able to save about 7,000 KHR per day. 

Mom has been with VisionFund since 2011 as a first-cycle client. The loan, which has been successfully repaid, has enabled her to continue her current business and to keep her children in school. Now, she is confidently leading a group of two to apply for a new second-cycle loan. She is requesting 1,200,000 KHR and her group member is applying for 200,000 KHR. 

She will buy necessary materials (i.e. plastic bags) to support the sowing business. She hopes to sell a lot of rubber tree seedlings so she can earn more income.

loans.use: To buy necessary material to sow rubber tree seedlings.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is from Mabini Extension, Ozamiz City. He is 25 years old. Rogelio is now married and he has one child. 

Rogelio used his last loan to purchase materials he needed to expand the services he offers in his watch and cell-phone repair business. His business is successful, and he is now taking a new loan to pay for the rent on his business premies. In the future he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to pay for the rent on his business premises.

loans.name: Rhyme Rose

texts.en:
Rhyme Rose is from Calabayan, Ozamis City. She is 22 years old and single. To make a living, Rhyme Rose is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Rhyme Rose been in business for three years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

Rhyme Rose is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2011, Rhyme Rose joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Chris Marie

texts.en:
Chris Marie is married and has two children. Chris Marie is 30 years old, and resides at Gata Daku, Clarin, Philippines. Chris Marie owns and operates a farm land, planting and harvesting watermelon for sale to earn a living and she's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 7,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This year, Chris Marie joined GDMPC. In the future, Chris Marie wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Gloriose

texts.en:
Gloriose is engaged. She wants the loan to buy more seeds, seed multiplication (production of seeds for sale or for future planting) and support labor to get the best harvest. She plans to use the profits for renovating the house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds, seed multiplication and support labor costs.

loans.name: Wangnigninan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNIGNINAN est formé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Firmine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Firmine a peu fréquenté l’école. Firmine est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un certain Omer. Le couple a quatre  enfants, tous scolarisés, et à leur charge. Parmi les enfants, trois sont leurs propres enfants. Firmine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a près de quinze ans que Firmine mène comme activité, la vente des glacières, des tissus à son domicile et par le système de distribution. De façon secondaire, Firmine vend des ustensiles de cuisine (plats, fourchettes) afin de contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille. Firmine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Firmine désire obtenir un quatrième crédit ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe WANGNIGNINAN. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The WANGNIGNINAN group comprises four women who live in the same neighborhood.  The group's representative, named Firmine, is the one raising her hand in the photo.

Firmine only attended school for a short period of time.  She is 46 years old and married to a man named Omer.  The couple raises four children, all in school and their dependents.  Out of these four children, three are their own.

Firmine lives with her husband and children.  The couple jointly takes care of the family's expenses. 

For almost 15 years now, Firmine has been selling ice boxes and fabrics from her home, through the distribution system.  Additionally, she sells kitchen utensils (dishes, forks) in order to meet her family's various needs.

She buys her goods at a market in Benin.

In order to increase her stock of merchandise, and to better meet her customers' demand, she would like to receive a fourth loan, together with the other members of the WANGNIGNINAN group.

Previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy ice boxes, fabrics and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Union Fait La Force Group

texts.fr: Le groupe UNION FAIT LA FORCE est composé de quatre personnes qui sont des amis résidant dans le même quartier et s’approvisionnant au même endroit. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Jérémie est celui qui a le doigt levé sur la photo. Jérémie est âgé de 41 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Reine. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Jérémie et sa femme assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Jérémie a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire et a appris la couture, activité qu’elle exerce depuis seize ans dans une région du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Jérémie fait la blanchisserie. Jérémie s’approvisionne dans sa région et dans une ville du Bénin. Afin de rénover sa technique de travail, Jérémie désire acquérir une nouvelle machine dans le but de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante. C’est dans le souci d’accroître leurs revenus que, Jérémie et les autres membres du groupe UNION FAIT LA FORCE sollicitent un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Union Fait la Force (“together we’re stronger”) group has four members, who are all friends, live in the same neighborhood and get their supplies from the same place. The group’s representative is called Jérémie, and is pictured with his finger raised in the photo. He is 41 years of age and married to a retailer called Reine. The couple has three children, some of whom are at school and all under their care. In addition to their own children, the couple also has another child to care for. The children live together with their parents. 

Jérémie and his wife make sure that their family’s various expenses are covered. Jérémie gave up his studies during high school and learned the sewing trade, and he has worked in this business for 16 years in a region of Benin. He also has a secondary business, working in a laundry.  

Jérémie gets his supplies in his region, as well as in a town in Benin. To improve his working technique, he would like to buy a bigger machine so that he can meet the needs of his ever-growing customer base. In order to increase their income, Jérémie and the other members of the Union Fait la Force group have requested their third loan from Alidé. Their first two loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy a machine.

loans.name: Siyoni Group

texts.fr:
Francine fait partie du groupe Siyoni et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 24 ans et est mariée à Gilbert, un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant de 3 ans.

Elle fait le commerce des habits, des rideaux et des draps  depuis  5ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d' habits, de rideaux et de  draps à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  construire sa propre maison et que son enfant étudie.
texts.en:
Francine belongs to the  Siyoni group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 24 years old, and is married to Gilbert, who is a driver. Together, they have a 3-year-old child.

For the last five years, Francine has been selling clothing, curtains and sheets. She is on her fifth loan from Turame. 

With the Kiva loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of clothing, curtains and sheets to re-sell, to make more profit. 

In the future, she would like to build her own house and see her child go to school.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy clothing, curtains and sheets to sell, to make more profit.

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND est composé de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Martine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Martine est âgée de 42 ans et a arrêté l’école au niveau universitaire. Martine a également appris la coiffure. Martine est mariée à un certain Gilbert. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Martine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Martine exerce depuis dix ans, la coiffure dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Martine vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques. Martine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Martine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra surement à hausser le niveau de leur activité et à se faire plus de profit
texts.en: The DIEU EST GRAND group is made up of three people who live in the same district.  This is the first time that this group has requested financial help from ALIDé with the hope of growing their business.  The representative of the group, named Martine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo.  Martine is 42 years old and left school at the university level.  She also learned to be a hairstylist.  She is married to a man named Gilbert.  The couple has three children, all of whom attend school, in their care. Martine lives with her husband and children.   In order to meet the different responsibilities of her family, she has been working as a hairstylist in her district for 10 years.  In addition, she sells hairpieces and cosmetic products.  She gets her supplies at a market in Bénin.  In the hopes of meeting the demand of her customers and to increase her turnover and her income, Martine is requesting, along with the other members of the DIEU EST GRAND group, her first loan through ALIDé.  This loan will certainly allow her to raise the level of her business and to earn larger profits.

loans.use: to buy hairpieces and cosmetics.

loans.name: Heou

texts.en:
Heou is 50 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom are single and still enrolled in school. Heou is a farmer cultivating rice, vegetables, and various kinds of crops, and selling them each harvesting season. She is happy that her spouse supports her in the business in order to obtain an abundant harvest and uplift the family out of poverty. She has been involved in the agricultural business for over 30 years. She has been able to manage her business well because she got these skills from her parents and experience from her farming practices. To make more income, Hoeu’s spouse dedicates himself to a business trading animals.

Heou would like to apply for a loan due to financial constraints. She is requesting a loan of KHR 4,000,000 which will be used by her husband to buy cow for trading purposes. She hopes to receive her second loan from Kiva lenders to invest in the business, so that they will be able generate a better income after selling the purchased cow. With the increased income, she can sustain her children's needs and save for their future education.

loans.use: to buy cow for trading purposes.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Ofelia has been in this business for 14 years. Ofelia earns additional income from pig-fattening.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Nenita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy materials like bamboo, a fishing net, nylon and other fishing equipment.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like bamboo, a fishing net, nylon and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Jamela

texts.en:
This is Jamelah, She previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of clothes and merchandise needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stocks of clothes and merchandise needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jamela hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jati Ayu Group

texts.en:
For housewives in Bali, especially in rural areas, it has become normal for women to play an active role in supporting the needs of the family in addition to what the head of the household does. In addition to farming, another activity that helps to make ends meet from day to day is raising livestock, especially pigs.

There are several obstacles encountered in developing this kind of business, including limited knowledge of business management as well as limited access to capital. To overcome this problem these borrowers decided to form one group so it's easier to communicate between members of the group and also easier to get funding.

Ni Nengah, 28 years old, is head of the Jati Ayu group for raising pigs. To increase its funds, Ni Nengah invited group members to participate in the loan program for small businesses from MUK. The loan will be used to purchase food supplies and also a sow. Within six months they will have swine babies ready to sell. The profits will be used to meet the needs of families, especially the children's education and also needed family meals.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies and also a sow.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 29 years old, married, and has three children. 

Evelyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 13,500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for the pigs.

Evelyn has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for the pigs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a videoke rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Grace is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy an additional unit of videoke machine.

Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional videoke machine.

loans.name: Bebioly

texts.en:
Bebioly is 52 years old and married with seven children.

Bebioly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Bebioly has borrowed and paid for 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years.

Bebioly aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Gaudiosa requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy a fishing net and repair her fishing boat.

She has been in this business for 32 years.

In the future, Gaudiosa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Kong is a 46-year-old mother of four kids, two of whom are staying with her and helping with the family's business. Rice farming is a common business for the villagers of the Dambae district (Kong's residential area) as well as for Kong. To better feed her family, Kong also plants cassava on one hectare of land. From both these businesses, she is able to earn about 19,000 KHR (Khmer Riel, Cambodia's local currency). The main problems for her business are fruitless rice caused by the drought and the declining price of cassava. 

This is Kong's second loan cycle. She leads a group of other two members; one is a newly-joined client and another is a third-cycled client. She has used the first loan successfully and managed to pay back already. The past loan has helped her to have a decent food and to support the daily basic needs of her household. Now, she is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizers, and to pay the fees for plowing her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her businesses and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers, and to pay the fee for plowing her farmland.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is 39 years old and married with three children.

Carol works hard to provide for her family. She runs a Sari-Sari Store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in the store.

Carol has been in this business for 16 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Carol aspires to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina works hard to support her family. Christina is married and has a fruit and vegetable retail business in the Philippines.

Christina requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell on her food stall.

Christina has been in this business for 24 years.

In the future, Christina would like to save enough to ensure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Dosseh Théophile

texts.fr: Âgé de 38 ans, Dosseh Théophile vit au Bénin et a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Dosseh Théophile est marié à Onance, une coiffeuse. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge dont trois  sont leurs propres enfants. Certains des enfants de Dosseh Théophile sont scolarisés. Dosseh Théophile vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme et assure ensemble avec sa femme les différents besoins du ménage. Dosseh Théophile a appris la peinture et la décoration, activités qu’il exerce depuis treize ans dans son atelier et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. La clientèle de Dosseh Théophile devient de plus en plus grandissante. Afin de perfectionner son activité et d’être plus compétitif sur le marché, Dosseh Théophile désire acquérir de nouveaux matériels de travail. Dosseh Théophile s'approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Dosseh Théophile sollicite une troisième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Dosseh Théophile is 38 years old and lives in Bénin.  He left school at the secondary level.  He is married to Onance, a hairstylist.   The couple has four children in their care, three of whom are their own children.  Some of Dosseh Théophile’s children attend school.  He lives with his children and his wife, and together he and his wife take care of the different family needs.  Dosseh Théophile has learned the art of painting and decorating, work which he has done for 13 years in his workshop, and which brings him considerable income.   His customers are becoming more and more numerous.  In order to perfect his work and to be more competitive in the market, Dosseh Théophile wants to get new materials for his work.  He gets his supplies in the region.   In order to meet the demands of his customers and to increase his turnover and his income, Dosseh Théophile is requesting a third loan through ALIDé.   The previous two loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Armida

texts.en:
Armida works hard to support her family. Armida is married and has a Vulcanizing Shop business in the Philippines.

Armida requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional tools and equipment for her vulcanizing shop.

Armida has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Armida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional tools and equipment for her vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Aires

texts.en: This time, Aires is borrowing PHP 22,000 to purchase medicines and vaccines for her pigs. The general store business that she previously funded through NWTF and its partner Kiva continues and provides Aires and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Thida's Group

texts.en:
Thida, 23, is a young mother of two dependent daughters. To support her family, she has been growing cassava on a 5-hectare area of land. She has been with this business for several years. Thida has been with VisionFund for two loan times and has completely paid back all the loans, which have helped to maintain her household better than before. 

Now, she is applying for a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each with her other group member for the third loan cycle. She, the group leader, is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes that she will grow her cassava timely so as to earn more profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Puao

texts.en: Puao is 50 years old and married with three children. She owns and operates a business venture of sewing and selling clothes. She has many years of experience in this line of business. Puao needs a loan to improve her business with an overlock sewing machine. She hopes to use her profits to improve the living conditions of her family. She joined SPBD in 2007.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Melopeta

texts.en: Melopeta is 21 years old and married with two children. She makes and sells puletasi handicrafts made from wood to earn a living and has been doing this for many years. Melopeta has requested a loan to get more new equipment to improve her business. She plans to use her profits to help her family income supplement. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to get more new equipment to improve her handicrafts business.

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un, a 65-year-old woman, has been residing in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She was born on the family farm, and the farming business has been the main source of her income ever since. Her husband had left her two legacies of children, leading her to try very hard in raising them alone and providing them a valued education. Both of her children are employed now and can earn a living independently.

With the amount Un has requested from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, Un would like to purchase a motorcycle for her son to commute to work as he is now a local policeman. This will help her family with their transportation needs. She hopes that lenders will continually support her family, and she is very thankful for their kindness. She promises to pay her loan back on time and punctually as scheduled.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her son to commute to work .

loans.name: Medelina Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden Medelina is a 40-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of 10 and 20. All of them go to school. 

Kiden runs a food store, and she has been in this business for two years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 1000 SDG to purchase onions, okra, etc. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Kiden would like to expand her business.

Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Kiden says she is grateful for the loans given by Finance Sudan.

loans.use: to buy items like onions, okra, etc.

loans.name: Roeurn's Group

texts.en:
Roeurn is 58 years old and living in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is married with six children; one daughter lives with her and helps the family to generate more income by working as a paid worker at a casino. 

Roeurn is a rice farmer. She has been in this business for five years to overcome the family’s hardship and can earn about KHR 26,600 per day. The main challenge for the business is the yield of the crop, which is destroyed by insects. To tackle this issue, she formed a group consisting of two to apply for her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use some portion of her loan to buy insecticide and the remaining to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for protecting the farmland.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
This is Amelia, 57. She is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Jesus, her business partner. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Amelia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Amelia hopes to be able to expand the business soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 37 years old and single with four children. She operates a jewelry business, which she has been doing for the last six years. She earns a monthly income of KES 50,000, which she uses to support her family.  

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to buy more stock of necklaces, earrings and rings for sale. 

Josephine plans to expand her business from the anticipated profits. Her dream in the future is to be a prosperous business lady.

loans.use: to buy more stock of necklaces, earrings and rings for sale.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is responsible for four children, one of whom is employed as a garment worker, while the other children are still attending school. Sok is now 38 years old and married to her spouse, who works in the field of business and is a farmer. Sok and her spouse help each other to take care of their crops at the field. Sok uses her generated revenue to provide daily sustenance, medicines, clothes and education to her children. She has been doing this business for nearly 12 years and earns approximately USD $2.90 each day.

Sok would like to borrow a loan in the amount of $1,000, which will be used to purchase farming supplies for planting potatoes such as fertilizers, pesticides and small potato plants. Sok believes that she can maintain her business and generate a better income for the family in the coming seasons.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies for planting potatoes, such as fertilizers, pesticides and small potato plants.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas, aged 43, peacefully lives with his family in Reussey Keo district, a suburb area of Phnom Penh. To earn a living, he operates a motorcycle transportation business, providing his services to people living in his community. He has been engaged in this type of business since 2008, earning in the vicinity of $5 per day. Meas is responsible for three single children, two of whom are under his care.

Meas has been a client of HKL for one loan already in order to gain access to financial services. With the help of the previous loan, he was able to upgrade part of his living conditions, and he is now asking for another loan of $1,000 to invest in a hog-raising business. He will purchase five piglets and feeds for fattening them. He hopes to improve his general living conditions and increase his business activities to pursue a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase five piglets and feeds for fattening them.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Living in the rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Chanthou is 45 years old. She is a widow and the mother of two children, one of whom is still in school. 

To earn a living, Chanthou has been working in a rice field. She also supplements the family’s income by selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

Chanthou has been with VisionFund for two cycles and has successfully paid back the loans. The past loans have helped her to earn more income to support her family and enable her to earn about 112,000 KHR per day. 

Now Chanthou is applying for a new loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR. With this loan, she will buy fertilizers for her farmland and grocery items such as canned foods, soap, food ingredients, etc. for selling. She hopes to earn more income so she can keep her son in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland and grocery items for selling.

loans.name: Khan

texts.en:
Khan is a loving father of five children, two of whom are still enrolled in a local school. He is 41 years old and married. Khan owns a few lots of farmland, on which he grows rice to support the whole family as food. He has managed a rice farming business which has become the primary source of income for almost 12 years. Khan is glad because he has his wife's support in the business. She helps him keep their family out of hunger and poverty.

Khan wishes to make improvements to his business and better his family’s living situations. So now, he is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to buy a motorcycle for home use and their personal purposes. This purchase will help in providing good transportation services for his family. In the future, he wants to maintain and expand his business activities to satisfy his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for personal use.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: a señora: juana maria, se encuentra  casada y con dos hijos, tiene poco tiempo que se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, su esposo trabaja como operador de carretera , tiene un año que adquirio su vivienda la cual esta pagando, su hija enfermo y la intervinieron quirurgicamente . actuamente su hija nesecita la operación y entre hospital y doctores,pago una cantidad considerable, del cual se salio de su presupuesto.por lo que necesita se le apoye para este gasto. ya que juana maria decea  que su hija se decempeñe i se reincorpore a la vida normal pues quiere que su hija tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señora Juana Maria is married with two children. She has recently begun selling used clothing. Her husband works as a highway operator. One year ago they acquired their home, which they are currently paying off. Her daughter got sick and had surgery. Now, her daughter needs an operation; between doctors and the hospital, she has paid a considerable amount out of pocket. She needs support for these costs. Juana Maria wants her daughter to get well and get back to normal life; she wants her daughter to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to cover surgery costs for her daughter.

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en:
Mussarat has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s grocery selling business. With the loan investment he will have a larger stock of grocery items such as sugar, spices, cooking oils, etc. in his shop that will allow him to fill the clients' needs and increase his sales and profits.

He is very professional in his dealings and his clients like to make purchases from his shop due to the quality of his products and his reasonable rates.

Mussarat is hopeful that the KIVA loan will be very productive for his business.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for grocery selling business

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa is 43 years old and married with six children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taro plants that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. Epenesa needs a loan to buy  manure, barbed wire, a crowbar, a spade and bush knives. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. Epenesa will use the profits from her sales to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy  manure, barbed wire, a crowbar, a spade and bush knives

loans.name: Fagalele

texts.en:
Fagalele is 47 years old and married with five children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taro plants that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Fagalele needs a loan to buy Gromozone, a water gallon, barbed wire and a crowbar. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. Fagalele will use the profits from her sales to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy Gromozone, a water gallon, barbed wire and a crowbar

loans.name: Faausuusu

texts.en:
Faausuusu is 35 years old and married with four children.  For two years, she has tended to a small garden where she grows taro plants and taamu that she can sell in her community or at the market.

Faausuusu needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, a spade, safety boots and barbed wire.  She has been a member of Kiva field partner SBPD since 2011. Faausuusu plans to use any profits realized from her sales to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a spade, safety boots, and barbed wire

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 55 years old and lives in Tinago, Ozamis City, Philippines. She is married and a mother of seven children. Juliana has a food business; she sells good viands (dishes), tasty desserts and refreshments in her food stall to earn a living. Juliana been running this food business for 10 years. She earns 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. 

Juliana requested a loan of PHP 21,500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Juliana has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Juliana hopes to have her business be more successful.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en:
Pelenatete is 48 years old and married with four children.  She has a small garden where she grows taro plants and banana that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years.

Pelenatete, who has has been a member of Kiva field partner SBPD since 2011, needs this loan to buy fertilizer, a spade, a rake, a shovel and a wheelbarrow.  Pelenatete will use any profits generated from her sales to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farming tools

loans.name: Macaria

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Macaria, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” de la provincia de Urubamba en Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando a varias actividades tales como a la producción y el comercio de verduras como legumbres y hortalizas al por mayor, y lo distribuyen en los diferentes mercados de la región, pero ahora ha incursionado también en el comercio de carbón de madera que trae desde Puerto Maldonado, capital de la región de Madre de Dios en Perú. Actividad que  viene realizando paralelamente a sus otras actividades. Macaria invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar carbón y venderlo en el mercado del Cusco.
Macaria está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This is Señora Macaria. She belongs to the “Reyna de los Angeles” communal bank, in the province of Urubamba in Cusco, Peru. She has several businesses including growing and selling vegetables wholesale. She distributes her vegetables to the various markets in the region. However, she has also started selling charcoal, which she transports from Puerto Maldonado, the capital of the Madre de Dios de Peru region. She has been doing this work on top of her other businesses. Macaria will invest the requested loan in the purchase of coal to sell in the Cusco market.
Macaria is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to provide her family with a better quality of life and for helping her to expand and strengthen her businesses.
She is grateful for this loan and promises to repay her quotas in keeping with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy coal wholesale.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is from Poblacion, Baclayon, Bohol. She has a business selling girly stuff, souvenir items like key chains, and school supplies. She is married with one child who is three years old. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of souvenir items like key chains and school supplies. 

She dreams of improving the life of her family through her business. Her income will be for family daily consumption and reinvestment in the same business. 

In the future, she hopes to be able to expand her merchandise and offer different products at affordable prices for better income.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of souvenir items like key chains and also school supplies

loans.name: Naheed's Group

texts.en:
Naheed is 43 years old and a mother of three daughters and three sons.  She couldn’t provide education to her children due to financial constraints.

Her husband has a furniture polish business. He is known as an expert in his field of work and receives regular orders every month. Naheed assists her husband by doing sewing for her neighboring clients. The income she earns helps her to pay utility bills and manage other household expenses.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan investment he will buy furniture polish to provide better quality services to his clients and increase his profits. He is very experienced in his business and Naheed is hopeful that he will be able to improve his business further after investing the loan.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Naheed.

loans.use: To buy furniture polish for polishing business

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

NWTF is relisting Cherry's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 19-year-old married woman with one child. 

She would like to start growing taro and 'taamu' to earn a living. Maria has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, barbed wire, a crowbar and a wheelbarrow to start her plantation. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Maria will spend her profits to buy more farming tools.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, barbed wire, a crowbar and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Jig

texts.en: Jig lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. He has been earning a living through proving transportation services for almost seven years so as to support the needs of his family. He gets an income of 8,000  PHP a month for this business. Without hesitation, Jig is borrowing the amount of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. He joined GDMPC in 2011. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is married with six children. Vivian is 55 years old. She lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Vivian plants and harvests rice to sell to earn a living and has been in business for 31 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 8,300 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping. In 2007, Vivian joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 45 years old and all her children are in school.

Elizabeth has a general store business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a 28,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods and other grocery products.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods and other grocery products.

loans.name: Djidjoho Jules

texts.fr: Âgé de 38 ans, Djidjoho Jules vit au Bénin et a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Djidjoho Jules est marié à une marchande du nom de Mireille. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Djidjoho Jules vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme et assure ensemble avec sa femme les différentes charges du ménage. Djidjoho Jules a appris la décoration, activité qu’il exerce depuis une vingtaine d’années à son domicile et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. La clientèle de Djidjoho Jules devient de plus en plus grandissante. Afin de perfectionner son activité et d’être plus compétitif sur le marché, Djidjoho Jules désire acquérir de nouveaux matériels de travail. Djidjoho Jules s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin et au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Djidjoho Jules sollicite une troisième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Djidjoho Jules is 38 years old and lives in Benin. He attended secondary school. He is married to a merchant named Mireille, and the couple have four dependent children, some of whom go to school. In addition to their own, they have another child in their care. Djidjoho Jules lives with his wife and children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

Djidjoho Jules is a decorator by trade. He has been practicing this activity from his home for about twenty years, and the work brings in substantial income. His customer base is growing steadily. 

To upgrade his activity and become more competitive in the market, Djidjoho Jules wishes to purchase new supplies, which he normally buys in a city of Benin and in Nigeria. 

Eager to achieve customer satisfaction and to increase his sales and revenue, Djidjoho Jules is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé for the third time. Both past loans were repaid without incident.

loans.use: to buy plexiglas, thinner and polyester resin.

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Исмоил житель района Хамадони. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Исмоил более пяти лет занимается животноводством. Он в основном разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа бычков и коров.
texts.en: Ismoil lives in Hamadoni region.  He's 42 years old. He's married and he has four children.  Ismoil has been engaged in animal husbandry for more than five years.  He's primarily specializes in cattle breeding and sales. Ismoil is requesting the loan to purchase calves and cows.

loans.use: to purchase calves and cows.

loans.name: Buen Corazon Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BUEN CORAZON” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gabriela es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, costura de ropa, atención de eventos, venta de juguetes, venta de fierros, venta de ropa y cosméticos.

La señora Gabriela, indica que hace un año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su padre que es socio desde hace tiempo. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de material electrónico, ella cuenta que el conocimiento de este negocio lo empezó cuando trabajaba con su madrina, posteriormente ella emprendió su propio negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el incremento de capital (compra de radios) mismo que comprará de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo venderá de en su puesto de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y crédito.

Enla fotografía no se encuentra la señora Alina, ya que fue a realizar la consulta médica.
texts.en:
The “BUEN CORAZON” communal bank will begin its seventh cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Villa Exaltación center. It is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors of which Gabriela is the Secretary. The businesses that the communal bank members have are varied. Among them, we have: a neighborhood store, sewing, event catering, selling toys, selling hardware, selling clothes and cosmetics.

Gabriela indicates that a year and ahalf ago she joined Pro Mujer. She jpined at the invitation of her father, who has been a member for a while. Right now, she has a business selling electronic materials. She says that she got to know this business when she works with her godmother. Later, she opened her own business.

The loan that she is talking out now is to grow her capital (buying radios). She will buy these from distributors and later sell them at her store. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible. She is in a common law marriage with two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the areas of health and lending.

In the photograph, Alina is missing, since she had to go to a doctor's appointment.

loans.use: to buy radios

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
(Nota: seleccioné cafetería por no tener la opción Heladería)
Con un préstamo de 21,000 pesos Rafael podrá comprar otro congelador y más mercancía. Hace 1 año que Rafael inició su heladería. Es un buen negocio, pues por el calor las personas siempre andan buscando algo frío para referesacrse. El mayor obstáculo de Rafael ha sido el servicio de energía electrica, ya que en su comunidad se suspende el servicio por lo menos 8 horas diarias. Por esto Rafael quiere comprar otro congelador, para mantener más helados congelados por un mayor tiempo.

Rafael es casado, su esposa es peluquera. Tienen un niño de 4 años que está en un preescolar.
Rafael quiere que su negocio crezca y se fortalezca para el y su esposa poder asegurarle una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
(Note: the sector "cafe" was selected because "Ice cream shop" is not an option)
With a loan of 21,000 pesos, Rafael will be able to buy another freezer and more merchandise. Rafael opened his ice cream shop one year ago. This is a good business; because it is hot out, people are always walking around looking for something cold with which to get refreshed. Rafael's biggest challenge has been the electricity services; in his community service is suspended for at least eight hours every day. For this reason, Rafael wants to buy another freezer, so that he can keep more ice cream cold for a greater amount of time.
Rafael is married; his wife is a hair dresser. They have a four-year-old who is in preschool.
Rafael wants his business to grow and get stronger for his and his wife's sake, so that they can provide their child with a good education.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and more merchandise.

loans.name: Wakeelan

texts.en:
Wakeelan is 27 years old and the mother of two daughters and one son. Her son is studying in fifth grade while her daughters are not of school-going age yet.

Wakeelan remains at home and performs her household responsibilities. She also supports her husband in his barbecue business by preparing the chicken pieces with spices.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy chicken and other ingredients used to make barbecue chicken in larger quantities.

He has been operating his business for the past many years. The taste of his barbecue chicken is liked by people very much.

Wakeelan is hopeful about her husband’s business improving after receiving the loan.

loans.use: To buy chicken meat for her barbecue chicken business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 52-year-old mother who lives in Bacoor, Cavite, the Philippines. She and her husband Eddie manage a business together and work hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Susan's business is selling men's and women’s clothes, slippers, and other products of the like.  She buys product at wholesale and resells it at a small  profit. She says her customers come to her because of her low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and others from the community.  She has a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

Susan plans to use this 10,000 Philippine peso loan to buy clothing and other merchandise to expand her product inventory. She expects to boost her income if she is able to expand her business. 

In the coming years, Susan dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy clothing and other merchandise for resale

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a 29-year-old married woman with two children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Marie needs a loan to buy flour, oil, yeast, sugar, and eggs. 

She plans to use her profits to save in her passbook for her kids' education. Marie has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, yeast, sugar, and eggs.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 32 years old. She is married and lives in a small village in the Kinango district with her small family: her husband, Shaban, who is a driver and her three children, all attending the local school. Agnes earns her living through the sale of gravel, retail. She is a very hardworking person who values her business. She buys the stones from the rural areas. Agnes says she has a ready market as her husband finds orders for her since he operates a lorry.

Agnes has requested a loan to purchase stones for making more gravel. She will be able to sell more gravel, which will increase the sales from her business.
