This will increase the family's income accordingly. With increased income, Agnes will be able to repair their house and finance their children's studies.

loans.use: to purchase stones for making more gravel.

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta is 38 years old and married with five children. She owns and operates a business venture designing elei (Samoan fabric). She has three years of experience in this line of business. Eseta needs a loan to buy materials, paint and brushes for elei. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy materials, paint and brushes for elei (Samoan fabric).

loans.name: Daylin

texts.en:
Daylin is 29 years old and married with three children who are in school.  Daylin works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Daylin has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soap, snack foods, canned goods, eggs, etc.

In the future Daylin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married with four children. She is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. Erlinda is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She's been doing this for five years and every month she earns 2,000  PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. 

In 2004, Erlinda joined GDMPC. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Saigbénan Élisée

texts.fr: Âgé de 35 ans, Saigbénan Élisée vit au Bénin et a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Saigbénan Élisée est un veuf et père de trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à sa charge. Saigbénan Élisée vit seul avec ses enfants et assure seul ses différents besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants. Saigbénan Élisée a appris la peinture et la décoration, activités qu’il exerce depuis dix sept ans dans son atelier et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Parallèlement à ces activités, Saigbénan Élisée vend des produits de sérigraphie. La clientèle de Saigbénan Élisée devient de plus en plus grandissante. Afin de perfectionner son activité et d’être plus compétitif sur le marché, Saigbénan Élisée désire acquérir des matériels de travail. Saigbénan Élisée s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin et au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Saigbénan Élisée sollicite une troisième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Saigbénan Élisée, age 35, lives in Bénin. He stopped going to school in secondary school.
Saigbénan Élisée is a widower and the father of three children, some of whom are in school, all of whom are under his care.
Saigbénan Élisée lives alone with his children and he alone cares for their needs and for his own. He learned to paint and decorate and has done so for seven years in his own workshop; his income is not insignificant. On top of this business, he sells silkscreen products. His clientele is becoming larger and larger. In order to perfect his craft and become more competitive, Saigbénan Élisée would like to acquire work materials. He gets his supplies in a village in Benin and in Nigeria. In search of customer satisfaction and in order to increase his business and revenue, he is requesting the financial support of ALIDE for the third time. His two previous loans were paid off well.

loans.use: to buy paint and decorations.

loans.name: Flor De Chachacomani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE CHACHACOMANI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por quince integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Aurora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de repuestos de bicicleta, chofer de taxi, taller de llantería, venta de chuño, venta de carne de ovino, carnicería, carpintería, producción y venta de papa y chuño, tienda de artículos varios.

La señora Aurora, indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la promoción llegada al lugar. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de comida, ella cuenta que hace dos años atrás realiza este negocio en su comunidad, ya que vio que no existía una persona que realice la misma actividad.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para adecuar su espacio de venta (compra de anaquel) mismo que comprará de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es separada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta que el crédito sea fácil.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Flora por razones culturales no quizo ser retratada.
texts.en:
The “FLOR DE CHACHACOMANI” communal bank. It will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Achacachi center. It is made up of fifteen members and is led by a board of directors where Aurora is the president. The members' businesses in the communal bank are varied. Among them we have: selling food, selling bicycle parts, driving a taxi, a tire workshop, selling potato flour, selling sheep meat, selling meat, carpintery, making and selling potatoes and potato flour and a variety store.

Aurora indicates that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer. She joined when it did some publicity where she lives. Right now she has a business selling food, something she says she has done for two years in her community. She did it when she saw there was no one else doing the same activity where she lives.

The loan she will take out now is to improve her sales space (buying some shelves). She will buy it in the city of El Alto and later set it up at her sales space. This work allows her to generate income to support her family as much as possible, because she is separated and has four chidlren.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes how easy it is to get loans.

Flor is not shown in the photograph due to cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy a shelf

loans.name: El Milagro 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the group coordinator for El Milagro (The Miracle) 2. Her story is representative of the others in her group and also more generally of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients. Maria lives in Hato Mayor, a rural area in the Dominican Republic. Her home is compound for her long term partner and her two children.

Maria has successfully completed four and a half years of loans with Esperanza and this is her ninth loan. She sells shoes, clothes, and accessories from her home and by walking around her community and others. She would like to continue expanding her business by increasing her inventory to access more clients and sell more products. She will use this loan to buy many pairs of shoes, sandals, sneakers, and other types of shoes, as well as clothes and women accessories.

She said she enjoys doing business and her most important dream is to finish building her house, which she started by saving her profits after she started her business almost five years ago with her first Esperanza loan. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy shoes and clothes

loans.name: Pinay

texts.en:
Pinay is a 23-year-old married woman with one child. She would like to start growing taro plants to earn a living. Pinay has requested a loan to buy farming tools such as a wheel barrel, knives, and a crowbar. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2012. Pinay will spend her profits to buy more chemicals when she needs them.

loans.use: to buy farming tools such as a wheel barrel, knives, and a crowbar.

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Enercida is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Progreso (New Progress) 1, 2, 3 & 4. Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula, an area with a nascent tourism industry. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. 

Enercida is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Kiva field partner Esperanza International, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and growing her business. She plans to use her portion of this group loan to invest in her cosmetic catalog sales business, and will buy products such as deodorant, body lotion, perfume, and makeup.  Enercida also plans to buy "Paca" (packages of second-hand clothing) to resell.

Enercida plans to save some of her profits in order to be able to build a website for her business.  She wants to improve her business, and the well-known cosmetics company she works for encourages its sales representatives to have websites.

As a member of Esperanza, Enercida joined a borrower group that includes some of her very good friends.  She says all of them are hard workers and dedicated to their businesses. She dreams of having her own house, and of seeing all her children go to school and becoming professionals. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy products such as cosmetics, hair and beauty products

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is Emma, age 50, who is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, in the Philippines. She is married to Manuel, a driver, and she is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Emma sells rice-cake snacks to the local neighborhood. She buys glutinous rice in the market in the morning along with other raw products she needs such as margarine, sugar and coconut. Then she cooks and prepares the snacks and sells them in the afternoon in her local neighborhood. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw products and ingredients she uses in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Emma hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Tasha

texts.en: Tasha is 21 years old and a single lady with no children. She owns and operates a business venture, sewing clothes. She has one year of experience in this line of business. Tasha needs a loan to purchase a new sewing machine, thread, oil and materials to start her business. She hopes to use her profits to save for business needs. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, thread, oil and materials

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a 'tricycle' transportation business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her motorcycle transportation business.

Edna has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from food vending and clothing sales.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. Jocelyn has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Surita

texts.en:
Surita is a 36-year-old woman who is married with two children. She runs a business selling goods and products in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Surita has requested a loan to buy boxes of chicken, sausage, snacks, vailima (a beer) and cigarettes for her shop. She plans to use her profits to help her business and her kids education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken, sausage, snacks, vailima and cigarettes.

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada is married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Librada is 57 years old and has one child who is in school.

Librada has a fishing business in the Philippines. Librada requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Librada has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Librada would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Edix Mercedes

texts.es:
Edix, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para invertirlo en el negocio, se comprará una variedad de mercadería que le permita atender mejor a la clientela, aceite, boquitas, galletas, pan, frijoles, azúcar, de los que se pueden mencionar, porque existe una variedad de productos que son necesarios mantener para las necesidades de los clientes.

Con el credito anterior logró crecer y tener surtido el negocio hasta el momento, creándole una mejor condición en las ventas, obteniendo mejores ingresos que espera de esta nueva deuda poder también tener una buena experiencia.
texts.en:
Edix is requesting a new loan so that she can invest in her business. She will buy a variety of merchandise so that she can provide better service to her customers. Edix will purchase oil, snack foods, cookies, bread, beans, and sugar. As mentioned before, she wants to have a variety of products so that she can keep meeting the needs of her customers.

With her previous loan, she was able to grow and keep her business stocked until now. This created better conditions for making sales and generating more income. Edix hopes to also have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy oil, snack foods, cookies, bread, beans, and sugar.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Peleiupu

texts.en:
Peleiupu is 58 years old and is married with seven children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. 

Peleiupu needs a loan to buy barbed wire fencing, chemicals, nails, a wheelbarrow and a rake. She became a member of SBPD in 2012. Peleiupu will use the profits from her sales to save for her kids fees.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire fencing, chemicals, nails, a wheelbarrow and a rake.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 36 years old and married with three children who are in school. Rhodora works very hard to provide for them.

Rhodora runs a school-supplies business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more school supplies to sell.

Rhodora has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as notebook, pencils, crayons, folder, papers, etc.

In the future Rhodora would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy more school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Elaine

texts.en: Elaine is 40 years old and married with no children. She wants to start a small business making and selling 'elei' (block printed) fabrics in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy painting materials and brushes for 'elei' printing. Elaine hopes to improve her business for her better future. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy painting materials and brushes for 'elei' printing

loans.name: Luzvimnda

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Luzviminda works hard to support her family.

She has a junk shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Luzviminda is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy more recycled materials to sell for her junk shop.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
This is Analiza, 40, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Orlando, her business partner, and mother to their two children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Analiza operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus there is a need for them, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. Analiza rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new computer units, spare parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Analiza dreams of being able to give her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer units, spare parts and supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Saira's Group

texts.en:
Saira assists her husband financially by doing decorative embroidery. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who is a scrap dealer. He operates his business from the nearby market and sells scrap to different factories and to other people and scrap dealers. He is very good in his dealings and his clients are very satisfied with his services. He is also an experienced person in his business and has been operating it for many years.

Saira is hopeful about the better future of her family as a result of her husband’s business improvement.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap selling business

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 53 years old and married with four children.

Violeta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like soap, sugar, soft-drinks and beverages.

Violeta has borrowed and paid for 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 21 years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Violeta aspires to save enough money to have a mini-grocery store at a public market.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like soap, sugar, soft-drinks and beverages.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of clothes and merchandise needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stocks of clothes and merchandise needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
 
Teresita hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise and items needed in her business.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a married with two children. She is 48 years old and lives in Caniangan, Tangub City, Philippines. Brenda owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns PHP 7,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase farm chemicals. 

Brenda has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2010. In the future, Brenda's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like rice, canned goods, detergent and other groceries to sell.

NWTF is listing Josephine's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice, canned goods, detergent and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Selma

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of five children, Selma works hard to support her family. She has a welding shop in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Selma is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her welding machine.

Selma has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her welding machine.

loans.name: Denia Iveth

texts.es:
Denia tiene 26 años, esta casada, vive con su esposo Oscar que se labora en una maquila como mecánico industrial, reside en una colonia de la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Denia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida. Ofreciendo desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, también ofrece baleadas, este puesto lo tiene establecido donde hay afluencia de personas. Lleva 1 año y dice que le ha ido bien ya que este tipo de negocio es rentable porque vende todos los días.
Ella ha solicitado su primer préstamo con Odef de 6,000 lempiras que invertirá en comprar insumos para elaborar las comidas como verduras, carnes, condimentos y refrescos. Esto le permitirá ofrecer más variedad y tener mejor clientela.
Su meta es dar mejor servicio, para tener mejores ingresos y poder comprar un vehículo ya que todos los días paga flete para trasportar los productos.
texts.en:
Denia is 26 years old and married.  She lives with her husband, Oscar, who works in a factory as an industrial mechanic.  She lives in a neighborhood in the city of San Pedro Sula.

Denia makes and sells food.  She sells breakfasts, lunches, and dinners.  She also sells “baleadas” [flour tortillas with beans, eggs, butter, cheese and meat].  She set up her stand where there are a lot of people.  She has been selling food for one year, and it has been going well for her.  This type of business is profitable because she sells every day.

She has requested her first loan with ODEF for 6,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy supplies to make the food.  She will buy things like vegetables, meat, condiments, and soft drinks.  This will allow her to offer greater variety and to have more customers.

Her goal is to provide better service in order to have better income.  She wants to be able to buy a vehicle because she pays to transport her products every day.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, and soft drinks in order to make food.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 55 years old and has five children. Paulina is married and has one child who is in school.

Paulina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Paulina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Paulina has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Paulina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Josefa works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Josefa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Josefa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Pen's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Pen is a 49-year-old mother of four children; three daughters still depend on her and help the family’s business. To support her family, Pen has been involved in rice farming and she has supplemented the family’s income by selling Khmer noodles for 33 years. She is able to earn about 35,600 KHR per day from her current businesses. Lack of a water supply for the farmland is the main challenge for her business. 

Pen’s group consists of two members and this is her first loan with VisionFund while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now Pen is leading the group to apply for a loan of 500,000 KHR each. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizers, rice seeds and to pay for plowing her farmland.  She hopes that the crop yield will become more profitable so as to make more income to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, rice seeds and plow her farmland

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 55 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

Josefina has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from selling vegetables and hog raising.

Josefina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 43 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Nenita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed, poultry vitamins and repair the cage for her ducks.

Nenita has been raising ducks  for 21 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, poultry vitamins and repair cage for her ducks.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a electronic repair business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her electronics shop.

NWTF is relisting Bella's business profile again for this new loan, in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her electronics repair shop.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 52 years old and married.

Merlyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Merlyn has been raising pigs for 14 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
This is Margarita, 43, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She’s married to Ferdinand, an employee, and is the mother of five children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Margarita is a rice dealer. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by sacks or by the kilo. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of rice for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Margarita hopes to have a grocery store someday and she hopes to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of rice needed in her business.

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is 45 years old, married, and has eight children. Three of them work and three of her remaining children are studying. She is a housewife who stays in her home and carries out her household responsibilities. She is very efficient lady and despite her big family, she manages her expenses very well.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a rickshaw driver and wants to change the body of his auto-rickshaw. Shameem is hopeful that by replacing his auto-rickshaw body, her husband will be able to provide better transport services to his passengers and make more profits.

loans.use: To replace the body of the rickshaw.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.

Nancy has been in this business for 20 years. Nancy earns more income from rice retailing.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 62 years old, married and has six children. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Rosalia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

Rosalia has been farming rice for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosalia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en:
Rodulfo is from Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 42 years old. Rodulfo is married and has four children. To make a living, Rodulfo owns & operates a business making & serving a variety of different meals. Rodulfo been in business for three years and earns 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Rodulfo joined GDMPC. Rodulfo is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Sheryl is 43 years old and has two children who are in school.

Sheryl has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines. Sheryl requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more cosmetics for her beauty salon.

Sheryl has been in this business for five years. In the future, Sheryl would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Teodora, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” de la provincia de Urubamba en Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando a la producción y el comercio mayorista de verduras como legumbres y hortalizas, y lo distribuyen en los diferentes mercados de la región, pero también a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Teodora en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar Gallinas y cuyes.
Teodora está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Teodora is a member of the “Reyna de los Angeles” community bank in Urubamba province in  Cusco – Peru.  She works in the production and wholesaling of vegetables, such beans and greens, and distributes them to markets in the region.  She also raises and sells small animals, like guinea pigs and hens. In this loan cycle, Teodora will invest her funds in buying hens and guinea pigs.

Teodora is very grateful to Kiva for helping her and her family achieve a better standard of living and for helping her to strengthen and enlarge her business activities.  She thanks you for your support and promises to pay her installments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy small animals, such as guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Nativedad

texts.en:
Nativedad is 40 years old and married with three children.

Nativedad works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of grocery products to sell.

Nativedad has borrowed and paid for four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for two years and also earns an income from food-vending.

Nativedad aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
This is Bienvenida, 52, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Celso, a technician, and is mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Bienvenida operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and sell them with a little profit. Her products are herbal supplements, soap and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of herbal products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Bienvenida hopes to expand soon, she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of herbal supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Asmin

texts.en:
Asmin, age 38, continues enjoying everything having to do with selling clothes. This is the second loan that Asmin has requested. With the first one she was able to increase her sales and reach more customers. She says that her business is doing so well. At the moment she is running the business alone, but she hopes to hire a helper in the future.

She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. She enjoys her work, and if they call her requesting her services at home, she does that with no problem.

She usually is open Monday through Saturday from seven in the morning until six in the evening. However, she extends her schedule when needed. Her husband is a military officer.

Asmin will use the loan she is requesting to buy more variety of clothes for sale so as to meet her customer's needs. She would like to use the increase in her income to open a boutique.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang, Cambodia, Pov is 31 years old. She has three dependent children, two daughters and one son, all of whom are still in school. To make a living, Pov and her husband have been working as a rice farmers for four years. They can earn about KHR 24,800 per day from their current business. 

Pov is leading the group of two female members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle and successfully paid back the loans. The loan has helped her to better support her family. Now she is applying for a loan of KHR 800,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers, rice seeds and use a portion to pay the fee for harvesting. She hopes that this loan will enable her family to earn a good living and keep the children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds.

loans.name: Nazareth Group

texts.en:
Christina, who is in her early 50s, is married with four children. Two of them go to school and two are grown-ups. She has three grand-children who are still going to school. She has been running a fruit and vegetable business where she also sells daga and salt. She works from 4.00am to 8.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock the missing items in her stock of fruit and vegetables, bought a plot of land, bought some bricks, paid school fees and helped with household expenses. She has paid all her loans back successfully. 

She wants a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables and to buy more bricks. Her dream is to one day to be able to start building her own house, now that she has bought enough bricks. 

Christina will share this loan with her loan group "Nazareth". It has 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables and more bricks.

loans.name: Salomon

texts.fr: Âgé de 33 ans, Salomon vit au Bénin et a très peu fréquenté l’école. Salomon est marié à une couturière du nom de Jacqueline. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Salomon vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme et assure ensemble avec sa femme les différentes charges du ménage. Salomon a appris la peinture-auto, activité qu’il exerce depuis deux ans dans sa région et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. La clientèle de Salomon devient de plus en plus grandissante. Afin de perfectionner son activité et d'être plus compétitif sur le marché, Salomon désire acquérir de nouveaux matériels de travail. Salomon s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin et au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Salomon sollicite une deuxième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Salomon is 33 years old; he lives in Benin and only attended school for a short period.  He is married to a seamstress named Jacqueline.  Salomon and Jacqueline have five children, all in school and their dependents.  In addition to their children, the couple has another child in its care.  Salomon lives with his wife and children and takes care of the various household expenses with his wife.

Salomon is trained as an auto-painter; he has been working in this field for the past two years, in his region.  This professional activity brings him a rather good income.

Salomon has an increasing number of customers.  In order to further improve his business and to become more competitive on the market, he would like to purchase some new equipment.  He buys his materials in a town in Benin and in Nigeria.

In order to meet his customers' needs and to increase his turnover and income, Salomon is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé for the second time.  

His previous loan was duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy paints.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Shirley requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, detergent and other groceries to sell.

Shirley has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Shirley would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, detergent and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
Efrena buys and sells fruits, snack items and some home-use products to earn a living and has been in this business for 11 years. Efrena is 41 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Each month, Efrena earns 8,000 PHP and requested a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2008, she joined GDMPC. In the future, Efrena plans to save her profit for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Jover

texts.en: Jover is from Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 32 years old, is married, and has two children. Jover used his last loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. His business is successful, and he is taking a new loan to pay for the labor cost of farm maintenance. In the future he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost of farm maintenance.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita used her last loan to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor. Her business grew and become successful. Now she's taking care of her transport service business and she is asking for a new loan to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 48 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Florenda has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from tailoring.

Florenda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 46 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora. Está separada del padre de sus dos hijos. Actualmente vive en la casa de su madre, con ella y sus dos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de refrescos, gaseosas y golosinas de diversos sabores y marcas. Esto lo realiza en el frontis de su vivienda donde tiene un puesto, siendo un lugar amplio y cómodo, para eso cuenta con una refrigeradora para mantener heladas las bebidas. Se inició con esta actividad hace más de 3 años, por iniciativa propia, con capital fruto de sus ahorros. Trabaja medio tiempo, ya que la otra mitad del día es empleada doméstica, por ello el resto del día atiende su puesto su madre. Le gusta mucho su negocio, pues disfruta de conversar con las personas, además de los ingresos económicos que le permite pagar los gastos de su hogar y darles una buena educación a sus hijos. Antes de iniciar con esta actividad el sueldo que ganaba no le alcanzaba. Desea seguir creciendo e implementar un local para la venta de comida, ya que siente que es momento.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete a seguir siendo una socia puntual y cumplida como en los créditos anteriores. Y desea seguir trabajando con los socios de su banco comunal, ya que todos son muy amables y solidarios.
Con los 1000 soles solicitados comprará golosinas; como caramelos, galletas, chisitos y otros, en cantidades y al por mayor. También empezará a adquirir los víveres e ingredientes para la elaboración de  las comidas que desea vender.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 46.  She is a very friendly and hardworking woman.  She is separated from her children's father.  She currently lives with her mother and her two children in her mother's house.  She wants to offer her children a better standard of living.

She sells many different flavors and brands of soft drinks and snacks from her porch, where she has a stall, since it is a wide and comfortable space.  She has a refrigerator to keep her drinks cold.  She started this work more than three years ago, on her own initiative, with her savings.  She works half time; the other half of the day, she is a domestic worker.  The rest of the time, her mother staff the stall.  She likes her business very much, since it gives her a chance to talk to lots of people, plus the income allows her to pay her household expenses and to give her children a good education.  Before starting this business, the money she earned did not go very far.  She wants to keep growing and to find a place to sell food--she thinks the time is ripe.

This is her third loan with microfinance partner MFP, and she hopes to keep meeting her targets.  She promises to keep paying punctually, as with her previous loans.  And she wants to keep working with the members of her community bank, since they are all very friendly and civic-minded.  With the 100 soles ($400), she will buy snacks, such as candies, cookies, and Chisitos in large quantities.  She would also like to start acquiring the means and ingredients to make the food she wants to sell.

loans.use: to buy snacks and soft drinks for her food stall.

loans.name: Cinthya Vanessa

texts.es:
Cinthya es una mujer soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias al apoyo de sus padres Cinthya pudo estudiar satisfactoriamente la carrera profesional de Veterinaria, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las calurosas calles de la ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos deliciosos Juanes (plato típico de su ciudad) para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, gracias a las enseñanzas de su madres, día a día Cinthya puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, tales como: cecina, chorizo, tacaco y otros potajes típicos de su ciudad, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y puede atender a un promedio de 20 clientes, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien ya que sus clientes la buscan por su buena sazon y por su trato amble.
Cinthya se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una congeladora e insumos, tales como: carne de cerdo, condimentos, hojas de bijao, entre otros; de esta manera Cinthya tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado y podrá conservar mejor los ingredientes para sus potajes, con ello espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales desea utilizar para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Cinthya is a single woman who lives with her parents and siblings in the city of Pucallpa.  She is a very friendly, hard-working, enthusiastic woman who has a great desire to do well in life.  Thanks to the support of her parents, Cinthya was able to study for a degree in veterinary science.  In her free time she enjoys going out for walks in the warm city streets and she sometimes cooks a delicious meal of 'Juanes' (a typical dish in her city) to share with her family.

With a lot of effort, having learned from her mother, Cinthya set up a small business selling food such as pork sausage, chorizo, 'tacacho' and other local dishes.  She works around eight hours a day and can serve an average of twenty customers.  She feels happy in her work and she believes that things are going well because her customers seek her out owing to the good flavor of her food and her friendly service.

Cinthya is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy a freezer and supplies such as pork, seasonings, bijao leaves, etc.  This will improve her business and the ingredients she uses in her dishes will keep better.  She hopes, as a result, to increase her sales and her income.  She wants to use this income so that she can have her own home in the not-so-distant future.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and supplies

loans.name: Nuvy Grace

texts.en:
Nuvy Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell in her food stall.

NWTF is relisting Nove Grace's business profile for another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Wapita

texts.en:
Wapita is 38 years old, married, and has four children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Wapita has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Wapita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

Wapita has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Wapita would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina works hard to support her family. Angelina is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Angelina requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy utensils and ingredients for her business.

Angelina has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Angelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy utensils and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en:
Ma. Corazon is 56 years old and married with one kid. Ma. Corazon works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Corazon runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Ma. Corazon has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future Ma. Corazon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, age 50, is married and has six children, aged between 10 and 28 years.Three of her children are in school. She resides in the town of Samburu, Kenya.


For over ten years, Lucy has been selling "omena" (small dried fish) retail. She started out selling on a small scale, but as time passed, she invested her earnings in the growth of her business.


Lucy is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 KES to restock her inventory and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to see an improvement in her earnings, so for this reason, she continues to work very hard despite her advanced age.

loans.use: to purchase more fish

loans.name: Hayde

texts.en:
Hayde is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Hayde has been in this business for 10 years. Hayde earns more income from fish and dried fish retailing.

Hayde has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Jeannilyn

texts.en:
Jeannilyn is 48 years old and has seven children. Jeannilyn is married and has three children who are in school.

Jeannilyn is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jeannilyn has been farming rice for eight years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jeannilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 42 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Julieta has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from fish retailing.

Julieta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela is a very talented lady who sews clothes to financially assist her husband who is a plumber by trade. She has got great sewing skills and knows about the latest fashion trends which helps her fulfilling the clients' needs and making a reasonable profit every month.

Shakeela has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Both of her sons are earning while her daughter is studying. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan investment he will buy plumbing tools, taps, pipes, etc. to improve his services.

He is very experienced and Shakeela is confident about his business success in future.

loans.use: To buy plumbing tools for plumbing business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 40 years old and married with 4 children.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell in her general store. Mary Jane has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Mary Jane aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nouratou Monradeké

texts.fr: Agée de 52 ans, Nouratou Monradeké est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont trois sont encore à l'université. Elle dispose d'une boutique dans laquelle elle vend des chaussures et des pagnes depuis 05 ans. Elle fait ses achats dans les marchés extérieurs et ses clients sont composés des togolais et des béninois. Afin de renforcer son activité et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a bénéficié un prêt à Finadev. Le présent prêt lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et d'épargner.
texts.en:
Nouratou Monradeké is 52 years old.  She is married and the mother of four children, three of whom are still in college.

She has a shop in which she has been selling shoes and pagnes (colorful West-African fabrics) for the past five years.  She buys her goods in surrounding markets and sells to customers who come from Togo and Benin.

In order to strengthen her activity and to meet her customers' expectations, she has requested and obtained a loan from Finadev.

This current loan will allow her to contribute to her children's education and to save some money.

loans.use: to buy 12 pairs of shoes, 8 handbags, and 10 "pagnes".

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is 28 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Laila works very hard to provide for them. 

Laila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, bread, soft drinks, sugar, etc.

In the future Laila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 54 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lita has been farming rice for 30 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 42 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is 43 years old and married with 5 children.

Sherlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. Sherlita has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from vegetable retail.

Sherlita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of 6 children, Agnes works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Agnes is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her food vending business.

Agnes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for her business

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en:
Aireen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business. Aireen has been in this business for one year. Aireen earns more income from raising chickens.

Aireen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 53 years old and married with 2 children. Amelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store. Amelita has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from raising chickens and direct selling Avon products.

Amelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Kantutas De Los Andes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTAS DE LOS ANDES” iniciará el desino octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felipa es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, ayudante de minibús, tejido de mantas, atención de saumerío, venta de conservas, trenzado de mantas, taller de carpintería.

La señora Felipa, indica que hace un año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de sus hermanas que son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas, ella cuenta que este negocio lo inicio en sus constantes viajes a la frontera de Perú y Bolivia, donde vio que esta actividad era escasa en ese lugar es por eso que inicio este negocio hace seis años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la ampliación de su mercadería (compra de lana) mismo que adquirirá de los almacenes de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es divorciada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la institución porque son prestamistas de dinero.
texts.en:
The “Kantutas de Los Andes” Communal Bank will begin its eighth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the “Centro Focal de Los Andes”.  The group is comprised of eight members and managed by a board of directors where Felipa is Secretary.  The members of the communal bank carry out varied businesses including owning a neighborhood store, working as an assistant minibus driver, selling woven blankets, providing incensing services, selling preserves, selling braided rugs, and a owning a carpenter’s shop.

Felipa says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for one and a half years and was invited to join by her sisters who are members of the institution.  Currently, she is in the business of braiding and selling rugs.  She says that while making frequent trips to the border of Peru and Bolivia, she noticed that this type of business was limited in this area and this is why she started her business six years ago.  

She is taking out this loan to expand her stock of merchandise (wool), which she will purchase from the shops in the city of El Alto for later sale in her sales space.  This type or work will allow her to support her family in the best possible way because she is divorced and has three children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the institution because they are money lenders.
.

loans.use: to purchase wool.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is 40 years old, married and the mother of eight children. She works hard to provide for her family by selling Avon and Natasha products to people in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 22,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell. Cynthia has taken out and repaid eight previous loans from NWTF, and has been in this line of work for 16 years. Her goal is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en: Phorn lives in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 40 years old and has four children, three daughters and one son, all of whom live at home and attend school. To earn a living, Phorn works as a rice farmer and supplements her income by planting cassava. She has been in these businesses for 25 years, and is able to earn about KHR 36,100 per day. She has taken out and repaid two loans from VisionFund, while the other member of this two-person loan group is requesting her first loan. They are hoping to improve their lives by borrowing 2,000,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR, respectively. As the group leader, Phorn will use a portion of this loan to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and insecticides to protect her her farmland. She hopes that the price of cassava will increase so that she can earn enough money to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides to protect her farmland.

loans.name: Nab Yiiri Group

texts.fr:
Mme RASMATA représente le groupe NAB YIIRI. Sur  la photo, c’est la trésorière qui a levé la main. La représentante est en tenue blanc avec bébé au dos. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 01an 06mois. 01 va à l’école et elle a 02 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des céréales (haricot) depuis 05ans. Mme s’approvisionne à YAKO au BURKINA. Ses clients  sont les femmes restauratrices et les grossistes.

Mme veut s’acheter  01 sac d’haricot.

Elle désire renforcer  son activité avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne avoir une voiture dans le futur pour faciliter son travail.
texts.en:
Rasmata is the representative of the NAB YIIRI group.  In the photo, it is [not her, but the] the group's treasurer who is raising her hand.  

Rasmata is dressed in white and carrying a child on her back.   She is married and the mother of two children; the oldest is 10 years old and the youngest 18 months.  One of her children goes to school and she has two people in her care.

Rasmata has been selling grains (beans) for five years.  She buys her merchandise in Yako, Burkina Faso.  Her clients are wholesalers and women involved in the preparation of meals.

She wants to buy one bag of beans.

Rasmata would like to use her profits to strengthen her activity.  In the future, she would like to own a car, to make her job easier.

loans.use: to buy 1 bag of beans.

loans.name: Rosa Marilu

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en la calurosa y muy linda ciudad de Pucallpa, la cual se ubica en nuestra selva peruana y alberga mucha variedad de flora y fauna muy maravillosa, es una ciudad en la cual uno puede desconectarse del bullicio de la ciudad, sobre todo porque podemos apreciar paisajes maravillosos. Rosa es madre, su hijo tiene 15 años y ella es madre y padre para el ya que el padre de su hijo la abandono y desde ese momento ella se armo de mucho valor y sobre todo mucho amor de madre para sacar a su hijo adelante. Rosa en su tiempo libre disfruta de comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “arroz a la cubana”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo estudio hasta el tercer grado de educación secundaria y le hubiera gustado ser diseñadora de modas, por ello ella trabaja muy duro para que su hijo sea mucho mejor que ella.

Día a día Rosa trabaja en su negocio de servicio de costura, ella elabora prendas y también realiza composturas; trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día. Ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y siempre hace su trabajo con gusto.

Rosa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda como colocar piso de cemento, reforzamiento de paredes, entre otros; de esta manera su vivienda será más segura y mejorara su calidad de vida, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y luchar para poder ver hecho realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su fábrica de confecciones”.
texts.en:
Rosa is a great hardworking woman who loves in the warm and delightful town of Pucallpa, a city located in the Peruvian jungle with an impressive flora and fauna. It’s a city where one can disconnect from the noise of the city and appreciate the beauty of nature since its scenery is very beautiful. Rosa is a single mother: she has a 15-year-old son to whom she is both mother and father because her husband has abandoned them. From that moment she has striven with great courage and above all with deep motherly love in order to provide for her child. In her free time Rosa likes eating one of her favorite dishes, the delicious “arroz a la cubana” (rice with fried plantain and fried meat). Owing to her meager economic resources she has been able to study up to the third grade of secondary education only, but she would have liked to become a fashion designer, and for this reason she works very hard so that her son can become a better professional than herself.

Rosa works day by day in her sewing shop, creating clothes as well as making repairs. She works around 10 hours a day and she can tend to up to 20 customers per day. She thinks her activity is going well because she is very kind and she always loves what she does.

Rosa is deeply grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to make some improvements to her house such as putting a cement floor, reinforcing the walls and other works. In this way her house will be safer and her standard of living will improve, so that she will continue working and fighting to make her biggest dream come true: “To have a dressmaking factory of her own”.

loans.use: To make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has earned a living for the past 20 years by running a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She supplements her income by growing vegetables and sugar cane. She is requesting a loan for PHP 40,000 to buy spare parts for her vehicle. Marina has run her business through hard work and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her business.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
César tiene 57 años, es un hombre bueno, amable y muy empeñoso. Está casado con Rosa, quien es comerciante, tienen diez hijos, a quienes crió y educó de tal manera que ya todos son independientes. Actualmente vive en su casa, a lado de su esposa, a quien desea seguir brindándole una mejor calidad de vida para así poder tener juntos una vejez tranquila.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de zapatos, zapatillas y sandalias, tanto nuevos como de segundo uso. Para ello cuenta con un pequeño local alquilado en una zona comercial de su localidad, donde atiende a sus clientes y también ofrece el servicio de arreglo de zapatos. Cuando se inició solo vendía los usados, pero con el tiempo fue incrementando su capital y ahora puede vender nuevos. Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 6 años y desea continuar haciéndolo por muchos años más, pues y le gusta y tiene la libertad de poner su propio horario y días de trabajo. Tiene buenas ventas y eso le permite tener buenos ingresos. Espera, en el futuro, aumentar su capital y su stock de mercadería para ver crecer su negocio.

Este es su crédito número 9 con MFP y está contento de contar con este apoyo financiero para continuar con sus objetivos. Se compromete, una vez más, a pagar las cuotas de manera responsable. Y comenta sentirse muy cómodo en su banco comunal, ya que sus compañeros de grupo son muy responsables y siempre se solidarizan con los demás.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará más zapatos para su negocio, de esa manera  aumentar la variedad que ofrece.
texts.en:
César, 57, is a good, kind, and very diligent man.  He is married to Rosa, a merchant, and they have ten children who they have raised and educated in such a way that they are already independent.  At the moment he lives in his home along side his wife, to whom he wishes to continue offering a better quality of life so that they can have a quiet old age together.

His work consists of selling shoes, sneakers, and sandals; both new and secondhand.  He relies on a small rented space in a commercial area of his town, where he takes care of his customers and also offers a shoe repair service.  When he began he only sold used shoes, but with time his capital increased and now he can sell new shoes.  He has been doing this work for more than six years and wants to continue doing it for many more years since he likes it and has the freedom to set his own schedule and work days.  He has good sales and this allows him to have a good income.  In the future he hopes to increase his capital and his stock of merchandise in order to see his business grow.

This is his ninth loan with MFP and he is happy to have this financial support in order to continue with his goals.  Once again, he promises to make his repayments in a responsible manner.  He also says he feels very comfortable in his communal bank since his group members are very responsible and always sympathize with others.

With the requested amount, 1000 soles, he will buy more shoes for his business and this way increase the variety that he offers.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to continue selling.

loans.name: Melaluna

texts.en: Melaluna is 29 years old, married and the mother of four children. For the last eight years, she has worked hard to provide for her family by selling cellphone accessories in the Philippines. She supplements her income by selling food and by fishing. She has requested a loan for PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. Melaluna has borrowed and repaid three previous loans from NWTF, and hopes to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more cellphone accessories to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ria Alma

texts.en: Ria is the married parent of five children, and works hard to support her family by selling food items. She supplements her income by raising pigs. Ria is requesting a loan for PHP 13,000 from NWTF to buy more ingredients for her food-vending business. She has sustained this business with help from three previous loans from NWTF, and hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items for a food-vending business.

loans.name: Ronesa

texts.en:
Ronesa is 59 years old and widowed with three children.

Ronesa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store.

Ronesa has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Ronesa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 50 years old and married with 13 children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell to her general store.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jocelyn aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell to her general store

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Loida has been in this business for eight years. Loida earns more income from farming rice and raising pigs.

Loida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional spare parts for her motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Laura, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” de la provincia de Urubamba en Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la cual expende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, y  leche entre otros productos. Laura en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar mercadería y surtir su comercio.
Laura está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su actividad.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Our associate Laura belongs to the communal bank "Reyna de los Angeles" in the province of Urubamba, Peru. Our associate has a grocery store where she sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, beans, milk and other products. With this opportunity, Laura will invest her loan in the purchase of merchandise and stock her store. Laura is very grateful to Kiva for giving her a better quality of life for her family and for helping her grow and strengthen her business activity. Our associate appreciates the loan and promises to meet her repayments on time.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, beans, milk and sodas.

loans.name: Marry Rose

texts.en:
Marry Rose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Marry Rose has been in this business for five years. Marry Rose earns more income from farming vegetables and direct sales of Boardwalk products.
