Marry Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 32 years old, married to Ruth, and blessed with two children that he supports. He has run a welding and spare parts shop for the last three years. His monthly income is KES 20,000. 

He has applied for a loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to acquire more stock of metals for use in his business.

He intends to use the anticipated profits to get more variety of business items. His future dream is to have a stable business, educate his children, and improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of metals for welding work.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 52 años, es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está separada del padre de sus hijos y actualmente vive en su casa propia, la que compró con sus ahorros de varios años en compañía de su actual pareja.

Su negocio es el alquiler de locales comerciales, para eso tiene dos espacios que acondicionó en su vivienda que está ubicada en una zona comercial. Uno ya lo tiene alquilado y en el otro está realizando algunos arreglos para poder alquilarlo nuevamente. Se inició hace más de 9 años, con una capital propio, fruto de sus ahorros, invirtió en su casa pensando en su futuro, contando con el apoyo de su pareja que la apoya con la administración. Decidió a empezar este negocio debido al avance de los años, pues sabe que no tendrá acceso a un empleo, ni jubilación, y esta actividad no necesita mucho esfuerzo físico.

Este es su préstamo número 17 con la institución MFP y está agradecida al saber que seguirá contando con el apoyo financiero para avanzar. Además, comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables y amables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para el arreglo de las paredes y puertas de su local, además del pago de la mano de obra por el arreglo y pintado del local.
texts.en:
Julia is 52 years old, she is a fighter and a hard worker, with a desire to get ahead. She is separated from the father of her children and currently lives in her own house which she bought with the savings of several years being with her current boyfriend. 
Her business is to rent to local business and to do this she needs to repair two spaces that are connected to her house which is located in a commercial district. She already has one of the two that she rents out and she is trying to get the second through savings in order to rent it out again. She started more than 9 months ago with some of her own money, her savings, and invested in the house thinking in the future, counting on the support of her boyfriend who helps with the administrative work. She decided to start this business because of her advanced years, as she knows she won't have access to employment, nor retirement and this activity does not require much physical activity. 
This is her 17th loan with MFP and is grateful to know that she can continue to count on this financing in order to advance. Furthermore, she comments that she likes her communal bank because she knows the members and considers them responsible and friendly people.  With the requested money, she will reinvest in the purchase of construction materials to repair the walls and doors of her location and also pay for the labor to fix the walls as well as paint them.

loans.use: repair walls and paint her store which she will then rent out.

loans.name: Boymurat

texts.en: Boymurat is glorious and cute. For more than 12 years he has been busy with animal husbandry. He buys cattle, cares for them and then sells to local people. In the local market he has a lot of customers. He has enough experience developing business and that’s why his business has been developing year by year.  He has a lovely wife and 2 smart children. His wife helps him with the business. They want to repair their house because it has bad conditions. He is asking for a loan to buy building materials for repairing the house. He waits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Farah's Group

texts.en:
Farah has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who runs a printing press. With the loan investment he will repair his printing machine and also purchase some printing tools to further improve his business. He is very good at his work and never compromises on quality. Due to his good work he receives regular orders every month.

Farah is hopeful that that by repairing his printing machine, her husband will be able to provide improved services to his clients and make more profits from his business.

loans.use: To repair printing machine for printing business

loans.name: Uzima Group

texts.en:
Mwarani, who is in his early 30s, is married with two children who go to school.  He has been running a business selling chips since 2007.  He works from 7.00 am to mid-night daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be his 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to make and sell more chips, bought a plot of land, bought iron sheets, paid household expenses and has paid back both his prior loans successfully.  He wants a loan to  buy a sack of Irish potatoes and make more chips to sell. His dream is to one day be able to build his house.

loans.use: to buy a sack of Irish potatoes and make more chips to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa Maria de 46 años de edad,  soltera, con tres hijos bajo su cargo, tiene por actividad brindar servicio de salon de belleza ubicado en su casa de habitacion experiencia que la adquirio  desde  hace 20 años , el negocio lo inico con esfuerzo propio de unos ahorro, y ayuda de un hermano que esta fuera del pais, en la actualidad ha logrado mantener el negocio gracia al  buen servicio que le brinda a su cliente, su entrega al trabajo ya que ella ama lo que hace, lo que cual le ha ayudado a superarce dia a dia, ella esta solicitando el fiananciamiento para la invertir en compra de material de material de trabajo como: tintes, brochas, alisadores, planchas, maquillajes, crema para pediquiur, tratamiento para el cabello entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosa Maria is 46 years old and is a single mother of three.  She makes a living by offering services at her beauty salon situated in her home and has gained experience by doing this for the past twenty years.  

She started her business on her own with some savings and help from her brother who lives in another country.  Her business has been successful thanks to the good service she provides her clients, her work ethic, and loving what she does which has helped her better herself day by day.  

She is seeking a loan to invest in work material such as dye, brushes, straighteners, irons, makeup, pedicure cream, and hair treatment among other items.

loans.use: to purchase dye, brushes, straighteners, irons, makeup, pedicure cream, and hair treatment among other items.

loans.name: Susan

texts.es:
Susan tiene 26 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, además de tener decisión y ganas de salir adelante. Su pareja es Carlos, el padre de su única hija, Danja de 7 años. Viven en el local alquilado para su negocio y lo que más desea es trabajar para poder brindarle a su hija una buena educación.

Se dedica a la venta de zapatos y zapatillas de segundo uso. Su local está en una zona céntrica de la ciudad por lo que es muy concurrido; además su mercadería la trae desde la capital y son modelos novedosos y baratos. Inició hace más de 8 años y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja, pues se siente muy feliz cuando vende todo. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta por el respaldo financiero para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Sabe que tendrá que ser muy responsable y sobre todo muy puntual con sus cuotas. Y se siente contenta de pertenecer su banco comunal, ya que ve que son muy solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará más zapatos para damas y caballeros, buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Susan is 26 years old and is a simple and hard working woman on top of being decisive and having the desire to get ahead. Her boyfriend is Carlos, the father of her only daughter, Danja, who is 7 years old. They live in the same space they have rented for their business and the thing she wants most is to work in order to give her daughter a good education. 

She sells new and second hand shoes. Her store is located in the central district of the city and so it is well-visited. She brings her merchandise from the capital and the shoes are usually new styles and cheap. She started his business 8 years ago and until the present has been working alone. She considers her business profitable because of the earnings she makes and so she is happy when she is able to sell everything in stock. In the future, she hopes to have a larger store that she can sell her merchandise from in more comfort. 

This is her second loan with MFP and she is very happy for the financial support she has received that has helped her increase her working capital. She knows she will have to be responsible and, above all, punctual in her repayments. She is happy to belong to a communal bank as there is solidarity among the members. With the requested money, she will purchase more shoes for men and women, looking for the best deals so that her sales increase in volume.

loans.use: purchase more shoes for men and women.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 51, has a grocery store where she sells groceries such as cabbages, bananas, etc. Every day she sells on a cash basis and also buys her products in cash. She is assisted by her daughter when she goes for teaching children in her private nursery school. However, she operates the grocery fully during the weekends.
 
Everyone living nearby congregates at Jane's store because it is a nice, friendly place and they feel well cared for, which is a growing sentiment among her clientele. Therefore, as her business grows, buying more volume in cash becomes increasingly difficult.

This is why Lucy has turned to Yehu for another Kiva loan. This will allow her to keep a stock of daily consumption products, since she has to have enough inventory to respond immediately to her customers, who are mothers who must prepare food for their families. 

She will use her loan to buy more groceries for sale. Her loan is sure to be successful because she is basing her request on market demand, and her suppliers will give her discounts for buying more volume and paying in cash. This will be beneficial to Jane's income.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 51 years old.  She is married to Wilson and jointly tends to their family .She has five children between 28 and 16 years. She has a cereals business and has been in operation for thirteen years, earning a monthly income of KES.17,000.

This is her third loan of KES.50,000 from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loans. She will use the loan to purchase dry maize, beans, peas and millet for resale. With the anticipated profits, she plans to pay school fees for her children and use the rest for sustaining her family.

Her dreams and hopes are that her business prospers and in future extends to a wholesale cereals business.

loans.use: To purchase dry maize, beans, peas and millet for resale.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel de 45 años de edad, casada, con un hijo de tres años de edad, tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace 19 años. Maribel ya ha tenido crédito con león 2000 y ha demostrado responsabilidad, honradez, solvencia moral,  los financiamiento le han sido de mucha ayuda para el crecimiento económico de su negocio ya que ha podido invertir en capital de trabajo, el préstamo lo está solicitando para la compra de productos del consumo diario como: aceite, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, huevo, leche, pan, tortas dulces, condimentos, hielo, leña entre otros.
texts.en: Maribel is 45 years old, married, with a three-year-old child. She has a small grocery store that has been located in her house for the past 19 years. Maribel has had a loan of 2000 Leon and has shown herself to be responsible, honorable and moral. The loan has provided a lot of help to her with growing her business as she could use it as working capital. With the loan she is requesting, she will purchase products for daily use such as oil, rice, beans, sugar, eggs, milk, bread, sweet pies, condiments, ice, and firewood among other items.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, beans, sugar, eggs, milk, bread, sweet pies, condiments, ice and firewood among other items.

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: Marlon Antonio de  43 años de edad de la localidad de Chinandega, soltero con 5 hijos, inicio su negocio desde hace 18 meses dedicándose a la compra y venta de repuestos de bicicleta ubicado en el mercado de su localidad El financiamiento lo quiere para comprar llantas, neumáticos, pega, tornillos, bomba de aire, parches entre otros.
texts.en: Marlon Antonio, age 43, is from Chinandega. He is single and has five children. Eighteen months ago, he started his business; he buys and sells bike parts at a store located in his region. He wants a loan for the purchase of tires, rims, glue, a pump, patches, and other items.

loans.use: to buy tires, rims, glue, screws, a pump, patches, and other items.

loans.name: Mauricio Francisco

texts.es: El señor Mauricio francisco casado de 66 años de edad, con dos hijos menores de edad, tiene por actividad económica una pulpería desde hace 5 años, el cual está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Inicio el negocio para mejorar sus niveles de vida, sus sueños y metas es crecer más su negocio para así vender más y poder incrementar sus ingresos el financiamiento lo quiere para invertir en capital de trabajo como: arroz, azúcar, leña, pan, huevos, jabón de baños, jabón de lavar, frutas, verduras, productos de consumo diario para el hogar.
texts.en: Mauricio Francisco is 66 years old, married and has two dependent children.  He has been running a grocery store in his home for five years.  He started the business to improve his standard of living.  His dreams and goals are to further grow his business so that he can sell more and increase his income.  He would like this loan to invest in buying rice, sugar, firewood, bread, eggs, soap, laundry detergent, fruit, vegetables and other staples.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, firewood, bread, eggs, soap, laundry detergent, fruit, vegetables and other staples

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad tiene 40 años, es una mujer buena y amable. Está casada con Eduardo, quien se dedica al transporte, y tienen dos hijos, quienes son su razón de esfuerzo y trabajo. Juntos viven en su casa propia y lo que más desea es poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de comida como tallarines, frituras, pescado asado y otros; también vende golosinas y gaseosas variadas. La venta la realiza a diario en un centro educativo donde le permitieron tener un puesto interior. Inició hace más de 3 años y hasta el momento lo viene realizando con el apoyo de su esposo y su hijo, ocasionalmente, además de una ayudante de cocina a quien paga por semana de trabajo. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la continua clientela que tiene y las buenas ganancias que le deja. Heredó la sazón de su madre, quien le dio las lecciones sobre cómo cocinar y como realizar buenas ventas. Espera seguir trabajando para progresar y salir adelante con su familia, tiene muchos planes, pero por el momento espera la expansión de su negocio.

Este es su crédito número 17 con MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Por su parte, se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual, como en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Y se siente muy a gusto de poder trabajar con su banco comunal, ya que son buenos y muy responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, 2000 soles, comprará los ingredientes y víveres para la preparación de sus comidas como carnes, arroz, aceites y otros. También golosinas para ofrecer mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Natividad, 40, is a good and kind woman.  She is married to Eduardo, who makes a living through transportation, and they have two children who are their reason for strength and work.  They live together in their own home and what she most wishes for is to be able to offer a better quality of life to her family.

Her work consists of selling food like noodles, fried food, and grilled fish.  She also sells various candies and sodas.  She does her selling daily in an educational center where they allow her to have an indoor stand.  She began more than three years ago and until now she has been doing it with the support of her husband and son, occasionally, in addition to an assistant cook who she pays for her work weekly.  She considers her business profitable enough due to the continuous customers she has and the good profits it leaves her with.  She inherited the seasoning from her mother, who gave her lessons about cooking and how to have good sales.  She hopes to continue working to progress and to get her family ahead in life.  She has many plans, but at the moment she waits for the expansion of her business.

This is her 17th loan with MFP, therefore she hopes to continue with her goals.  For her part, she promises to make her repayments in a timely manner, as she did with the previous loans she has had.  And she feels very at ease working with her communal bank because they are good and responsible people.

With the requested amount, 2000 soles, she will buy ingredients and supplies for the preparation of her food, like meat, rice, oils, and others.  She will also buy candies in order to offer a greater variety.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her food and candy for her stand.

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Originally from the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, Soeurn is 61 years old. She is married with four children, three (two daughters and one son) of whom are still dependent on her for support and are helping the family’s businesses. Soeurn grows paddy rice as the main source of income and supplements her income via planting cassava, raising pigs, and working for others for a fee. She has been with these businesses for 20 years and is able to earn approximately KHR 62,700 per day. 

As the latex from rubber trees always gets a high price, Soeurn plan to grow rubber trees to earn extra income. Therefore, she is applying for the first cycle loan with VisionFund in amount of KHR 4,000,000. She hopes to grow her rubber tree healthfully so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: To buy rubber tree seedlings for planting

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Shaker

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has three children.

Since 2005, Shaker has owned a small shop for selling cigarettes . He has sufficient experience in this field, a good understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to renovate the shop and install an external ceiling. He is aiming to develop his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the shop and install an external ceiling

loans.name: Rozina's Group

texts.en:
Rozina knows the art of artificial jewelry. Her home is located in a big jewelry market of the city which also helps her capture a wider audience for her business.
Her husband lives abroad and she lives with her mother and 3 children. Her 2 elder children are studying, while her youngest daughter in only 3 years old.
She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her jewelry-making business. With the loan investment she will buy jewelry-making items such as thread, beads, etc., in larger quantity and better quality.  That will allow her to complete larger orders on time. She is very experienced and expectant that she will be able to make huge profits on this EID (holy day), which is coming soon.

loans.use: To buy jewelry-making items for jewelry  business

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, age 26 years old and married.

Karar has owned a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $3,000 as a youth loan in order to install shutters and two window closets. He also wants to buy a refrigerator. 

He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to install shutters and two window closets in his market. He also wants to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Judith Audrey

texts.fr: Judith Audrey vit avec son époux et ses quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés dans une école de la place. Le plus âgé a 16 ans et le moins âgé a 08 ans. Avec un niveau d'instruction secondaire, elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente des fleurs, des amuses gueules et des jouets depuis quelques années. Elle se ravitaille dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci de satisfaire la forte demande de ses clients qui s'accroît de jour en jour compte tenu du bon emplacement de sa boutique, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev afin de maximiser son profit et de renforcer son stock. Le bénéfice lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et de leurs assurer une bonne éducation.
texts.en:
Judith Audrey lives with her husband and her four children, who all attend the local school. Her eldest child is 16 years old, and her youngest child is 8 years old.

With a secondary school education, she specialized in the sale of flowers, appetizers, and toys a few years ago. She stocks up at one of the markets in Benin.

Striving to satisfy her clients' strong demand, which is growing daily thanks to the strategic location of her shop, she sought and obtained a micro loan from Finadev in order to maximize her profit and increase her stock. The profits will allow her to help pay for her children's schooling and ensure that they receive a good education.

loans.use: to buy 30 toys, 12 bottles of appetizers, and 20 toys

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia de 34 años de edad, con dos hijos menores de edad, soltera tiene por actividad ecomomica una fritanga venta de comida tipica de la  su pais ( tacos, enchiladas, tajadas, maduro, gallo pinto, carnes asadas)  ubicada en su casa de habitacion, tiempo de tener el negocio 6años, el cual lo aprendio de sus padre y lo inico con esfuerzo propio, en la actualidad esta solicitando el fiananciamiento para la  invertir el el negocio comprado productos para la elaboracion de su comida.
texts.en: Rosa Emilia is 34 years old and single with two children.  She makes a living selling traditional food of her country (tacos, enchiladas, fried unriped and ripened plantain slices, and roasted meats).  Her business is located in her home, and she has had it for 6 years.  She learned the business from her parents and started it through her own efforts.  Currently she is requesting financing to invest in the business so she can buy products to make her food.

loans.use: to buy products to make her food.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es: El banco comunal el triunfo esta comformado por 8 integrantes todos tienne actividad economica diferentes los integrantes son: Graciela, Leyda, Lucrecia, Celso, Maria, Amparo, Imara, Aurelia. Leyda del carmen es la coordinadora del banco comunal la cual se encarga de la union del grupo la comunicación la responsabilidad entre todas, Leyda tiene por actividad economica la elaboracion y venta de artesania ubicada en su comunidad, el financiamiento lo quiere la compra de materia prima. Pinceles, pintura, barro, ollas, arcillas. Entre otros.
texts.en:
The El Triunfo community bank is made up of eight members who all work doing different things.  The members are: Graciela, Leyda, Lucrecia, Celso, Maria, Amparo, Imara, and Aurelia.

Leyda del Carmen is the coordinator of the community bank, which means she is in charge of the group meetings and communication among the members.  Leyda works making and selling crafts in her community.  She will use this loan to purchase primary materials, brushes, paint, clay, pots, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase primary materials, brushes, paint, clay, pots, and other items.

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es: G.S DIVINO NIÑO NO 10,esta conformado por dos integrantes  Dolores, y Rosa Emilia  tienen varios años de trajar con fundacion leon 2000 lo cual han demostrado ser responsables, trabajadoras, con solvencia de pagos,  por lo tanto en esta ocacion han  sido beneficiada con el programa kiva, lo cual les ha permito incrementar su mercaderia en general  ya que es la actividad a la que se dedica, el financiamiento lo invertiran el la comprar de mercaderia para la sastifaccion de sus clientes como: vestidos, faltas, ropa de ñino, vermudas, camisolines, ropa interior, jugos de sabanas, pantolones de mujer de hombre entre otros.
texts.en: The solidarity group Divino Niño #10 comprises two members: Dolores and Rosa Emilia. They have been working with Fundacion Leon 2000 for several years and have proven themselves to be responsible, hard-working, and solvent in their payments. Therefore, this time they have benefited from the Kiva program, which has allowed them to increase their merchandise in general, which is what they sell. They will invest the financing in purchasing merchandise in order to satisfy their customers, such as: dresses, skirts, children's clothing, shorts, slips, underwear, sheet sets, men and women's pants, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase dresses, skirts, children's clothing, shorts, slips, underwear, sheet sets, men and women's pants, and other items.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonia reside en la ciudad de Ibarra, capital de la provincia de Imbabura, ubicada al norte de la Sierra ecuatoriana. La ciudad cuenta con 181.175 habitantes y es el centro de desarrollo económico del norte del Ecuador. La ciudad tiene una riqueza única de cultura y naturaleza, por lo tanto es una zona turista muy importante del país. La ciudad es conocida por el helado de paila que por su peculiar forma de ser mantienen un sabor a fruta natural que los han hecho famosos alrededor del país. Ibarra también es conocida por un dulce de mora conocido como arrope. El clima de la ciudad es sub tropical con una temperatura que varía de 12°C a 32°C. 

José Antonio de 62 años de edad vive con su esposa Zoila de 51 y sus dos hijos. A pesar de solo haber terminado sus estudios primarios, él fue aprendiz de un zapatero, y con su experiencia en el área abrió su negocio de elaboración de calzado hace 40 años. Desde entonces, trabaja todos los días de la semana para sacar al negocio adelante. Por la dedicación que pone a su trabajo,  José tiene varios clientes especialmente academias militares. José Antonio tiene fe en que su negocio puede crecer. Sin embargo, no ha tenido suerte recibiendo crédito para invertir en su él. Por lo tanto, solicita un crédito a Kiva para poder comprar más materia prima, producir más zapatos, e incrementar sus ingresos. El planea comprar cuero y suelas. De esta manera mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia y brindará un mejor futuro para sus hijos.
texts.en:
José Antonia lives in the city of Ibarra, capital of Imbabura province, located in the northern part of the Ecuadorian highlands. The city has 181,175 inhabitants and is the center for economic development in northern Ecuador. 

The city has a unique wealth of culture and nature, so it is a very important tourist area of the country. The city is known for "helados de paila" (fruit sorbets), that because of their uniqueness retain the flavor of natural fruit. This has made them famous around the country. Ibarra is also known for a blackberry sweet called "arrope." The city's climate is sub-tropical, with a temperature that varies between 12°C and 32°C. 

José Antonio is 62. He lives with his wife Zoila, 51, and his two children. In spite of only having finished primary school, he was apprenticed as a shoe-maker, and with his experience in the area, 40 years ago he opened his shop making footwear.  Since then, he has worked every day of the week to keep his business going. 

Because of the dedication he puts into his work, José has several customers, especially military academies. José Antonio has faith that his business can grow. However, he has had no luck getting credit to invest in it. Therefore he is applying to Kiva for a loan so that he can buy more raw material, produce more shoes and increase his income. 

He plans to buy leather and shoe soles. In this way he will improve his family's quality of life and offer his children a better future.

loans.use: To be able to buy more raw materials.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Una vitrina que saca afuera de su casa es la que utiliza para exhibir sus productos, el se dedica a vender enchiladas unos de los alimentos mas comunes de la ciudad así es como se gana la vida Alexander un humilde habitante de Estelí, de 31 años de edad, el de oficio operador en micro computadoras también se dedica al comercio desde hace 3 años. Inicio su actividad con capital propio, anteriormente trabaja en un restaurante de la comunidad, del dinero que ahorro de su trabajo decide establecer su propio negocio en su casa de habitación,  este ha sido su primer negocio el cual saca adelante con el apoyo de su mama que le ayuda a atender a sus clientes.
Requiere el préstamo para comprar harina, carne, tortillas, aceite, verduras, etc, toda la materia prima necesaria para elaborar las ricas enchiladas, el estima que el crédito será de ayuda porque podrá invertir mas en su inventario para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, sus planes futuros es ampliar el área de su negocio y llegar a tener su bufet donde pueda ofrecer variedad de comida a sus clientes, su meta próxima es llegar a tener su propia casa para poder ser alguien independiente con el objetivo de vivir cómodamente y poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Alexander brings a display cabinet outside his house and uses it to show his products. He works selling enchiladas, one of the most common dishes in the city. That is how he earns a living. Alexander is a humble resident of Estelí, he is 31 years old, and is a microcomputer operator by profession. He has also been in business for three years. He started his business with his own capital. He used to work at a local restaurant, and decided to use the money he saved from his job to set up his own business at home. This has been his first business venture, and he is managing to keep it going with support from his mother, who helps him see to his customers. 
He is requesting the loan in order to purchase flour, meat, tortillas, oil, vegetables, and all the raw materials he needs to make his delicious enchiladas. He estimates the loan will be of help because he will be able to invest more in inventory so that he can satisfy his customers' demand. His plan for the future is to expand his business area and to one day have his own buffet, where he could offer a variety of food to his customers. His short-term goal is to own a home so that he can become independent. His aim is to live comfortably and manage to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase flour, meat, tortillas, oil, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 32 years old, married, and blessed with two children that she supports. For the last five years, she has been running a grocery store where she sells assorted vegetables, fruits and cereals, getting a monthly income of KES.20,000. 

She has applied for a loan of KES.60,000 from KADET LTD, with which she plans to restock and expand her grocery store, especially buying more green vegetables and dry maize to sell. The anticipated profits will be plowed back into the business for expansion. Her future dreams is to be successful in life

loans.use: to  buy more green vegetables and dry maize to sell.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is married and has two children, ages 11 and 7. She has always wanted to give them a good quality of life. That is why she has had her own business for approximately four years. She started it with a great deal of effort. She sells charcoal as retail. By doing this she has managed to financially contribute to her household so that her family has a better quality of life and greater financial opportunities to get ahead.

She wants to start a new business of selling secondhand clothes. The loan will allow her to buy bundles of clothes for sale.

This way she will manage to have good sales and offer her customers a good variety of products. Also, she will continue to have guaranteed household income for her children to continue having access to a quality education.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: La Sra. Felicia tiene 27 años y es casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 10 y 4 años, ella se dedica a la venta variedad de comidas en su puesto de venta que se encuentran ubicado en una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Felicia va a usar este préstamo para la conexión de alcantarillado para tener un baño en su domicilio, ya que esto le permitirá contar con un servicio básico en su casa y así brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para adquirir lo necesario, la Sra. Felicia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, y utilizara los beneficios para revestimiento y construcción de un baño y ducha, la Sra. Felicia se siente feliz con esta oportunidad que le brindan, ya que hará su sueño realidad que es contar con un baño terminado.
texts.en: Felicia is 27 years old, she is married and she has 2 children aged 10 and 4. She sells different kinds of food in a stall located in a very well-trafficked area of Cochabamba. This is the first loan she is requesting to our institution. Felicia will use it to pay for the connection of a sewer system to have a bathroom in her house, as this will allow her to have a basic service in her house thus granting a more comfortable environment to her family. The reason she is requesting this loan is that she does not have enough money to buy what is needed for the job. Competition is the challenge Felicia has to face in her activity, and she will use the profits to reinvest in the construction of a bathroom with shower. Felicia is happy about this chance that she has been given, as she will make her dream come true by having her bathroom completed.

loans.use: To  pay for the connection of a sewer system to have a bathroom in her house.

loans.name: Maria Del Trancito

texts.es: Maria del Transito de 40 años de edad del municipio de somotillo, tiene por actividad economica la venta de ropa usada, desde hace 4años , la cual distribuye de forma ambulante, el cual inicio con ahorros propio y por la necesidad de tener una herramienta de trabajo para obtener ingresos para su familia, y asi seguir luchando dia a dia para ayudar a sus hijos  y que lleguen a ser profesionales y poder cumplir con su metas y sueños, gracias al apoyo que leon 2000 y el programa kiva ofrecen a los pequeños emprendedores para  para poder tener una herramienta de trabajo propia.
texts.en: Maria del Transito, 40, is from the town of Somotillo.  She's had a business selling used clothing for 4 years. She sells from place to place, and she started the business with her own savings so that she could have a way to work and obtain income for her family.  This way she can continue to strive each day to help her children so that they can become professionals and she can accomplish her goals and dreams, thanks to the support that Leon 2000 and Kiva are offering to entrepreneurs with small businesses so that they can have a tool for their own work.

loans.use: to buy packages of used adult and children´s clothes

loans.name: Angela Edamira

texts.es: Angela Edamira de 62 años de edad soltera del municipio de chinandega , tiene por actividad ecomomica la venta de ropa,tiempo de tener el negocio 17 años , el negocio consiste en la venta de : ropa variada, camisas, pantalones faldas, vestidos, camisetas, zapatos, chinelas el cual distribuye de forma ambulante, herramienta de trabajo que la inicio de tener un medio de trabajo para poder sacar  a sus hijos adelante, en la actulidad ha cumplido con sus sueños como es ver forjados a sus hijos.
texts.en: Angela Edamira is 62 years old. She is single and lives in the town of Chinandega. Her business is selling clothing products. She has had the business for 17 years. The business consists of selling a variety of clothing, shirts, pants, skirts, dresses, T-shirt, shoes, and flip-flops, which she sells as an itinerant vendor. She created this source of employment to have a means of work to be able to raise her children. Now she has achieved her dream, to see her children grown.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as skirts, dress shirts, pants, dresses, shoes and sandals

loans.name: Amalia Del Socorro

texts.es: Amalia del Socorro de 59 años de edad tiene por actividad economica comerciante, esta emprendedora ha demostrado ser responsable, trabajora de buenas costumbre, en la actualidad ella  esta solicitando financiamiento para mejoras  en su lugar de trabajo, para brindarle mejores condiciones a sus clientes, con el financiamiento comprara material de construccion como: bloques, ladrillos, zinc, arena, cal, hierro, pintura, madera, clavos   entre otros.
texts.en: Amalia del Socorro is 59 years old and she is a retailer. This entrepreneur has proven herself to be a responsible and hard-working person with good values. She is currently requesting a loan to improve her work place in order to offer a better environment to her customers. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy blocks, bricks, zinc, sand, nails and other materials.

loans.use: To buy blocks, bricks, zinc, sand and nails.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds to prepare the soil for planting.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La Sra. Victoria tiene 49 años y tiene  4 hijos que son de las edades de  16; 9; 7 y 5 años, ella es agricultora se dedica a la siembra de sandia y frutales en su parcela que se encuentran en la localidad de Colonia Porvenir,  este préstamo es el primera secuencia de la institución, la Sra. Victoria va a usar este préstamo para la siembra de sandia y el preparado de la tierra para la siembra, la Sra. Victoria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios para aumentar su producción,  la Sra. Victoria vende sus productos en el mercado de la localidad directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en:
Victoria, 49, has four children whose ages are 16, 9, 7 and 5.  She’s a farmer who grows watermelons and fruit in her field located in Colonia Porvenir.  This loan is the first sequence in the institution and Victoria will use the loan for her watermelon crops and to prepare the soil for planting.  

Victoria faces the business challenge of improving her quality of life and will use profits to increase production.  Victoria sells her products in the local market directly from producer to consumer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to prepare the soil to plant watermelons.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Dominga, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” de la provincia de Urubamba en Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando a la producción y el comercio mayorista de verduras como legumbres y hortalizas, y lo distribuyen en los diferentes mercados de la región, pero también a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Dominga en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar algunos productos como tomates, cebollas y zanahorias para surtir su oferta.
Dominga está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member is Señora Dominga, she belongs to the communal bank Reyna de los Angeles (Queen of the Angels) in the province of Urbamba in Cusco, Perú.  The member continues making a living through the production and the wholesale of vegetables like legumes and garden vegetables, and she distributes them in the different markets of the region.  But she also makes a living by raising small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  With this opportunity Dominga will invest the requested loan by buying various products like tomatoes, onions, and carrots, in order to stock up her offerings.

Dominga is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to provide a better quality of life to her family and for helping her with the growth and strengthening of her work.  The member is grateful for the loan and promises to complete her repayments according to the timeline.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, onions and carrots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Sayramby

texts.en: Sayramby is a woman who is trying to find new ways to earn income. She is beautiful, jolly and plodding. She had a business selling vegetables, but it did not satisfy her. Sayramby is going to organize a new business selling fabrics. She has enough experience to develop a new business. Her selling place will be situated in the local market. She must work hard because she is the only breadwinner in the family, as she is divorced. She has a child and tries to do the best for him. She is asking for a loan to buy goods for the new business. She waits your help and support.

loans.use: To buy goods for a new business

loans.name: Khnoeurn

texts.en: Khnoeurn, is 40 years old, living in a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district of Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She has one daughter and one son, both of whom are still her dependents and in school. To support the family, she has been involved in rice farming and cassava planting for twenty years. She can earn about 63,600 KHR per day from her current business. Khnoeurn is applying for her first loan of 3,000,000 KHR with VisionFund. With this loan she is going to buy fertilizers for her field. She hopes to earn more income from the cassava business, live in a better conditions, and keep the children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
Gloria tiene la edad de 43, hoy en día madre soltera, con dos hijos estudiantes, su negocio lo inicio hace veinte años, en el norte en apawas con dinero que mi esposo dio y ahorros, su negocio es la venta de queso, cuajada, crema al por mayor, obteniendo mejores ganancias. Para ella fue difícil la muerte de su marido, porque era él, quien le ayudaba en su negocio, a vender, a cargar, ahora paga un ayudante.
Este financiamiento es con el propósito de comprar más queso en Quinientas libras y trescientas cuajada, para fortalecer su negocio, el cual vende en un mercado de la capital todos los días al por mayor y libreado. Contenta por esta inversión y Afodenic por este crédito otorgado, permitiendo obtener mejores resultados económicos en su hogar.
texts.en: 43-year-old Gloria is a single mother [widowed] and has two children who are students. She started her business twenty years ago, in the north, in Apawas, with money that her husband gave her and some savings. Her business is selling cheese, cuajada and cream wholesale which makes her good profits. Her husband's death was hard on her because he used to help her in her business, selling and carrying. Now she pays an assistant. Gloria's aim for this loan is to buy more cheese in 500lb lots and cuajada in 300lb lots, in order to strengthen her business. She sells her products in a market in the capital city. She sells wholesale and by the pound. She is happy to be making this investment and grateful to Afodenic for the loan as it will allow her to make more money for her household.

loans.use: to buy cheese and cuajada

loans.name: 010305-Bắc Sơn- Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thu  operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Thu is 41 years old.  She is married and has 2 children..
She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 010305-Bắc Sơn- Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. 
Thu  supports 2 dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Thu  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thu  has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thu  has been involved in this business for 4 years. The main hardship that Thu  faces in her business is the lack of capital.  In the future, Thu  hopes to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is forty-seven years old.  She is widowed and has two children. She runs a farming business.  She has been in this business for thirteen years, earning monthly income if twenty thousand shillings. 

This will be her third loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use it for purchasing farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer.  She plans to use the anticipated profit to improve her farming.  She hopes to become a competitive farmer in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nushrivan

texts.en:
Nushrivan is 62 years old, married, and has three children.

He has owned a food market since 1999, selling foodstuffs and fancy goods. He has sufficient experience in this field, a good understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. Nushrivan has a good reputation in the trading sphere. 

He is requesting a loan of AZN 1500 in order to purchase goods for the store and to increase his business to provide a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To purchase goods for the store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate the cafeteria

loans.name: 010304-Bắc Sơn- Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bích operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Bích is 50 years old.  She is married and has 3 children..
She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 010304-Bắc Sơn- Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. 
Bích supports 1 dependent with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.   Two other children are grown up.

In 2002, Bích joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Bích has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Bích has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Bích faces in her business is the lack of capital.  In the future, Bích hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shelving and to lay flooring

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche,galletas y dulces,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este trbajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y galletas al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Tomasa continues to operate her grocery store. She sells products of primary necessity such as rice, sugar, milk, cookies and sweets. Tomasa works from 7:00 am until 8:00 pm. As a result of this work, she advances her children. Tomasa's dream is to expand and improve her grocery store business.

Tomasa is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies at wholesale. She is grateful to all who form part of this dream by this means and she promises to comply with her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Qodirjon

texts.ru:
Кодирчон житель города Вахдат. Ему 30 лет. Он живет вместе с женой. У него двое детей. 
Кодирчон занимается животноводством. Он занимается этим видом деятельности четыре года. Первый раз Кодирчон начал свою деятельность в 2009 году, когда он закупил крупнорогатый скот по низкой цене и через несколько месяцев продал по более выгодной цене. 
На сегодняшний день Кодирчон разводит скот у себя дома. 
Кодирчон берет кредит для закупа несколько голов бычков в дальнейшем для продажи.
texts.en: Qodirjon is a resident of the city of Vahdat.  He is 30 years old, lives with his wife, and they have two children.  Qodirjon is involved in animal husbandry.  He has been in this business for four years.  Qodirjon first started his business in 2009, when he purchased cattle at a low price and then sold it several months later at a more advantageous price.  Today, Qodirjon breeds livestock at home.  He is requesting this loan to buy several bulls for future resale.

loans.use: to purchase several bulls

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.en: Odiljon is very successful businessman. For more than 7 years he has been busy with animal husbandry. He has enough experience to develop business and that’s why his business has been developing year by year. He buys cattle, cares for them and then sells to the local market. He has many customers because he sells at a low price. All his customers are happy with his cattle as his cattle are fat and well-cared for. He has a large family.  His wife helps him with the business. They have 6 children and try to do the best for them. He is asking for a loan to buy young cattle for developing the business. He waits your help and support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for developing his business

loans.name: 010302-Bắc Sơn- Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngọc operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase net for fishing.

Ngọc is 49 years old.   She is married and has 3 children.  She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 010302-Bắc Sơn- Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group.  Ngọc supports 1 dependent with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  Two other children are grown up.

In 2008, Ngọc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Ngọc has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Ngọc has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Ngọc faces in her business is the lack of capital.  In the future, Ngọc hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and to buy a cell phone.

loans.use: to purchase net for fishing

loans.name: Prima

texts.en: Prima is 46 years old, from Cortes, Bohol. She is married to a carpenter and they have four children together. Her eldest is 18 and her youngest is 3 years old. Prima makes baskets and raises hogs for an income. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of PMI feed necessary to fatten her hogs. A loan will definitely boost her business, she will be spared worrying if she has to buy feed on a per kilo basis. Her income will be for her children's healthy diet and school fees.

loans.use: to buy sacks of PMI feed

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 37 years old and married to Esther. They are blessed with two children, aged 14 and 10 years. 

Nicholas has been into a green tea leaves selling business for the past three years. He earns a monthly income of KES 20,000 from the business.

This is his third loan of KES 100,000 with KADET LTD after successfully repaying his previous loans. He intends to use the loan for purchasing green tea leaves for resale. 

With the anticipated profits from the business, he plans to save so as to pay school fees for his children and use the remaining amount to sustain his family. 

His hopes and dreams are to own a retail shop and a butchery.

loans.use: to purchase green tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: 020309-Bắc Sơn- Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Giang operates a food stall/restaurant selling shrimp sauce. She is requesting a loan to purchase shrimp sauce for resale. Giang has been involved in this business for five years.

Giang is 27 years old and she is married with two children.

She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 020309-Bắc Sơn- Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. 

Giang supports two dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Giang joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Giang faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Giang hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase shrimp sauce for resale.

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de nourriture dans une école de la place depuis 2003, Madame Amivi est mariée à un instituteur et ils ont eu ensemble 03 adorables enfants. Ils sont âgés de 17,14 et 11ans et sont tous sur les bancs de l’école. Elle rencontre par moments un problème de mévente. Elle sollicite ce crédit de WAGES pour s’approvisionner en ingrédients rentrant dans la préparation du jus et de la nourriture. Elle voudrait avoir une activité pérenne et prospère, avoir une vie confortable.
texts.en:
A food seller in a local school since 2003, Ms. Amivi is married to a primary school teacher, and they had three adorable children. They are 17, 14 and 11 years old, who are all in school. 

Ms. Amivi sometimes runs into the problem of a drop in sales. She is requesting this WAGES loan to stock up on ingredients for making beverages and food. She would like to have a sustainable and prosperous business and a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making beverages and food

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en: Felomina is 49 years, old from Cortes, Bohol. She is married and has seven children. Her husband works as a farmer in Manga, and Felomina helps by raising hogs near her house. She is asking for a loan to buy feed, another piglet to raise, and supplements to prevent diseases that are common to pigs. Felomina hopes that someday she can renovate her barn and she can have more animals to raise for a bigger profit. Her income will be for family daily consumption and school fees.

loans.use: to buy feed, another piglet to raise, and supplements

loans.name: Nasim

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 27 years old, and is married. Nasim has been an owner of a motorcycle repair shop since 2000. He sells and repairs motorcycles. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding area.

He is requesting $3000 as “Youth Loan” in order to pay the annual rent. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent

loans.name: 010104-Hợp Tân- Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyệt works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise. Nguyệt is 60 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 010104-Hợp Tân- Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group.  Nguyệt has her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  Her children are grown up.

In 2001, Nguyệt joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nguyệt has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nguyệt has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nguyệt faces in her business is the lack of capital.
In the future, Nguyệt hopes to maintain  a successful business, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

loans.name: Lawoé

texts.fr: Madame Lawoé est mère de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. Son conjoint est retraité. Vu que les temps sont difficiles elle voudrait avec l’appui de son mari assurer les besoins nécessaires de ses enfants c’est pour cela elle a commencé depuis 04ans par vendre des détergents en gros à ses clients à domicile. Une personne l’aide et elle rencontre par moment des problèmes de mévente. Elle est à son second crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour s’approvisionner en marchandises. Elle veut assurer la pérennité de l’activité et avoir une vie meilleure.
texts.en:
Ms. Lawoé is the mother of three children, of whom two are in school. Her spouse is retired. Given that times are tough, and with the help of her husband, she would like to meet her children's necessary needs. This is why she started selling detergents in bulk four years ago to her customers at her home. One person helps hers, and she sometimes runs into problems with a drop in sales. 

She is on her second WAGES loan and is requesting this loan to stock up on merchandise. She wants to ensure that her business is sustainable and to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy detergents

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is 52 years old. She lives in a small village of Samtredia District with her family: her husband,Grigol, her 29-year-old son, her daughter-in-law and her granddaughter. Grigol works at a railway station and gets a monthly salary. Mzia and her son are busy with agricultural activities. They have 4 milking cows and a calf. They produce cheese, part of which is used by the family members and the rest which is sold locally. They also have a plot of land, where nuts are grown. They sell approximately 100 kg of nuts seasonally. 

Mzia’s son wants to become a goldsmith. With the requested credit they will purchase a golden gauge and other necessary tools to start learning the new business. Mzia thinks that her son will be a good goldsmith and he will have many orders. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income they will be able to create better living conditions for the family members.

loans.use: to purchase a golden gauge and other necessary tools

loans.name: Blavi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes  et tissu depuis 2005 dans un quartier de la place, Madame Blavi est mariée à un chauffeur. Elle a en charge un enfant âgé de 06ans qui fréquente. Avec cette activité elle parvient à subvenir à ses moindres dépenses. Madame Blavi sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour s’approvisionner en pagne de différentes variétés afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients. Elle veut épargner pour acheter un terrain, devenir grossiste, vivre dans l’aisance  avec sa famille.
texts.en:
A retailer of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) in a local neighborhood, Ms. Blavi is married to a driver. She supports one child, 6 years old, who attends school. 

With this business, she is able to cover her lesser expenses. Ms. Blavi is requesting this initial loan to stock up on 'pagnes' of different types in order to satisfy her customers further. She wants to save money to buy a plot of land, become a wholesaler, and live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to buy 'pagne' cloth and fabrics

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 28-year-old single lady who supports her schooling siblings. She has run a tailoring and clothing shop for the last three years, getting a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, with which she plans to restock her shop with a variety of fabric materials.


The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into the business for expansion. Her future dream is to be successful in life

loans.use: to purchase additional fabric for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun is still farming. Thanks to his occupation he is able to provide for his family. Harutyun used his first Kiva loan to buy some chickens, rabbits, calves, piglets and fodder. Thanks to his farm development he bought a car which he uses to transport the farm's meat and milk products to food markets in Ijevan city. 

Now Harutyun is asking for a $3,000 loan to buy two more cows for his farm and also a large lot of fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy two more cows for his farm and also a large lot of fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Baghdasar

texts.en:
Baghdasar and his family are still farming. Thanks to his agricultural business, Baghdasar is able to provide for his large family. 

He used his first Kiva loan to buy animal feed. Now he needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy a large lot of fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: to buy a large lot of fodder for his farm animals.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 30 years old and from Cortes, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 6 and 2, and a baby on the way. Her husband, Remegio Jr., works in Manila in a garment factory to support his family. 

Melanie helps in providing for her children by cooking snack food, which she sells in Cortes. She cooks rice cakes and pancakes for an income. She is also into raising hogs for a profit. 

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, and sticky rice, and also hog feed. A loan will help support Melanie's business to be sustainable while meeting the needs of her two young children. 

Her income goes towards her family's healthy diet and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, and sticky rice, and also and hog feed.

loans.name: Antony Harold

texts.es:
Antony tiene 19 años de edad, vive en la alegre ciudad de Chincha, caracterizada por ser una de las ciudad de donde habitan la gran mayoría de descendientes afroperuano, es una ciudad en la cual se baila el festejo, el landó y la zamacueca, bailes muy típicos de nuestro país, sus pobladores son expertos en la preparación de comidas ya que tienen una buena sazón, podemos encontrar playas hermosas y sobre todo su clima es cálido. Cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta escuchar música y también realizar lectura de sus cursos ya que el está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Industrial y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos; también le gusta en algunas ocasiones comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cuales s la riquísima Carapulcra con sopa seca.

Día a día Antony trabaja como obrero en una empresa de venta de productos para construcción, el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias ya que en las noches acude a su centro de estudios; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y sobre todo atiende bien a los clientes.

Antony está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracia a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de estudio como libros, calculadora, separatas, maquetas, entre otros, de esta manera el podrá seguir estudiando y luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Culminar su carrera y tener un pequeño negocio”.
texts.en:
Antony is 19 years old and lives in the cheerful city of Chinca.  Chincha is noted for being a city with one of the largest Afro-Peruvian populations in the country.  It is a city in which people dance traditional dances such as the festejo, landó and zamacueca.  The local people are experts in preparing tasty food.  In this area we find beautiful beaches and, above all, a hot climate.  Whenever he has a little free time, Antony enjoys listening to music and reading course literature because he is studying for a degree in industrial engineering.  He covers his expenses through his work.  Antony also sometimes enjoys eating one of his favorite dishes: 'carapulcra con sopa seca'.

Antony works day by day as a worker for a company that sells building supplies.  He works around eight hours a day because he studies at night.  He believes that he is doing well in his work because he is responsible and serves customers well.

Antony is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to buy study materials such as books, a calculator, offprints, models, etc.  This will enable him to continue studying and working hard to make his biggest dreams come true: to finish his degree and own a small business.

loans.use: to buy study materials (books, a calculator, offprints, models, etc.)

loans.name: Pedro Joaquin

texts.es:
Pedro es un joven de 28 años de edad, casado, padre de un hijo de 4 años, su esposa lo apoya en su negocio, el cual vende comida diario por las tardes y por la mañana trabaja de acarreo en cargas oh botando basura el cual tiene su caballo con su carreta de estos ahorros comenzo la venta de comida, estando en mejores condiciones, al poder tener estas ventas, ya que de las ganancias nos surtimos para nuestro alimentos.
El todas las tarde tiene un lugar fijo en una rotonda de la capital, en donde ofrece variedad de comida en tacos, pollo asado, carne, salchichón, tajadas verdes y madura, gallopinto, refrescos y gaseosa, por tal razón está optando al financiamiento para poder hacer más variedad de comida en comprara: Carne, pollo, salchichón en mas cantidad, un quintal de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, bidón de aceite frutas y verduras para seguir ofertando sus ricos platillos, obteniendo la captación de más clientes y que gracias a Afodenic será posible la inversion.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 28-year-old young man. He is married and has a four-year-old son. His wife helps him with his business, where he sells food daily in the afternoons. In the morning he works as a freight carrier or hauling trash, for which he has a horse and cart. With the savings from this work he started selling food. His situation has improved with this business, since the sales profits allow him to provide sustenance for his family.
In the afternoons, he has a set spot at a roundabout in the capital, where he offers a variety of food: tacos, roast chicken, meat, sausage, fried green and ripe plantains, gallopinto (a rice and beans dish), soft drinks, and soda. He is requesting financing in order to be able to offer even more variety. He will purchase meat, chicken, greater quantities of sausage, 100 pounds of rice, sugar, beans, a large can of oil, fruits, and vegetables, so that he can continue offering his delicious dishes and gain more customers. Afodenic will make this investment possible.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, sodas, fruit, and vegetables, in order to offer more food to sell.

loans.name: Wendyalgdo Group

texts.fr:
Mr  SALIFOU est responsable du groupe WENDYALDO. Marié, il est père d’un enfant, âgé de 02ans. Il ne va pas à l’école et il a 02 personnes en charge.

Mr vend des plats en plastiques  depuis 06ans. Il s’approvisionne au marché de Larlé et à Sankaryaaré. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

Il veut s’acheter  10 douzaines de bouillard et 10 douzaines de gobelet.

Mr veut investir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il ambitionne  mieux agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Salifou is the representative of the Wendyaldo group. He is married and has a two-year-old child. He did not attend school and has two people under his care.

Salifou has worked selling plastic plates for the past six years. He gets his supplies in the market in Larlé and in Sankaryaaré. His customers are both male and female, and he plans to buy 10 dozen kettles and 10 dozen cups.

Salifou wants to invest his profits in his business. He plans to expand his business and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy 10 dozen kettles and 10 dozen cups.

loans.name: Rognooma Group

texts.fr:
Mme MAMOUNATA est responsable du groupe ROGNOOMA. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a08ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. Un va à l’école et elle a 02 personnes en charge.

Mme tisse et vend des pagnes tissés  depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter  une balle de laine et  50 pagnes tissés.

Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices pour agrandir son activité. Elle ambitionne améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mamounata is the head of the Rognooma group. She is married, and has two children. Her oldest child is 8 and the youngest is 2, and one of them goes to school. She has two people under her care.

Mamounata has worked weaving and selling woven “pagnes” (traditional wrap-around cloth) for the past three years. She gets her supplies in a market in the area known as Sector 10, and her customers are both male and female. She wants to buy a ball of wool and 50 woven pagnes.

Mamounata wants to save her profits in order to expand her business, and she plans to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a ball of wool and 50 traditional woven wrap-around cloths.

loans.name: Arely Maria

texts.es:
Arely de 33 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Estelí, casada, madre de dos hijos que están a su cargo, ella realizo estudios hasta quinto año de secundaria, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de nacatamales desde hace 3 años. Inicio su negocio con dinero propio, anteriormente trabajaba en un restaurante de la comunidad a la edad de 28 años, de los ingresos que obtuvo de su trabajo decide establecer su propio negocio en su casa de habitación, este ha sido su primer negocio el cual saca adelante por si sola pues no tiene apoyo de nadie, Arely dice que se encuentra satisfecha con su venta de nacatamales ya que es un negocio rentable, genera ingresos diarios además cuenta con clientes fijos. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar leña, maíz, carne, cebolla, papas, etc. Toda la materia prima que se necesita para elaborar y darle el sabor a sus nacatamales, ella dice que el préstamo será de ayuda pues podrá invertir en su inventario, incrementara su producción y podrá obtener mejores ingresos para la familia, sus planes futuros es llegar a tener su casa propia para  tener un mejor nivel de vida y ser alguien independiente, sus metas próximas es diversificar su negocio en otros lugares de la comunidad, pues su deseo es llegar a ser una de las mejores comerciante de la zona con el objetivo de mejorar sus ganancias y poder ofrecerle una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Arely, 33 years old, lives in the town of Estelí. She is married and has two children who are in her charge. She studied until the fifth year of secondary school. She has been selling natacamales (steamed corncakes, a popular Nicaraguan dish) for 3 years. She started her business with her own money, earned while working at her previous job, a restaurant in the community. At 28, she decided to set up her own business with this money in the house where she lives. This is her first business, which she runs successfully on her own, since she is not helped by anyone. Arely says that she is satisfied with selling natacamales because it is a profitable business: she makes money every day and has many returning customers. She asks for this loan to buy firewood, sweetcorn, meat, onions, potatoes, etc. These are all the ingredients needed to make natacamales and give them flavour. She says that the loan will help her because it will enable her to invest in her inventory, increase production, and obtain a better income for her family. Her plans for the future include having her own home to be able to have a better standard of living and be independent. Her next goal is to establish her business in other places in the community, since she would like to become one of the most successful entrepreneurs in her area in order to increase her earnings and be able to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy firewood, sweetcorn, meat, onions, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru: Тамара-старается успевать во всем, так как она одна воспитывает своих маленьких детей.Её муж находится в России на заработках и видимо его дела идут плохо, что он не присылает семье деньги на проживание.Тамара откармливает крупно-рогатый скот и производит кисло-молочные продукты и продает их.Кроме того у неё дома постоянно есть молоко, чему её дети очень рады и сыты.Первый кредит она  использовала на покупку одной коровы и таким образом увеличила свое поголовье.Это ее основной доход и благодаря этим видом деятельности она намного улучшила свою жизнь.На полученный кредит она  хочет купить скот и дальше развивать свой бизнес. Сотрудничает с нашей организацией более 2 года.Целенаправленно использовала все кредиты и надеется работать с нами в дальнейшем.
texts.en: Tamara tries to succeed at everything because she is raising her small children by herself.  Her husband is working in Russia, and apparently things with him are not going well because he does not send money to the family for living expenses.  Tamara fattens up cattle and makes and sells dairy products.  Besides this, she always has milk at home, which makes her children happy and full.  She used her first loan to purchase one cow, which helped her to increase the livestock headcount.  This is her primary source of income, and, thanks to this business, she significantly improved her life.  She wants to use this loan to purchase livestock and continue developing her business.  Tamara has been working with our organization for over two years.  She used all of her loans as intended and hopes to work with us in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Gbétogo Yvonne

texts.fr: Agée de 28 ans, Gbétogo Yvonne est mariée et mère d'un enfant non encore scolarisé. Elle a une buvette où elle vend des boissons de la SOBEBRA depuis 02 ans et fait ses approvisionnements dans les dépôts de SOBEBRA les plus proches de son fonds de commerce. Expérimentée dans le crédit, elle a fait recours au financement de Finadev en vue de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire et de répondre favorablement aux demandes de ses clients. L'intérêt généré par son activité lui permettra de participer aux dépenses du foyer et d'épargner.
texts.en:
Gbétogo Yvonne is 28 years of age, married, and has one child who is not yet in school. She has a refreshment stand where she has sold SOBEBRA-brand drinks for two years, and she gets her supplies from the SOBEBRA depots closest to her business. 

Gbétogo Yvonne has prior loan experience, and has requested financing from Finadev to increase her sales and meet customer demand. The interest generated by her business will allow her to contribute to paying the household expenses and to save.

loans.use: To buy 50 crates of assorted drinks.

loans.name: Tamawe Group

texts.fr: Aidé par 09 personnes dans l’exécution de son activité (agriculture) Mr Katawili est né en 1965. Il est marié à une cultivatrice et ont ensemble 18 enfants dont 15 scolarisés. Il est à son troisième crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour s’approvisionner en outils de travail afin d’avoir un bon rendement. Notons qu’il est dans ce domaine il y a 30ans et il maitrise bien les saisons pour savoir qu’elle récolte faire en cette période. Toute son activité est basée en RÉGION CENTRALE et il s'y plait bien car cela lui permet de nourrir la population en générale et sa famille en particulier. Avec les profits réalisés, il souhaiterait construire un logement, augmenter la superficie cultivable et prendre soin de la famille. Tous sont dans l’agriculture et leurs cultures se font en saison. Ils cultivent le mais, le riz, le sorgho et le soja. Les autres membres du groupe veulent assurer les besoins élémentaires de leurs familles.
texts.en:
Katawili was born in 1965, and is helped by nine people in his agricultural business. He is married to a farmer, and together they have 18 children, 15 of whom are at school. This is his third loan from WAGES, and he has requested the money to buy work tools so that he can have a good crop. 

Katawili has been working in this area for 30 years, and he is able to handle seasonal change well so he knows what crop to harvest in each period. His entire business is based in the Central Region, and he enjoys it because it allows him to provide food for the local population in general and his family in particular. 

Katawili would like to use his profits to build a house, increase the land on which he grows his crops, and take care of his family. Everyone works in agriculture, and their crops are seasonal. They grow corn, rice, sorghum and soybeans. The other members of the group want to make sure that their families’ basic needs are met.

loans.use: To buy work tools.

loans.name: Léonie's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Léonie, la responsable, est âgée de 37 ans. Mariée et mère de 03 enfants scolarisés, elle a une boutique où elle vend des sacs et des chaussures dames depuis 03 ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. En vue de renforcer son fonds de commerce et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev. Ce financement lui permettra de maximiser son profit et de participer à l'éducation de ses enfants. Léonie se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This group has two members who jointly guarantee the loan. Léonie is the head of the group, and is 37 years of age. She is married and has three children who are at school.

Léonie has a store where she has sold bags and ladies’ shoes for the past three years. She obtains her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. To increase her working capital and meet the needs of her customers, she has requested and obtained a loan from Finadev. This loan will allow her to maximize her profits, and to provide for her children’s education. Léonie is pictured to the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy 30 bags and 15 pairs of ladies’ shoes.

loans.name: Gavhar
