texts.ru: Гавхар- женщина с высшим образованием.У неё семья, дети и любящий муж.Гавхар работает в частной школе преподавателем начальных классов.У неё достаточно опыта работы и стаж, любит и знает свою профессию очень хорошо.Её муж работает на мельнице  несколько лет и имеет постоянную работу.Хотя они работают непрерывно и имеют стабильный доход,семья не может накопить деньги на стройку своего дома. Им нужно  построить дополнительные комнаты для сыновей, они уже стали взрослые и скоро родители поженят их.Для таких расходов Гавхар с мужем решили обратится к нам за кредитом.Это её не первый кредит и она уже знает все условия кредитования и не подводила  нас.Старается целенаправленно использовать кредит  и вовремя  погашать.
texts.en: Gavhar is a woman with a higher education.  She has a family, children and a loving husband.  Gavhar works as an elementary school teacher at a private school.  She has plenty of work experience and tenure, loves and knows her trade very well.  Her husband has been working at a mill for several years and has a permanent job.  Despite the fact that they both work and have a stable income, the family has not been able to save money to build their home.  They need to build additional rooms for their sons because they have grown up and will soon be married.  Gavhar and her husband decided to request a loan from us for these expenses.  This is not her first loan, and she already knows all of the financing conditions and never violated them.  Gavhar tries to use the loans as intended and to repay them in a timely manner.

loans.use: to make housing repairs

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: Зарина- мать троих взрослых детей.Недавно она женила двоих сыновей.У неё сейчас большое хозяйство и большие заботы, так как живут вместе большой семьей.Конечно все в семье работают и имеют свои доходы, но все равно семейные ресурсы хватают только на проживание.Накопить   денежные средства невозможно и поэтому она обратилась в нашу организацию за кредитом, чтобы покрыть свои крупные расходы.Первый кредит она использовала на ремонт своей квартиры перед свадьбой сыновей и своевременно погасила его.После этого она получила кредит на свадьбу.Очередной кредит запрашивает также на приготовление мероприятия, у неё взрослая дочь и планирует выдать её замуж,для этого она закупает  приданное и золотые изделия.Она благодарна нам за своевременную финансовую программу и надеется на постоянное сотрудничество.
texts.en: Zarrina is a mother of three adult children.  She recently married off two of her sons.  Right now, she has a large household and large expenses because they live together as a big family.  Of course, everyone in the family works and earns an income, but still the family resources are only enough for basic living expenses.  It is impossible to save money, and this is why Zarrina requested a loan from our organization in order to cover large expenses.  She used her first loan to make repairs to her apartment before her sons' weddings and repaid that loan timely.  Then, she obtained a loan for the wedding.  Zarrina is requesting this loan also to hold events.  She has an adult daughter and plans to marry her off, and needs to buy a dowry and gold jewelry for this purpose.  She is grateful to us for the timely financial program and hopes for a permanent partnership with us.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Aslam

texts.ru:
Аслам родился 1980 году в городке Дангара. Он живет с женой. У него двое маленьких детей. Аслам имеет среднее образование. Он занимается торговлей. Аслам начал свою деятельность с 2004 года. В то время он арендовал не большую торговую точку на рынке. Занимался малым предпринимательством.
Аслам на сегодняшний день арендует помещение рядом с домом, где он открыл продуктовый магазин. Он хочет увеличить товарооборот.
Аслам просит кредит на сумму 1050 долларов США для покупки продуктов и хозяйственных товаров.
texts.en: Aslam was born in 1980 in the city of Dangara.  He lives with his wife, and they have two small children.  Aslam has a secondary education.  He is involved in sales.  Aslam started his business in 2004.  At that time, he leased a small retail outlet at a market and was involved in a small entrepreneurship.  Today, Aslam leases a space near his home, where he opened a food store.  He wants to increase his goods turnover.  Aslam is requesting a loan in the amount of $1050 to purchase products and household goods.

loans.use: to purchase products and household goods

loans.name: Arnulfo Reyes

texts.es: Arnulfo tiene una venta de accesorios para celulares en Bastión Popular sector que en un principio fue un asentamiento ilegal de personas que querían tener una casa propia, pero por medio de conversaciones se oficializo en el municipio de la cuidad, tiene 11 años en el negocio el cual empezó al inicio del auge telefónico lo cual le ayudo ya que empezó a reunir su clientela. Poco después decidió comprar un local en la bahía de la ciudad un sector muy conocido por ser un nicho comercial, ahí empezó la reparación y venta de celular como artículos. Su horario de trabajo empieza desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, no tiene ayudantes por lo que realiza el trabajo solo. En su local oferta, baterías, celulares, cargadores, estuches, audífonos, tarjetas de memoria y reparaciones. Arnulfo espera con el préstamo aumentar sus ventas aunque el sector es muy competitivo. Su sueño es tener un vehículo propio para viajar y pasar más tiempo con su familia.
texts.en: Arnulfo has a business selling cell phone accessories in Bastión Popular.  This area was originally an illegal settlement of people who wanted to own their own homes.  However, following talks, the city council decided to make it an official settlement.  Arnulfo has been in his business for 11 years.  He started it at the beginning of the cell phone boom which helped him to form his customer base.  Shortly afterwards, he decided to buy premises in the bay area of the city.  This area is very well known for being a commercial niche.  He started repairing and selling both cell phones and accessories.  Arnulfo starts work at 10 o'clock in the morning and works until 8 o'clock at night.  He doesn't have any assistants and works alone.  In his premises he sells batteries, cell phones, chargers, cases, earphones and memory cards.  He also offers repairs.  Arnulfo hopes to use his loan to increase his sales although the industry is very competitive.  His dreams are to own his own vehicle so that he can travel and to spend more time with his family.

loans.use: to buy batteries, cell phones, chargers, cases, earphones and memory cards

loans.name: Iuri

texts.en:
Iuri is 66 years old. He lives in a small village of Abasha District with his wife Eter. They are pensioners. They earn their living through their agricultural business with 4 milking cows and a pig. Eter milks cows twice a day and produces cheese. They sell it on the local open market. Iuri also sells piglets in nearby villages. They own a plot of land as well, where nuts and vegetables are grown. They sell 400 kg of nuts seasonally. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Lari.

Iuri requested a loan to install an irrigation system on his plot. He will water the land and hopes to get more and better quality vegetables (tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes and cabbage). This will increase the sales of the family. With increased income, they will be able to finance the education of their grandchild. Thus, they hope that living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to install an irrigation system

loans.name: Ludit Francisco

texts.es: Ludit de 39 años se dedica a la venta de artículos hechos en aluminio y vidrio, el taller lo abrió en su domicilio ubicado en las Orquídeas sector norte de Guayaquil. Aprendió de su hermano mayor quien se dedica  al mismo negocio, empezó como ayudante hasta que poco a poco fue aprendiendo y logro independizarse. En la actualidad trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, la labor lo realiza con un ayudante ya que lo necesita para el corte y ensamble de las piezas por ser frágiles. Tiene 10 años en el negocio y cuenta con mucha clientela a quienes les gusta su trabajo. Ludit está casado y tiene 2 hijos quienes estudian en la escuela. Con el préstamo va a comprar aluminio, vidrio prensado, caucho y pegamento con los cuales hace las vitrinas. Espera a futuro ampliar su taller mejorando su calidad de vida, su sueño es poder comprar un carro que le permita dar un mejor servicio.
texts.en: Ludit is 39 years old and works selling products made from aluminum and glass.  He opened his shop in his home, located in the Orquídeas sector north of Guayaquil.  He learned from his older brother, who works in the same business.  He began as a helper until little by little he continued learning and was able to achieve independence.  Currently he works from Monday to Saturday from 8am to 6pm.  He works with a helper since he needs one for the cutting and assembling of the pieces since they are fragile.  He has been working in the business for 10 years and he counts on many clients who like his work.  Ludit is married and has two children who study in school.  With the loan he is going to buy aluminum, pressed glass, rubber and adhesive which he will use to make windows.  He hopes in the future to grow his shop, improving his quality of life.  His dream is to be able to buy a car that will permit him to give better service.

loans.use: to buy aluminum, pressed glass, rubber and adhesive.

loans.name: 010103-Hợp Tân- Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Nguyệt has a retail business selling seafood. She is requesting a loan to purchase seafood to make processed seafood.

Nguyệt is 48 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 010103-Hợp Tân- Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. Nguyệt supports 2 dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. One of her children is grown up.

In 2008, Nguyệt joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nguyệt has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nguyệt has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Nguyệt hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase seafood to make processed seafood.

loans.name: Ma. Miriam

texts.en:
Ma. Miriam is a 34-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has five young children, and their ages are 12, 10, 9, 5, and 3. She has been in the farming business together with her husband for 12 years now. They grow rice.
 
Ma. Miriam gives her best in providing support to her husband and in meeting the needs of the family, especially for their children. The farming business provides them with the income that they need for their sustenance and expenses.
 
Ma. Miriam is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizers for the crops that they grow. Also, she wants to renovate their house.
 
In the future, Ma. Miriam dreams of expanding their farming business in order to generate more income so that she can send her children to school for a bright future.
 
The additional income will be used to finance the family's daily needs, reinvest in her business, and save for future use.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her plants

loans.name: 010102-Hợp Tân- Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Hồng operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish sauce. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish sauce for resale.

Hồng is 39 years old and married, with two children.  She supports two dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  Hồng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  She says the main hardship that her business faces is the lack of capital.

Hồng is the leader of a five-member group, the 010102-Hợp Tân- Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group.   In 2008, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  She has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Hồng hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase fish sauce for resale.

loans.name: 010104-Hợp Tân- Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Lệ operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish sauce. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish sauce for resale.

Lệ is 31 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 010104-Hợp Tân- Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. Lệ supports 2 dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Lệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. The main hardship that Lệ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Lệ hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish sauce for resale.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica has a thriving bakery business in Cortes, Bohol. She is 42 years old and married. She has three children, and their ages are 7, 12 and 13. Her husband helps her bake the bread to sell. Monica knows that she can do more. Her only challenge is that she lacks the money to buy some ingredients. She is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, margarine, lard, baking powder and cooking oil. Her loan is just what she needs so she can further increase her production. Any income generated will be used for paying for her children's healthy diet and school fees and reinvesting in her business.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, yeast, margarine, lard, baking powder and cooking oil

loans.name: Emilienne's Group

texts.fr: Emilienne est la responsable d'un groupe composé de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Agée de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants scolarisés dans une école de la ville. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente des mèches, des sacs et des chaussures dames depuis quelques années. Elle se ravitaille dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. En vue de satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants et de creuser un puits dans leur maison, elle a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un financement auprès de Finadev. Emilienne se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
Emilienne is the supervisor of a group made up of two people who are mutual guarantors. 44 years old, she is married and the mother of five children, who attend a school in the town. She has concentrated on selling hair extensions, bags and ladies shoes for several years. She buys her supplies in one of Benin's markets.
In order to meet her childrens' needs, and to dig a well at their home, she requested and got a loan from Finadev. Emilienne is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase 2 boxes of hair extensions, 12 bags and 16 pairs of ladies shoes.

loans.name: Jose Alfonso

texts.es: Jose es un taxista de 52 años que vive en las Orquídeas, se decidió por dar este tipo de servicios cuando se quedo sin trabajo y por su edad no fue contratado en otra compañía. Desde el año 2009 se puso en contacto con una compañía legalizada de taxi solicitando empleo ya que tiene licencia profesional, lo llamaron y le alquilan un vehículo por el que paga diariamente una guardianía. En el trabajo le dan el vehículo desde las 6:30 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche cuando lo retorna a la compañía. Con el tiempo que tiene trabajando ya es conocido por lo que tiene cliente fijos quienes lo llaman solicitando el servicio, también realiza expresos para colegios y escuelas. Como todos sus compañeros de la compañía su mayor temor es encontrarse en una situación de secuestro express ya que se arriesga en gran parte su integridad, espera no encontrarse en esa situación ya que es el único sustento familiar. Jose está casado y tiene 3 hijos quienes depende de él.  Con el préstamo que está solicitando va a mejorar su vivienda comprando barrillas, cemento y arena ya que desea mejorar su calidad de vida. Su sueño a futuro es poder adquirir un vehículo propio para ya no tener que pagar guardianía y así tendría una mayor rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Jose is a 52 year old taxi driver who lives in las Orquídeas. He decided to be a taxi driver when he was out of work and because of his age, was not contracted with another company. In 2009 he contacted a legalized taxi company and applied for employment since he already has a professional license.  They called him and rented him a vehicle which he pays for daily for guardianship. 

At work he gets the vehicle from 6:30 am till 11 pm when he returns it to the company. Over the time he has been working he has become known and has fixed customers who call requesting service.  Jose also provides service for high schools and primary schools.  Like all his colleagues in the company, Jose's biggest fear is being in a hostage situation and risking a large part of their integrity.  He hopes not to be in that situation because he is the only provider for his family.

Jose is married with 3 children who depend on him. With the requested loan, he will improve his home by purchasing rods, cement and sand because he wants to improve their quality of life. Jose's future dream is to buy his own car and never have to pay for guardianship and thus would have higher returns.

loans.use: to buy rods, cement and sand.

loans.name: Jbar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 62 years old and married, with two children.

Jbar has owned a grocery store since 2008, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, dairy products, and detergents. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers.  He knows their needs. He has a good reputation, and he is  well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $3,000 loan in order to expand his shop and increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to expand his shop and increase its inventory

loans.name: Piabalo

texts.fr: Mr Piabalo est père 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. L’ainé a 08ans et le dernier 01ans. Il a appris la cuisine et l’exerce depuis 02ans dans une boutique. Sa difficulté est la mévente et il sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des produits alimentaires, de la boisson et réaménager l’emplacement pour les clients. Dans l’avenir, il veut seconder son restaurant et contribuer à l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Piabalo is the father of 3 children, 2 of whom are at school. The eldest is 8 and the youngest 1 year old. He has learned to cook and has been doing that for 2 years in a shop. His problem is the recession, and he is seeking this first loan with WAGES in order to buy food products and drinks, and to redecorate the premises for his customers.
In the future, he wants to enhance his restaurant and to contribute to his childrens' education.

loans.use: to buy food products and to improve the premises.

loans.name: Elvis Manfredo

texts.es:
Elvis, tiene 32 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive con su esposa e hijos en  una aldea cercana al municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Elvis trabajo en una fábrica maquiladora y al quedar sin empleo decidió establecer su propio negocio por sus propios medios y manejarlo juntamente con su esposa. Hace 4 años empezó a vender productos de la canasta básica familiar como granos básicos, manteca, huevos, cereales, condimentos, abarrotes etc. Lo ha surtido poco a poco reinvirtiendo sus ganancias. El ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para surtir de más productos comestibles que le ayuden a incrementar sus ventas y sus ganancias. Todo el esfuerzo que hace es para mantener siempre una fuente de ingresos para su familia y hacer que su negocio crezca más.
texts.en:
Elvis is 32 years old, and he has two children.  He lives with his wife and children in a village close to the Choloma municipality in Cortes.

Elvis worked in an assembly plant.  When he was left without employment he decided to set up his own business through his own resources.  He decided to run the business together with his wife.  Four years ago he started to sell basic needs products like basic grains, lard, eggs, cereals, condiments, and other groceries, etc.  He has stocked it little by little by reinvesting his earnings.

He has decided to request a loan for 10,000 lempiras in order to stock more food products.  These products will help him to increase his sales and his income.  All of the effort that he puts forth is to always maintain a source of income for his family and to make his business grow more.

loans.use: to stock his business with basic needs food products.

loans.name: Rosa Agustina

texts.es: Rosa vive en Orquídeas ciudad norte de Guayaquil, en su sector cuenta con los servicios de agua, luz y alcantarillado. Vive en esta zona desde que por medio de un préstamo adquirió su casa. Rosa inicio su vida comercial haciendo cadenas de dinero a parientes y conocidos con lo cual solventaba la mayor parte de sus gastos. Pasado varios años de realizar este tipo de negocios logro reunir un capital con el cual pudo comprar ropa para empezar a vender ya que le pareció un negocio muy rentable. La venta la realiza sola desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde recorriendo los sectores y visitando a sus clientes ya que su negocio es informal. La venta que realiza es de blusas, pantalones y lencería tanto femenina como masculina obteniendo un costo de $ 4.00 en la venta de cada producto. El negocio que realiza le gusta mucho ya que le ha permitido superar sus dificultades financieras que tiene siendo madre soltera de 3 niños. Rosa espera obtener el crédito con el cual compraría más mercadería para la venta, su meta a futuro es abrir un bazar de manera estable para dedicarle más tiempo a su familia.
texts.en: Rosa lives in Orquídeas, a city to the north of Guayaquil.  In her neighborhood she has access to services for water, electricity and sewage.  She has lived in this area since she was able to acquire a loan for the purchase.  Rosa began her commercial life selling something similar to lottery tickets (cadenas de dinero) to family and friends.   She was able to take care of many of her bills in this way.  After several years of this type of work she was able to collect enough capital that she was able to buy clothing to sell, since this seemed to her a very marketable business.  She completes her sales between 8am and 3pm, traveling through various neighborhoods and visiting her clients since her business is informal.  The things that she sells include blouses, pants, and undergarments for both men and women.  She obtains a commission of $4 for every product she sells.  She enjoys her business very much since it allows her to overcome the financial challenges that she faces being a single mother of three children.  Rosa hopes to obtain a loan with which she will buy more merchandise for sale.  Her future goal is to open a permanent bazaar so that she can dedicate more time to her family.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, pants and lingerie.

loans.name: Berdimurod

texts.en:
Berdimurod is a man who likes to work hard.  He has many friends, and all of them love him because Berdimurod is kind, jolly, and smart. 

He has been a driver for more than 30 years. He serves local people as a taxi man.  He is very sociable, and that’s why he attracts a lot of clients. 

He has a lovely wife and a smart child. Berdimurod tries to do the best for them. He must do more to raise the level of his living conditions because it is more expensive as his child grows older. 

Berdimurod is asking a loan to repair his car. He needs your help and mercy.

loans.use: To repair his car.

loans.name: 010101-Hợp Tân- Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mẫn operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish sauce. She is requesting a loan to purchase small fish and shrimp to make fish sauce.

Mẫn is 60 years old and she is married with 4 children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 010101-Hợp Tân- Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. Mẫn supports 2 dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Two other children are grown up.

In 2008, Mẫn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Mẫn has successfully repaid 8 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Mẫn faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Mẫn hopes to buy land of her own, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase small fish and shrimp to make fish sauce.

loans.name: Smas

texts.en:
Smas, aged 49, is a hammock weaver who permanently lives in the Reussey Keo district with her husband and three single children, while the other two children are married and live separately. Smas got involved in the weaving business in order to help her husband earn some additional income for the family. She has been doing this for almost seven years and can earn approximately 2.00 USD per day. Smas’ husband is a vendor, selling kitchen supplies in various places around his district. 

Smas would like to borrow some funds from Kiva lenders to purchase kitchen supplies to support her husband’s business. This will enable Smas’ husband to increase his business activities and income. She hopes that she is able to experience a better standard of living since she and her husband strive to work hard.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen supplies to support her husband’s retail business

loans.name: 01.06.06 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Anh has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase household commodities in general to resell.

Anh is 35 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 01.06.06 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. She lives with 2 dependents and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. 

In 2011, Anh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Anh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Anh hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase household commodities in general to resell

loans.name: Noapéli

texts.fr: Infirmière de profession depuis 2000, Madame Noapéli est marié à un tâcheron dans une société de la place. Ils ont ensemble un adorable enfant âgé de 02ans. Pour prêter main forte à son mari dans les  charges du foyer, elle a décidé par vendre des produits génériques à domicile à ses patients. Deux personnes l’aident et elle sollicite ce second crédit de chez nous pour s’approvisionner en marchandises. Elle veut agrandir son centre de santé, devenir grossiste des produits génériques. Comme perspectives d‘avenir, elle veut réaliser des bénéfices afin  de contribuer aux dépenses dans l’éducation de leur enfant au coté de son mari.
texts.en:
A qualified nurse since 2000, Noapéli is married to a local labourer. They have an adorable 2 year old child. In order to assist her husband with the household expenses, she decided to sell generic products to her patients from her home. Two people assist her and she is seeking this second loan with WAGES to buy stock.
She wants to grow her health centre, and become a wholesaler of generic products. As to the future, she wants to generate a profit in order to contribute, alongside her husband, to her child's education.

loans.use: to purchase generic pharmaceutical products.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Maria  tiene 59 años de edad, esta casada y su esposo trabaja como comerciante,   tiene 1 hijo de 26 años el cual ya es independiente, vive en una colonia de la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Maria, tiene su negocio de pulpería el cual estableció con su propio capital hace 12 años, y vende productos de la canasta básica como frijoles, arroz, harina, manteca, café, cal, pan ,lácteos, churros, refrescos, agua en bolsa. Su negocio tiene bastante movimiento ya que esta ubicado en una zona de mucha afluencia de personas, y las ventas que obtiene le generan buenas ganancias. Ella atiende su negocio todo el día. 
Ha logrado mantener surtido su negocio con las ganancias obtenidas y actualmente esta solicitando su primer préstamo de 15000  lempiras para  poder abastecerse de producto como azúcar, manteca, frijoles, arroz, frescos, pan, lácteos, café, carnes, churros, confites y maseca. 
Su plan en el futuro es tener un mejor local y ampliar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is 59 years old and married.  Her husband works as a merchant.  She has one child, age 26, who is now independent.  She lives in a neighborhood in the city of San Pedro Sula.

Maria has a grocery store business, which she established with her own money 12 years ago.  She sells basic needs food products like beans, rice, flour, lard, coffee, lime powder, bread, dairy products, churros, soft drinks, and water in bags.  

Her business has plenty of movement because it is located in an area with a lot of people.  The sales she makes generate good income.  She tends to her business all day.  She has managed to keep her business stocked by using the income she received.

She is currently requesting her first loan for 1,500 lempiras.  With the loan she will be able to stock products like sugar, lard, beans, rice, soft drinks, bread, dairy products, coffee, meat, churros, candy, and instant corn flour.

Her plan for the future is to have a better place and to expand her business more.

loans.use: to buy products like sugar, lard, beans, rice, soft drinks, bread, dairy products, coffee, meat, churros, candy, and instant corn flour in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es: Mary  es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer. Tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 4 años. Mary es dueña de una estética de belleza en su propia vivienda y también vende regalos. Ella se siente exitosa porque gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar y también le ayudan mucho a saber manejar su negocio y a valorarse a sí misma. Está agradecida con la institución por las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrece. Mary invertirá el nuevo préstamo que solicita en la compra de tintes de pelo, máquina de cortar cabello, insumos para peluquería y regalos para su tienda.
texts.en:
Mary is a member of the Communal Bank "Florecer."  She is 29 years old, married and the mother of 2 children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 4 years. Mary owns a beauty salon in her own home and also sells gifts. 

She feels successful because thanks to the training received in the communal bank, she has learned to save.  It helps a lot to know how to manage her own business and value herself.  Mary is grateful to the institution for the loan facilities offered. Mary will invest the new loan request in buying hair dye, an electric razor, salon supplies and gifts for her store.

loans.use: Purchase hair dyes, hair cutting machine, supplies for hairdressers and gifts for your shop tienda

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is 62 years old. He lives in a small village of Chokhatauri District with his wife Marina.  Marina is a coach and is paid fees for the work.

Guram is busy with his agricultural business. He has a plot of land where he grows nuts. He picks nuts in late summer and sells them on the local open market.  Guram also has a car, and he offers taxi services to the local population.   The familly's average monthly income is 580 Lari.

Guram requested a loan to buy a milk cow.   He plans to expand his agricultural business that way. He will milk the cow twice in a day, and he will produce cheese. He will sell the milk and cheese on the local open market. 

This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will be able to renovate and equip their house, because it is old and uncomfortable. The living conditions of the family will improve accordingly. After hard working days, Guram and his wife will be able to spend their evenings in a more comfortable environment.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow to start a dairy business.

loans.name: 01.06.07 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Vân works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

Vân is 60 years old, and she is married, with three children.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents; her children are grown up.

In 2006, Vân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Vân has successfully repaid one previous loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Vân has been involved in her business for five years.  One critical business difficulty that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Vân hopes to remodel her house.  She hopes for her children to find a good job and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Jesutin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUTIN est composé de seize personnes qui se connaissent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Anne Clarisse est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Anne Clarisse est âgée de 41 ans et vit au Bénin. Anne Clarisse a arrêté l’école au niveau universitaire. Anne Clarisse est mariée à un certain Didier. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins du ménage. Afin d’assurer ses divers besoins, Anne Clarisse vend depuis sept ans, des produits de médecine traditionnelle, des liqueurs et des produits vivriers à son domicile. Anne Clarisse s’approvisionne dans une région et dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Anne Clarisse sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUTIN, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The JESUTIN group comprises sixteen people who all know each other from the same region in Bénin. The group representative, whose name is Anne Clarisse, has her hand raised in the photo.
Anne Clarisse is 41 years old and lives in Bénin. She left school after university. She is married to a man named Didier. They have two children together, both attend school and live at home. In addition to their own children, they also have another child living with them. They cover the various household costs between them. In order to do this, Anne Clarisse has sold, for the last seven years, traditional medicine products, liqueurs and food from her home. She buys her supplies in a market in an area of Bénin.
In order to meet her customers' demand, and to increase her turnover and profit, Anne Clarisse is seeking - together with the other members of the JESUTIN group, a third loan with ALIDé. The previous two have both been repaid.

loans.use: to buy traditional medicine products, liqueurs and food.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.es: Flavia es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer. Tiene 58 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 3 años. Se dedica a la venta de hojas medicinales de coca, y también a la siembra, cosecha y venta de maíz, por otro lado se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y ovino fuera de la ciudad. Está agradecida con la institución por las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrece. Ella dice que las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal son muy buenas ya que ellas le dejan mensajes motivadores. Flavia invertirá el nuevo préstamo que solicita en la compra de semillas de maíz, el pago de sus trabajadores y en el transporte de carga de su mercadería.
texts.en: Flavia is a member of the Banco Comunal Florecer [Community Bank "Florecer"]. She is 58 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for the past 3 years. She works selling medicinal coca leaves and also planting, harvesting, and selling corn. In addition, she also raises cattle and sheep outside of the city. She is grateful to the institution for the loan opportunities offered. She says that the training she receives from the Banco Comunal [Community Bank] is very good, because they give her motivating messages. Flavia will use the new loan that she is asking for to purchase seed corn, to pay her workers, and to transport her goods.

loans.use: to purchase seed corn, pay her workers, and transport her goods

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.ru:
Точинисо портниха. Она имеет средне - специальное образование. Точинисо более двадцати пяти лет занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Ей нравится ее работа. Точинисо предоставляет услугу у себя дома. Она берет заказы на дому. В этом ей помогает ее старшая дочь. На сегодняшний день у Точинисо много клиентов. 
Точинисо 43 года. Она проживает в городе Дангара. Точинисо живет вместе с мужем. Ее старший сын работает, двое других сыновей учатся в Вузах. А трое дочерей учатся в школе. 
Точинисо просит кредит для приобретения еще одной швейной машинки. Она надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: Tojiniso is a seamstress.  She has a secondary-specialized education.  Tojiniso has been involved in sewing national dresses for over twenty-five years.  She likes her work.  Tojiniso provides this service and accepts work orders at home.  Her oldest daughter helps her with this business.  Today, Tojiniso has many clients.  Tojiniso is 43 years old.  She lives in the city of Dangara together with her husband.  Her oldest son works, and two other sons attend universities.  And her three daughters attend a school.  Tojiniso is requesting this loan to purchase another sewing machine.  She relies on your help.

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old and married, with one child.

Iyad has owned a food market since 2008, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers.  He knows their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $3,000 loan in order to buy a big generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a big generator.

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es:
Gloria, tiene 23 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive con ellos en una colonia de la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula. 
Gloria  se dedica a la costura. Inicio hace 3 años con su propio capital, especializándose en la elaboración de ropa de cama, forros de muebles y después las vende, no se le dificulto iniciar esta actividad ya que obtuvo la experiencia por su trabajo anterior qué fue en una maquila como operaria de maquina.  También  vende mercadería como zapatos, y ropa como blusas, camisas. El negocio le ha ayudado mucho a mejorar sus ingresos de los cuales a podido reinvertir en el mismo. 
Actualmente ha decidido solicitar su primer préstamo de 7,000 lempiras para poder abastecerse de materiales (telas, hilos), para la elaboración de ropa de cama, forros de muebles y cortinas. Para satisfacer los pedidos de los clientes.
 Su meta es seguir trabajando para tener el capital necesario para ayudar a sus hijos en el estudio.
texts.en:
Gloria, age 23, is a single mother with three children.  She lives with them in a neighborhood in the city of San Pedro Sula.

Gloria is a seamstress.  She started three years ago by using her own capital.  She specializes in making bed linens and slipcovers.  She then sells them.  It was not difficult for her to start this business activity.  That is because she got experience from her previous work, which was in a factory working as a machine operator.

She also sells merchandise like shoes and clothes like blouses and shirts.  The business has helped her a lot to improve her income, which she has been able to reinvest in the business.

She has currently decided to request her first loan for 7,000 lempiras.  With the loan she will be able to stock up on materials (fabric and thread) to make bed linens, slipcovers, and curtains.  She will do this in order to fill her customers’ orders.

Her goal is to continue working in order to have the money needed to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy materials like fabric and thread to make bed linens, slipcovers, and curtains.

loans.name: Mahmadulo

texts.ru: Махмадуло запрашивает новый кредит для увеличения товарооборота. С предыдущего кредита он преуспел и увеличил количество клиентов. Махмадулло не первый раз получает кредит с помощью кредиторов Кива. Он намерен еще раз получить кредит для покупки продуктов и приобретения холодильников. Так как на сегодняшний день у него магазин со смешанным ассортиментом товара, Махмадуло хочет заняться только торговлей продуктов питания и открыть продуктовый магазин.
texts.en: Mahmadulo is requesting a new loan to increase his goods turnover.  He succeeded and increased his customer base with the help of the previous loan.  This is not Mahmadulo's first time obtaining a loan with the help of Kiva creditors.  He intends to obtain a loan again and purchase products and refrigerators.  Because, currently Mahmadulo has a store with a mixed selection of merchandise, he wants to get involved in selling products and open a food market.

loans.use: to purchase products and refrigerators

loans.name: Suliko

texts.en:
Suliko is 39 years old. He is married and lives in a small village of Khoni District with his wife, Nargizi, and two children (15 and 16 years old). Both of them study in the local school. 

Suliko and Nargizi run an agricultural business. In particular, they have a small dairy farm with five milking cows and three calves. They produce cheese and sell it on the local open market. 

They also own a plot of land where they grow maize, tomatoes, and nuts. The family has a truck; they use it for transportation of vegetables and fruits to nearby villages for selling. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Lari.

Suliko requested a loan for purchasing fertilizers and additional vegetables and fruits for sale. After fertilization and properly done seasonal agricultural work, they hope to get a good harvest. 

They will sell the harvested products, together with other vegetables and fruits, in nearby villages. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will be able to finance the studies of their children. Thus, they will be able to create better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and additional vegetables and fruits for sale.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 38-year-old married woman from Cortes, Bohol. Her husband is a government employee. She has three children, ages 4, 11, and 17. 

Rita operates a sari-sari store within her house. She sells items like seasoning, chips, milk, coffee, toiletries, and other basic household necessities.  

She is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, and seasoning, which are bought by her neighbors on a daily basis. 

In the future, she wants to make improvements and expansion of her store for a bigger profit.  Any income will be used for family daily consumption, savings, school fees, and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, and seasoning.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 30 years old, and married, with one child.

Safaa owns a bakery. He established his business in 2011.  He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers. He knows their demands. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2,100 as a Youth Loan to buy a baking machine and a new oven and to install an external ceiling for the shop. He is aiming to gain more profits, which will offer a better living standard for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy a baking machine and a new oven and install an external ceiling for his shop.

loans.name: Ayaba Elisabeth's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe de deux membres en caution solidaire. Elisabeth, la responsable, est âgée de 33ans. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont trois vont déjà à l'école, elle a un salon de coiffure où elle vend aussi des chaussures dames. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de la sous région et sa clientèle est essentiellement composée des togolaises et des béninoises. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de combler les attentes de ses clientes, elle a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un micro crédit à finadev en vue d'élargir sa commande et d'accroitre son intérêt. Le surplus généré lui permettra de contribuer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et de payer ses dettes. Elisabeth se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
This relates to a group with two members - acting as mutual guarantors. Elisabeth, the supervisor, is 33 years old. She is married and the mother of four children, three of whom already go to school. She has a hairdressing salon where she also sells ladies shoes. She buys her supplies in one of the markets in the local area, and her customers are mainly women from Togo and Bénin.
In order to strengthen her business and to meet the needs of her customers, she has requested and received a micro loan from Finadev so that she can increase the size of her order and generate more interest. The profit generated will allow her to help with the schooling costs of her children and to pay her debts. Elisabeth is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase 20 pairs of shoes of various types.

loans.name: Maria Alexandra

texts.es: Maria vive en Las Orquídeas sector norte de Guayaquil donde tiene una tienda de abarrotes. La tienda se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio el cual es de cemento y cuenta con los servicios básicos. El negocio lo empezó hace varios años cuando uno de sus hijos realizo un crédito y le dio un pequeño capital para que pudiera empezar. Ella decidió poner un mini market para no depender del ingreso de su esposo ya que él es jubilado y recibe la pensión. Maria se siente útil y satisfecha de saber que puede aportar en la mantención de su hogar. La atención del negocio la realiza ella sola aunque a veces su esposo la hace compañía. La tienda está bien surtida ya que vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, atún, huevos, colas, verduras etc. con el préstamo va a comprar más de estos productos para el inventario. Su sueño a futuro es poder construir la segunda planta de su casa y así ampliar mas el negocio.
texts.en:
Maria lives in Las Orquídeas, an area north of Guayquil, where she has a grocery store. Her business is located in her home, which is made of cement and receives basic services. Maria opened her store several years ago when one of her children took out a loan and gave her a small amount of capital to get started. She wanted to establish a mini-market so that would not have to rely on her husband’s income. He is retired and receives a pension.

Maria feels useful and is satisfied to know that she is able to support the maintenance of her household. She manages her business by herself but sometimes her husband keeps her company. Her store is well-stocked with basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, tuna, eggs, colas, vegetables, and other items. This loan will be used to buy more of these products to add to her inventory. Her dream for the future is to build a second floor to her house so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, tuna, eggs, colas, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Aydee Filonila

texts.es: Aydee es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchariy II. Tiene 57 años de edad y es madre de 4 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 14 años. Es dueña de un hospedaje y también se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de tubérculos. Está agradecida con la institución por las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrece ya que gracias a ello logró construir su hospedaje en otra provincia cerca a la cuidad. Ella dice que las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal le enseñan temas motivadores que le ayudan mucho en su vida cotidiana. Aydee invertirá el préstamo que solicita en la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar con los acabados de las instalaciones de su hospedaje.
texts.en:
Aydee is a member of the communal bank Rikchariy II.  She is 57 and is the mother of four children.  She has been a member of FINCA Perú for 14 years.  She is the owner of a hotel and also earns income by farming, specifically by growing tubers such as potatoes.  She is grateful to the institution for the ease with which she has been able to obtain loans; thanks to these loans she has been able to construct her hotel in a province close to her city.  She says that the training she has received through the communal bank has given her a lot of motivation that has helped her a great deal in her daily life.

Aydee will invest the loan funds in construction materials so that she can complete the work on her hotel.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials so that she can finish the work on her hotel.

loans.name: Cadith

texts.es:
Cadith tiene 50 años, es una mujer muy amble, trabajadora y perseverante. Su pareja falleció hace mucho tiempo, con él tuvo cinco hijos, con los que vive actualmente y a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.
Su trabajo comienza muy temprano por la mañana, cuando abre su taller de tapicería en un pequeño local alquilado. Con la ayuda de su hijo, empezó esta actividad hace más de un año.  También se dedica a la venta de carne pollo en el mercado, donde cuenta con un puesto de ventas, ella es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre logra sacar una sonrisa a sus clientes. Cuando se inició en este negocio recuerda que no sabia nada, tuvo que trabajar mucho para aprender y tener mejores ganancias. Actualmente lo realiza con la ayuda de su hija, para la atención al público, estando más de 6 años en esta actividad. Para el futuro espera ampliar su taller de tapicería y seguir creciendo.

Este es su crédito número 19 con MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Por su parte, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, pues es una de las fundadoras y se siente muy orgullosa de estar trabajando desde hace mucho tiempo y poder formar al grupo donde todos sean personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, 3000 soles, comprará materiales para el taller de tapicería (con 2000 soles) como tapiz, tolderas, hilos, colchones y otros para cubrir mejor la demanda de sus clientes. Con el saldo, invertirá en su negocio de venta de carne de pollo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Cadith is 50 years old, and she is a very nice, hardworking, and persevering woman. She had five children with her husband, who died a long time ago, and she currently lives with her children and wants to provide a better quality of life for them.

Her work begins very early in the morning, when she opens her upholstery workshop in a small rented space. With her son's help, she began this work more than a year ago. She also sells chicken meat in the marketplace, where she has a sales stall. She is a very persuasive saleswoman and always manages to get a smile out of her customers. When she began in this business, she remembers that she didn't know anything, and she had to work hard to learn and to have better earnings. Currently she works with the help of her daughter, to serve the public, having been in this line of work for more than 6 years. For the future she hopes to expand her upholstery workshop and keep on growing.

This is her 19th loan with MFP, which is why she hopes to continue with her goals. For her part, she is committed, once again, to making her payments in installments, as she has done with past loans she had. She is very happy to belong to a communal bank. She is one of the founders and feels very proud to be working for a long time and to be able to form this group where all of the members are responsible, supportive people. With the amount requested, 3000 soles, she will buy materials for her upholstery workshop (with 2000 soles) such as tapestry, thread, cushions, and other items to better cover the needs of her customers. With the balance, she will invest in her business selling chicken meat in the marketplace.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials for her upholstery work, and furthermore to buy chicken meat to sell.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
Bahodur has very good ideas and always realizes all of them. He is a very good designer of furniture. He is a master craftsman and sells his beautiful work to local people. If you saw the furniture made by Bahodur, you would like it at once. This furniture gives your home a special touch. 

This wonderful master has a lovely wife and two smart children. His family loves him very much because he is a very careful father and husband. 

Bahodur wants to develop business, but his income isn't enough for it. That’s why he is asking a loan to buy equipment for making furniture in the modern fashion. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy equipment for making furniture.

loans.name: Hashem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 23 years old. He is married and has two children.

Hashem has owned a food market since 2010, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $1,800 as youth loan to buy a big generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a big generator.

loans.name: Pho

texts.en:
Pho is a resident living in a small village, Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is 32 years old and married with a lovely child attending local school. To make a living, Pho pays full attention to her agricultural business and also works as a paid laborer for extra income. She is very patient in completing her daily tasks at the field and takes cares of her family at home as well. Pho has been in these businesses for five years and typically earns in the neighborhood of USD 3.20 per day.
 
Prior to this loan, Pho had borrowed and paid off three loans already. Those loans were very helpful and had good impact in developing her family-owned businesses and her living conditions. And now, Pho would like to take out another loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorcycle both for business and home use. Her husband will use it to provide transportation services to local people. Pho believes that through the help of the loan her family will be better off gradually. And she hopes to obtain a good quality of life someday.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle both for business and home use.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde es soltera y tiene un hijo pequeño, viven en la casa de su padre  ocupando solo una habitación pequeña, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Belén de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de doce horas vendiendo ropa de forma ambulante a crédito y al contado ya que es la única que cubre los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más ropa para mejorar sus ingresos y aumentar  su mercadería.
El sueño de Matilde es independizarse y darle mejor de calidad de vida a su hija.
Es a primera vez que solicita el crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Matilde is single, and she has a small child.  They live in her father’s house, occupying only one small room.  The house is located in the Belén area in the city of La Paz.

She currently works for over 12 hours selling clothes in an itinerant manner.  She sells for credit and for cash.  This is the only way that she covers the food expenses and pays for the family’s basic services.

She needs the loan to buy more clothes in order to improve her income and increase her merchandise.

Matilde’s dream is to become independent and to give her child a better quality of life.

This is the first time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to get more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es: Balbina es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer. Tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 5 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 2 años. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artesanías (alfombras, frazadas). Está agradecida con la institución por las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrece. Ella manifiesta que las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal le sirven para poder mejorar tanto en el negocio como en su familia. Su sueño es construir su casa donde pueda vivir al lado de su familia. Balbina invertirá el nuevo préstamo que solicita en la compra de hilos de lana de oveja, hilos procesados y rústicos para la elaboración de tejidos artesanales.
texts.en: Balbina is a member of the Banco Comunal Florecer [Community Bank "Florecer"]. She is 42 years old, has a live-in partner, and is a mother of 5 children. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for the past 2 years. She works making and selling handicrafts (rugs and blankets). She is grateful to the institution for the loan opportunities offered. She states that the training she receives at the Banco Comunal [Community Bank] helps her to improve her business and family life. Balbina will use the new loan she is asking for to buy wool threads, fine threads, and rustic threads to use in producing handcrafted textiles.

loans.use: to purchase wool threads, fine threads, and rustic threads for the production of handcrafted textiles.

loans.name: Olmoskhon

texts.ru: Олмосхон проживает в городе Исфара. Ей 37 лет. Она замужем. Олмосхон живет вместе с мужем. У нее двое детей. Олмосхон занимается торговлей на рынке. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает фрукты (слива, персик, яблоко виноград и др. виды). Торговлей фруктов Олмосхон занимается более двадцати лет. Она просит кредит для покупки несколько ящиков яблок, винограда, банана и для покупки арбуза.
texts.en: Olmoskhon lives in the city of Isfara.  She is 37 years old, married and lives with her husband.  They have two children.  Olmoskhon is involved in sales at a market.  She leases a retail outlet, where she sells fruits, such as plums, peaches, apples, grapes and others.  Olmoskhon has been selling fruits for over twenty years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase several cases of apples, grapes and bananas and to buy watermelons.

loans.use: to purchase several cases of apples, grapes and bananas and to buy watermelons

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of two children.  Her home is Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the fishing business and seaweed farming for almost ten years now. Her husband is a fisherman.

Virgilia is a hardworking woman who wants nothing but to provide a better life for her family, especially for her children. She's been supporting her husband in their business to make it sustainable.

As of now, Virgilia lacks the funds for their fishing business. Virgilia joined CEVI to gain access to the financial services it offers to business-minded individuals like her. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy fishing equipment, such as fishing nets, basins and other things. With this loan, she and her husband will be able to increase their catch, thus giving them more sales in their business. 

Virgilia hopes to expand her business in order to augment their income, so that she will be able to send her children to school for a better education.

loans.use: to buy nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase building materials to repair windows and floor

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who wants to change his auto-rickshaw body. By replacing his auto-rickshaw body he will be able to save his business asset and also provide better quality transport services to his passengers.

Saima is a very efficient and active lady. She remains at home and does her household responsibilities.She has five sons. Three of them are studying while her eldest son sells fruit.

She is very excited about the future improvement of her husband’s business as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: To replace a rickshaw body for transport business

loans.name: Khayom

texts.en:
Khayom is very jolly and intelligent. He likes to work hard as he is a very hard-working man. 

Khayom spends much of his time on the road because he is a driver and transports local people from one place to another. He has a very good character and this is the main aspect of attracting clients. He is the only breadwinner in the family because his wife doesn’t work. They have two children and try to do their best for them. He is asking for a loan to repair his car to develop his business. He awaits your help and support.

loans.use: To repair car used as taxi

loans.name: Milagros De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señorita Milagros es socia del banco comunal “Fruto Bendito” del Distrito de Manantay, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 27 años, está casada y tiene tres hijos. 
Tiene tiempos trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y su hermana le ayuda a vender por la carretera.  Toda la mercadería es para repartir. 
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 10 shor's, 12 camisas,6 pantalones, 12 polos para niños, 12 polos para adultos, 6 polos para mujeres.
Este negocio es aún pequeño pero gracias a los préstamo ahora puede comprar su mercadería por docenas porque así puede ganar más.  Quiere tener mayor capital para traer más mercadería y surtirla.  Su esposo es trabajador independiente y con lo poco que gana puede cubrir los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Milagros is a member of the Communal Bank “Fruto Bendito”, which is located in the District of Manantay in the Department of Ucayali.  She is 27 years old, married, and has three children.  

Milagros has been working with the loans from Manuela Ramos for some time.  She sells new clothing and her sister helps by selling from a cart.  All of her merchandise is delivered.  

With this new loan of 1,000 PEN Milagros will buy 10 pairs of shorts, 12 shirts, 6 trousers, 12 pullovers for children, 12 pullovers for adults, and 6 pullovers for women.  Her business is still small, but with this loan she will be able to buy merchandise by the dozen so that she can earn more.  

Milagros wants to have more capital so that she can acquire more merchandise and remain stocked.  Her husband is a self-employed worker and with what little he earns they are able to cover the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Ilsia Evelyn

texts.es:
Ilsia, desea comprarse más leña, maíz, bolsas, hilos y telas, para todo esto solicita un nuevo préstamo que le brinde los recursos económicos de los cuales realmente ella no cuenta, ya que son necesarios para poder tener continuidad en negocio siguiendo esta producción de tortillas y poder confeccionar ropa, espera tener un buen efecto que le permite alcanzar sus expectativas.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener un efecto positivo ya que compró dos carga de leña y seis sacos de maíz que fueron los que hasta el momento se han dado la producción necesaria, ademas realizo unos trabajos en su vivienda, en estos días a manteniendo un buen nivel de ventas y de ingresos, está creciendo en el negocio por lo mismo espera continuar en este mismo curso a través de este nuevo préstamo.
texts.en:
Ilsia wants to buy more firewood, corn, bags, thread, and fabrics. Obtaining all of these items requires that she ask for a new loan so that she can receive the financial resources that she does not have. These items are needed to continue her businesses of producing tortillas and sewing clothes. She hopes to achieve good results that live up to her expectations.

Her previous loan had a positive effect. Ilsia was able to buy two bundles of firewood and six sacks of corn that have given what she needs to continue producing thus far. In addition, she was able to complete a few repair jobs around her home. These days she has been able to maintain a good level of sales and profits. Her business is growing, so she hopes that this will continue as a result of this new loan.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, bags, thread, and fabrics.

loans.name: Noemi Antonia

texts.es: Noemi es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer. Tiene 26 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 2 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 3 años y es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes. Ella dice que en su Banco Comunal  aprendió a ahorrar y por ello se siente orgullosa de sí misma, las capacitaciones que recibe son temas que le  ayudan para mejorar su negocio y también en la familia. Está agradecida con la institución por las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrece. Su sueño es construir su propia vivienda. Noemi invertirá el préstamo que solicita en la compra de abarrotes, golosinas, y de unas maquinas exhibidoras de bebidas.
texts.en: Noemi is a member of the Banco Comunal Florecer [Community Bank "Florecer"]. She is 26 years old, has a live-in partner, and is the mother of 2 children. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for the past 3 years, and is the owner of a grocery store. She says that she learned how to save at the Banco Comunal [Community Bank], and feels proud of herself for this. She receives training on topics that help her to improve her business and also her family life. She is grateful to the institution for the loan opportunities offered. Her dream is to build her own home. Noemi will use the loan that she is asking for to buy groceries, sweets, and beverage display cases.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, sweets, and display cases for beverages

loans.name: Muhayyo

texts.ru: Мухайё родилась 1963 году в Исфаре. Она живет вместе с мужем. У них один ребенок. Мухайё успешная и целеустремленная женщина. Она очень счастливо живет с мужем. Мухайё имеет богатый опят в области животноводства. Она разводит мелко - рогатый скот у себя дома. Ее муж хороший человек. Именно он помогает ей в продвижении ее деятельности. Мухайё увеличивает поголовья скота изо дня в день. Также она получает и продает козье молоко. Она просит кредит для закупа коз и двух овец. Мухайё ждет поддержки со стороны Кива и кредиторов Кива.
texts.en: Muhayyo was born in 1963 in Isfara.  She lives together with her husband, and they have one child.  Muhayyo is a successful and goal-oriented woman.  She happily lives with her husband.  Muhayyo has a rich experience in the animal husbandry field.  She breeds small livestock at home.  Her husband is a good person.  He helps her with moving her business forward.  Muhayyo is increasing her livestock headcount day-to-day.  She also obtains and sells goat milk.  She is requesting this loan to purchase goats and two sheep.  Muhayyo is awaiting the support from Kiva and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy goats and two sheep

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is 27 years old and single with one child aged three years. She has been into the retail shop and grocery business for three years, earning KES 22,000 monthly. This is Emily’s second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loan.

She will use the loan to purchase sugar, cooking fat, maize flour, some groceries and tea leaves for resale. She plans to plough the anticipated profits  back into her business. 

Her dream is to manage her business well and provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, cooking fat, maize flour and tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 32 years old and comes from Gaza. He is married and lives with his wife and two children.


Mahmoud has been working as a medical sales representative in a company and has owned a pharmacy for seven years and has two employees helping him. He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy an air conditioner, closets, and display cabinets for the pharmacy.

He wishes to develop his work and increase the amounts and kinds of medicine in the pharmacy and so improve his income.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner, closets and display cabinets for the pharmacy

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-year-old ambitious young man from Gaza. He has owned a clothing store for guys' wear for three years. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy an air conditioner, display shelves and some goods and clothes.

He hopes that by having this loan the amount of clothes displayed will increase and his income as well. He wishes to develop his work and initiate his own family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner, display shelves and some goods and clothes.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is thirty-eight years old and married with two children. He operates a pig farming business, and he has been in this business for nine years earning a monthly income of thirty-two thousand shillings.

This will be his fifth loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use it to purchase twenty-seven piglets for rearing and later sale. He plans to use the anticipated profit to invest back into the business.


He hopes to buy a dairy cow and supply milk to the village dairy in the future.

loans.use: to purchase  twenty-seven piglets.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
La señorita Milagros es socia del banco comunal “El Paraíso” del Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo.
Lleva cinco ciclos trabajando con los préstamos que Manuela Ramos que les da cada ciclo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda  mano, y lo hace en su misma casa, tiene la ayuda de su mamá quien vive con ella.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 15 camisas, 20 pantalones, 10 short, 10 blusas, 5 faldas, 10 polos, 10 pantalones para niños, 5 chompas, 2 casacas, 6 vestidos.
Con los ingresos de su negocio mantiene a su pequeño hijo y también puede ayudar a su mamá con algunos gastos básicos del hogar, esta agradecida con Manuela Ramos por brindarle los préstamo.
texts.en:
Milagros is a member of El Paraiso (The Paradise), a Communal Bank located in the Coronel Portillo district, in the De Ucayali department. She is 22 years old, she is single and she has one child.
She has been working five cycles with the loans she has received by Manuela Ramos. She sells used clothes ion her own house, and she is helped by her mother who lives with her in the same house.
With her new loan of 1,000.00 PEN she will buy 15 shirts, 20 trousers, 10 shorts, 10 blouses, 5 skirts, 10 polo shirts, 10 trousers for children, 5 sweaters, 2 zip jackets and 6 dresses.
With the earnings of her activity she provide for her young child, on top of helping her mother paying for some of the basic expenses of the house. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for having granted her the loan.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 36,750 pesos Carmen podrá comprar mercancía para ampliar el inventario de su tienda. Hace 2 años que Carmen comenzó a vender zapatos a sus amigas y vecinos cercanos, hasta que este fue creciendo y pudo instalar una tienda de ropas, zapatos y accesorios. Carmen es casada y tiene una niña de 3 años. 
El sueño de Carmen es tener su casa propia, por lo que cada dia se empeña en dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, para asegurar la fidelidad de los mismos en todo lo que dependa de ella.
texts.en:
With a loan of 36,750 pesos, Carmen will be able to buy merchandise to increase the inventory in her store.  Two years ago she started to sell shoes to her friends and neighbors.  Her business has grown to the point where she was able to open her own store for shoes, clothes and accessories.  

She is married and has a three-year-old daughter.  Her dream is to have her own home. To this end she strives every day to provide good service to her customers so that she can ensure their loyalty and that they come to her for all of their clothing needs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.ru:
Юрий занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельность в деревне Шишкерт, Сьюникского региона, на протяжении 10 лет.  Юрий разводит пчел, крупный рогатый скот, овец и кур. Также он выращивает овощи и фрукты. Продавая полученную сельскохозяйственную продукцию: мед, говядину, баранину, молоко, яйца, шерсть, овощи и фрукты, на рынке города Капана, Юрий имеет возможность содержать свою большую семью
Юрию 47 лет. Он получил специальность водителя в профтехучилище и, параллельно с сельскохозяйственной деятельностью, он работает водителем в одной из капанских организаций. Юрий женат и у него трое детей: сын и две дочери. Жена Юрия работает поваром в одной из капанских столовых, сын помогает отцу в ведении сельского хозяйства, старшая дочь работает в продавщицей в магазине, младшая дочь учится в колледже на связиста. Также с Юрием проживают его родители, которые по мере своих возможностей помогают ему в ведении сельского хозяйства.
Юрию необходим кредит на сумму 500.000 драмов, который он потратит на организацию работ по уборке сена и заготовку корма для скота. В частности он потратит деньги на покупку дизельного топлива, аренду сельскохозяйственной техники, покупку веревки для перевязки сена и т.д.
texts.en: Yuri has been involved in agricultural work in the Shishkert village of the Syunik region for ten years.  He keeps bees, cattle, sheep and chickens.  He also grows vegetables and fruits.  Selling the resulting products, such as honey, beef, lamb, milk, eggs, wool, vegetables and fruits, at the market of Kapan, allows Yuri to have the ability to support his large family.  Yuri is 47 years old.  He got a speciality of a driver at a technical college and works as a driver at one of the Kapan organizations parallel to his agricultural business.  Yuri is married and has three children: a son and two daughters.  His wife works as a cook at one of the Kapan cafes, his son helps the father with running the agricultural business, the oldest daughter works as a salesperson at a store, and the youngest attends a college to become a telecommunications worker.  Yuri's parents also live with him, and they help him to run the agricultural business within their abilities.  Yuri needs a loan in the amount of 500,000 dram to organize hay-gathering work and to prepare livestock feed.  He will spend this money partially on buying diesel fuel, leasing agricultural machinery, buying rope to tie the hay, etc.

loans.use: to organize hay-gathering work and to prepare livestock feed

loans.name: Sajjad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 20 years old, married, and he has two children.

Sajjad has owned a coffee shop since 2009, offering different types of beverages. He has sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation, and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2400 as youth loan to pay the annual rent for the shop and to buy a small generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop and to buy a small generator

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is 47 years old; she is married and lives in a small village of Mtskheta District with her family:  her husband Loseb and her mother-in-law, who is a pensioner. 

The family earns its living through an agricultural business. They have two milk cows and produce cheese. They sell cheese on the local open market. Along with the agricultural business, Loseb works in construction.  The family's average monthly income is 500 Lari -- which is hardly enough even for food for the family of three. 

Lela requested a loan to repair the bathroom. She will purchase construction materials and do the repair. It is very important for the family to improve the sanitary conditions in the house. With this loan, Lela will be able to improve living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her bathroom.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 27 years old, and married, with no children.

Haidar has owned a food market since 2008, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers.  He knows their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2,400 as youth loan in order to buy four refrigerators and expand his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy four refrigerators and expand his inventory.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge Alberto de 48 años de edad del municipio de chinandega, soltero, tiene por actividad economica una sala de belleza ubicada en su casa de habitacion desde hace 18 años,  herramienta de trabajo que inicio para tener una forma de subsistir, ya que no encontraba trabajo , y como habia sacado cursos  de belleza decidio aperturar su propio negocio en cual en la actulidad le ha sido muy rentable,  hoy en dia tiene mucho clientes fijos y eventuales, el fiananciamiento lo esta solicitando para comprar equipo de trabajo como: tijeras, peines, cremas de afeitar, secadoras, colonias, talcos, cuchillas, peinadores, entre otros.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto, age 48, lives in the town of Chinandega. He is single and has managed a beauty salon in his home for the past 18 years. Jorge started this business as a way of supporting himself since he did not have a job. He had taken beauty courses and then decided to open his own business, which has been very profitable. Today he has many established clients and walk-in customers.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy equipment for his work such as scissors, combs, shaving creams, dryers, colognes, powders, razors, barber capes, and other items.

loans.use: to buy scissors, combs, shaving creams, dryers, colognes, powders, razors, barber capes, and other items.

loans.name: Agripina
